story:
JOIN THE "IN CROWD" MOVEMENT 

We are looking for ALL of you… YOU who will never, ever, be in the IN CROWD to help us make a music video for this song.  
 
IN CROWD is all about standing up for the outcasts, the bullied, anyone who has ever felt like they don't fit in.  And it's about celebrating the different… and occasionally humorous… things that make us unique.
 
We've been so blown away by your response to this song, all the photos and comments you've been posting and emails you have sent us.  We believe more than ever that the world needs to hear this message.  So we're asking for you to help us make the best, most impacting music video we've ever released.  
 
WHAT ARE WE ASKING FOR?
 
We have developed some crazy cool ideas for this video and put together a budget with an LA-based crew who will produce the clip for us.  It's not a huge budget compared to the $500,000+ spent on most major-label videos, but we are confident for that $15,000 we can create something we can all be proud of, that you will want to share with your friends, and will encourage so many people who feel "out" of the crowd.
 
We need you guys to donate whatever you can afford - from $10 to $10,000.  There are a bunch of different incentives listed in the side column… we're super excited about the T-shirt design using all the IN CROWD photos and images you've been sending us.  And there are some other fun ones there too:  try your hand as Band Stylist, bring a Ruckus House Party to your place, or get some friends together and encourage one of your mates by giving them a day On Tour with us!
 
WHAT ELSE CAN YOU DO?
 
No money?  Already donated and don't know what to do next?  We want as many people as possible to hear about this song, this video, this movement.  Please share our project page on your Facebook, Twitter, email your friends… And we have the IN CROWD (live) download still available absolutely free at www.raptureruckus.com
 
#NeverGonnaBeInTheInCrowd

story:
Who We Are...

If you don't allready know, Crash Endings is a three piece Rock 'n' Roll band from Denver Colorado. Each member playing music locally for two decades, we are three individuals that are passionate about music. We have been playing together for a little over 2 years and feel as though we have put together a collection of 8 songs that will rock your balls off.

Why We Need Your Help...

Music truly is the universal language and art is the foundation of the soul. By supporting local music and art you are contributing to a better world. This contribution will help us fund a project that we are also putting our own money into and will help us to produce a final product that, again, will rock your balls off.

We are asking for $1,500 to help with the costs of recording. Every donation is important and every dollar we get will be going towards making this the best recording that we have ever done within our 20 years in music.

What You Get...

We have put together some unique packages to include you in this project...

 

We Couldn't Do It Without You...

Even if you can't afford to make a donation, you can help us out with emailing our campaign message to 5 of your friends.

Investing in our campaign is a great way to support local music, a great way to support music and a great way to support art.  So, be a part of Rock 'n' Roll history and show us some love...

 

Peace, CE

 photos by: Chip Smith

story:
Blessings to our family and friends. Thank you for clicking to check out our camaign. 
WE WANT TO MAKE A NEW MUSIC VIDEO! 
 
Allow me to introduce you to the internationally celebrated Hip Hop/Reggae/Dub-Step Collective, Noble Society .  With a message of Peace and Powerful Painful Music , Noble Society has began their rise into the mainstream after years of fan-supported popularity within the underground Reggae and Dancehall communities.  The members hail from Switzerland, Guiana, and Jamaica now all residing in Brooklyn, NY making for a new blend of WORLD MUSIC with Hip Hop/Reggae/Dub-Step/Dancehall. 
 
“Noble Society harkens back to a time when the term ‘hip hop meets dancehall meant more than slapping Sean Paul on a remix."
                                                           ––The Village Voice.
 
Group Members: 
Jahdan Blakkamore - Singer/Songwriter 
Delie Red X - Emcee/Songwriter 
Fuego Campo - Production, Flamenco Guitar, DJ, Percussion 
D2- Emcee/Songwriter 
 
2012 brought French attention to NS's PPM album with a full sold out tour presented by X-Ray Records of Paris.
 
"#1 Reggae Album on iTunes" - Noble Society's Take Charge 2008 
"#1 Reggae Album on iTunes" - Noble Society's Jahdan Blakkamoore Babylon Nightmare 
Nominated Best Reggae Group of the Year 2012 - AIRM Awards February 2012 
Nominated Best Reggae Artist of the Year 2012 - Jahdan Blakkamoore of Noble Society AIRM Awards February 2012 
 
Snoop Lion "Reincarnated"- Jahdan Blakkamoore of Noble Society was invited to Tuff Gong Studios to co-write the highly anticipated Snoop Dogg project, with also featuring on three of the singles.  http://largeup.okayplayer.com/?s=noble+society+
 
2013 Release | PPM The Rolaz Remix album | Manchester's Colin Rolaz Nisbett has taken Powerful Painful Music to new heights.  
2013 Release | Subatomic Sounds Release of PPM 'Living the Life' Remix EP- Emch, Fuego, Rolaz team up for a 5 version release of Living The Life off of PPM
2013 Release | Snoop Lion Reincarnated 
2013 Release | Live Large Music Video, a follow up to our hit single "4 Life" which gained attention from Universal Records 
 

Paris-based X Ray Production release of French sensation Dancehall artist, Biga Ranx,REMIX album, On Time, featuring Delie Red X of Noble Society.http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q1pNHJteF


Video Links: 

  • '4 Life' - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SBJJ1Yaq9TQ
  • 'New Day' http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kK9fiCSKDjc
  • Accoustic Feature on Metric 9 TV http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bcSmQDqyNPY
  • PPM Teaser- http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RydDOmwv2QY
  • Accoustic Feature on Metric 9 TV 2 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w9njQQUe0WA 
  • Rip Off http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fDDAMF9Rlcg

“Deeply satisfying reggae/ hip hop fusion from Brooklyn…Always precise and swinging.”  

                                                                                                                             –Tokion Magazine

story:
Short Summary

We're creating SONICBOOST STUDIO, a high quality home recording studio where local artists can create a quality album at an affordable rate.  We need your help to make it possible to keep our rates very low and help to foster the local music scene.

My name is Eric Myers.  I manage a high end recording studio here in Raleigh, NC - www.puremixstudios.com

The rates at PureMix are already pretty reasonable considering the level of quality we provide.  The room there was designed by Wes Lachot, and we have an SSL console, as well as a pile of incredible outboard gear.  However, there are still many artists who can't afford even our deepest discounted rate of $50/hr at PureMix.

SONICBOOST STUDIO will exist in the basement of my home where we can help musicians create music with some very good equipment and skilled engineers starting at $25/hr!

REWARDS

  • T-Shirts!
  • STUDIO TIME!  We think this is pretty genius.   We are also making studio time available as a reward.  Even if you are not interested in the studio time, you could buy some studio time and donate THAT to an artist you believe in!

We already have the equipment needed to record, edit and mix great sounding albums because of the generosity of our partner studio PureMix Studios.  We are thinking of SONICBOOST STUDIO as sort of a "B" room for PureMix.  We are keeping the overhead extremely low by building out a room in our basement, and we are also able utilize the portable equipment that we use for our "on location" recordings as the majority of the platform for SONICBOOST STUDIO.

In order to keep our rates low, we need your help with final construction costs in order to finish the basement area in such a way that the rooms will be isolated from each other and to create an acoustically appropriate environment for tracking and some light duty mixing.

Final mixes for larger budget projects can always be completed at PureMix, but for demo budget projects we will need to make the acoustics in the environment at SONICBOOST STUDIO correct enough to complete a demo quality mix.

We need to raise a minimum of $5000 to complete construction here in the basement for approximately 300 square feet of space to isolate from the upper floor, stud the walls, install electrical, HVAC, and electrical work.  Some of this work has already been completed, and the money we raise through this project will complete the remaining construction tasks.

If we "overfund" through this Kickstarter we will put the additional funds towards additional studio equipment to expand our capabilities.

Remaining budget needs breakdown:
  • Electrical - $750
  • Framing/Insulation - $2000
  • Drywall/Painting/Flooring/Finishing (doors/light fixtures etc) - $2250

The Impact

Your donation will be like a scholarship fund for many local artists helping to keep our hourly rate costs WAY down.  There are already many artists and bands lined up and waiting to take advantage of our low rates and expertise.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to give PLEASE help by sharing the links and spreading the word.  Use the Indiegogo SHARE tools!  Tell a friend personally about it.  Talk about it over lunch tomorrow!

story:
I'm TUNEDEF, an EDM producer/college student. I've been producing since mid-2010, and my music is slowly catching on. I can only consider it a hobby of mine though, as I haven't made a dime since I started.

As I start to expand my audience and plan to make my first EP, I need to upgrade my equipment (which currently consists of only a budget computer and headphones), as it is becoming a hindrance to my ability to produce. That's where you (hopefully) step in!

story:
How Did We Get Here? 

Straw & Hay is a raw, two-piece band that originates from Lexington, Ky. The band consists of Shane Allan Smith and Joshua Hollis Doss and started from a urge and need to play "loud" music. After one jam session it was evident that it was a start of a beautiful friendship and passionate tunes. One year later Straw & Hay is going to be miles apart with Shane moving to PHILADELPHIA for grad school, and Josh is staying in Lexington to finish up obtaining his undergrad degree. The reason this campaign is so important is due to the fact that Straw & Hay will be on hiatus for awhile and this collection of songs entitled, "Princess Motel" was recorded with the sole purpose of keeping the music alive for the time being. The ten song album is tentatively scheduled to be released on September 1st with help from our fans!  

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET:

Over the past year Straw & Hay have worked extremely hard in writing music that is very personal and dear to both. Much has gone on and hard times produce beautiful art and we want to be able to share and hopefully inspire others. In order for this project to be completed we need help to do so. With Shane and Josh both in college and the high expenses of mastering and producing a record it is necessary and unfortunate that we must ask and reach out to all of you for help. With a goal of $1,000 we intend to be able to fund the production and mastering costs associated with producing an album, the album which was recorded in two long nights is all but finished with only the mastering and production to be completed. 

However through your help you will not be left empty handed  Through some of the perks we have made available and the wonderful ability of Shane Smith to create not only music, but imaginative and beautiful art there are some very fine objects to be earned. Whether it's the limite edition art prints and t-shirts hand designed by Shane, personalized covers or songs or just a plain ole copy of the album we hope that there is something for you! We also will take any recommendations that might be unique to you and not listed as a perk but there are always exceptions! 

The Impact of Helping Straw & Hay Finish "PRINCESS MOTEL":

With this album so near and dear to our hearts we really hope that not only is this completing an album but it's helping Shane and Josh reach their dream of finishing an album that has taken a lot of hard work and late nights to record. It will also help to set in stone a piece of work that will hold as a bridge between Shane and Josh's hiatus and hopefully the next step in furthering our love of music. We hope you will find the same joy in this project that we have found and that you will find a way to help us complete our dream! 

Other Ways You Can Help:

We also encourage you to help spread the word and to get the word out on the streets about this project. Even if you have no means to donate (which we totally understand) you can still tell others and help get the campaign out to the masses. Any way you may feel the need or desire to help we beyond appreciate  So with that being said thank you and may God Bless you! 

Stay tuned for more updates on the progress.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Umculo's 2013 Fairy Queen

www.capefestival.com

Umculo/ Cape Festival is an international organisation that supports lasting social change through opera in South Africa. Our dedicated team of top professionals donates its time and effort to a project to which all of us are passionately committed. We believe that the future of opera can be found in South Africa.

Singing is part of everyday life in South Africa - more than anywhere else in the world. Thousands of choirs in schools, churches, community halls and even prisons bear living witness to this tradition.

This is the starting-point for Umculo, a name which means both music and reconciliation. 

Our team organises workshops in Township schools.  Scenic interpretation is the decisive step towards more self-awareness and social consciousness; both sides learn equally from encounter and exchange.

The highlight each year is a full opera production with young South African singers and musicians and a choir from the Townships. 

We urgently need your support for this unique project.

Our project already receives generous support from the Hilti Foundation and the Goethe Institut.  But neither organisation is able to cover all of our costs, and we urgently need an extra EURO 25 000 in the next three weeks to enable our opera to reach the stage.

We believe that Umculo can achieve in opera a revolution comparable to that of Venezeula's El Sistema for the symphony orchestra.  With the right support, we can grow and expand.  Not only can we touch hundreds of thousands of young lives in South Africa; we can also help the rest of the world to learn from South Africa just how much social impact can be achieved when opera is conceived as participation and grown from communities.  

Who are we?

Umculo's 2013 Fairy Queen team includes:

- Founder and director Shirley Apthorp, Cape Town-born music journalist for the Financial Times;

- Baritone Njabulo Madlala, winner of the 2010 Kathleen Ferrier Award;

- Catherine Milliken, head of the Berlin Philharmonic's education programme from 2005 to 2012;

- German stage director Robert Lehmeier;

- Award-winning costume designer Thando Lobese;

- Violinist Stefano Pagliano, concertmaster of the orchestra of the orchestra of La Scala, Milan;

- Vienna-based conductor Warwick Stengards;

- Education team: Ntando Cele, Lea Heinrich, Marion Haak

- The choir of Bloekombos Secondary School, conducted by Siyabulela Sulelo;

- Singers Angela Kerrison, July Zuma, Mlamli Lalapantsi, Melissa Gerber, Sandile Mabaso, Ronald Paseka, and Brenda Thulo

- Production team Tatjana Dachsel, Laura Ellersdorfer, Michael Maxwell.

What We Need & What You Get

The EURO 25000 we need is essential for providing transport and school lunches for workshop participants. Our education workshops, which build tomorrow's opera audiences, give talented young singers a first-hand understanding of performance, and build social skills, are absolutely fundamental to Umculo's aims.  The funds will also cover transport and daily costs for our young orchestra members and chorus.

By supporting us, you become part of this exciting new venture.

Depending on the size of your donation, you can secure your own tickets to our performances, original photographs of the performance, an individually-designed photo book of the production, a Fairy Queen t-shirt, a poster, and/ or an exclusive invitation to attend our closing party.

If we do not meet our full goal, we will still provide as many workshops as possible.

The Impact

Over the three years since it was founded, Umculo has reached hundreds of young South Africans and gained international press attention and financial support.  We believe opera can change lives, and our young participants are the living testimony to this fact. Opera develops self-awareness and social consciousness, and provides a vital aesthetic experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help with a donation, please help us by telling everyone you know about this campaign!

If you're interested in volunteering, please contact us on info@capefestival.com

The highlight each year is a full opera production with young South African singers and musicians and a choir from the Townships. 
We urgently need your support for this unique project.
Our project already receives generous support from the Hilti Foundation and the Goethe Institut.  But neither organisation is able to cover all of our costs, and we urgently need an extra EURO 25 000 in the next three weeks to enable our opera to reach the stage.
We believe that Umculo can achieve in opera a revolution comparable to that of Venezeula's El Sistema for the symphony orchestra.  With the right support, we can grow and expand.  Not only can we touch hundreds of thousands of young lives in South Africa; we can also help the rest of the world to learn from South Africa just how much social impact can be achieved when opera is conceived as participation and grown from communities.  
Who are we?
Umculo's 2013 Fairy Queen team includes:
- Founder and director Shirley Apthorp, Cape Town-born music journalist for the Financial Times;
- Baritone Njabulo Madlala, winner of the 2010 Kathleen Ferrier Award;
- Catherine Milliken, head of the Berlin Philharmonic's education programme from 2005 to 2012;
- German stage director Robert Lehmeier;
- Award-winning costume designer Thando Lobese;
- Violinist Stefano Pagliano, concertmaster of the orchestra of the orchestra of La Scala, Milan;
- Vienna-based conductor Warwick Stengards;
- Education team: Ntando Cele, Lea Heinrich, Marion Haak
- The choir of Bloekombos Secondary School, conducted by Siyabulela Sulelo;
- Singers Angela Kerrison, July Zuma, Mlamli Lalapantsi, Melissa Gerber, Sandile Mabaso, Ronald Paseka, and Brenda Thulo
- Production team Tatjana Dachsel, Laura Ellersdorfer, Michael Maxwell.


What We Need & What You Get
The EURO 25000 we need is essential for providing transport and school lunches for workshop participants. Our education workshops, which build tomorrow's opera audiences, give talented young singers a first-hand understanding of performance, and build social skills, are absolutely fundamental to Umculo's aims.  The funds will also cover transport and daily costs for our young orchestra members and chorus.
By supporting us, you become part of this exciting new venture.
Depending on the size of your donation, you can secure your own tickets to our performances, original photographs of the performance, an individually-designed photo book of the production, a Fairy Queen t-shirt, a poster, and/ or an exclusive invitation to attend our closing party.
If we do not meet our full goal, we will still provide as many workshops as possible.


The Impact
Over the three years since it was founded, Umculo has reached hundreds of young South Africans and gained international press attention and financial support.  We believe opera can change lives, and our young participants are the living testimony to this fact. Opera develops self-awareness and social consciousness, and provides a vital aesthetic experience.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't help with a donation, please help us by telling everyone you know about this campaign!

If you're interested in volunteering, please contact us on info@capefestival.com

story:
Gamechanger II: Spring Tour 2013 - Berlin, London, and Holland

Tour Details:

Who: Norman Vladimir

What: Spring European Tour 2013

Where: Berlin,  London, Amsterdam/The Hague/Rotterdam

When: April 18th - May 10th

Websites: www.normanvladimir.com

 

Press:

- CBS News: http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-207_162-57569663/norman-vladimir-a-pop-soul-artist-with-depressingly-hopeful-lyrics/

- Ebony Magazine: http://www.ebony.com/video/entertainment-culture/introducing-norman-vladimir-video-888#axzz2NKwVjBg8
- Hemelbestormers show for Radio 2 - Netherlands (was live interviewed from New York): https://soundcloud.com/normanvladimir/no-more-obligations-performed

 

As you know, I'm a guy from a small town in Tennessee who had the crazy idea to pursue a music career in NYC. This journey has brought me some wonderful experiences/memories: sharing the stage with people like Norah Jones, John Forte, Me'Shell Ndegeocello; becoming the lead singer for world-renown director/choreographer Bill T. Jones and performing his tribute at the Kennedy Center for Pres. Barack Obama, First Lady Michelle Obama, Oprah, Paul McCartney, et al, touring cities in the U.S. and Europe, landing singing for a national commercial, getting features about my music on CBS News, in Ebony Magazine, and working with some of the most talented singers/songwriters and musicians in NYC.

 

As they say, half of being lucky is just being there...

 

Since my tour in Europe last Summer (Berlin, Cologne, Brussels, London, Paris, Den Haag & Amsterdam), I've been getting messages and calls  asking me when I would be able to come back to Europe to begin moving forward with opportunities to grow my career. Meetings with publishing companies, licensing companies, booking agents, and more recently, club managers, radio stations, and festival managers have all surfaced and I just need to be there to make things happen.

 

It's time to build on this momentum. I've been doing so much of it on my own, and I'm thankful for that because I've grown so much, and I thank you for all your support, too. But, I'm now at the point in my career where I need to build my team (booking agent, manager, publishing, record label, distribution, etc) ; I need to solidify my ground game to spread my music & expand my reach (street teams, local booking & cross-pollinating for events and causes); and I need it to be global because if given the proper chance, I know my music can connect people, it can give context, it can unify, it can be fun, and it can allow us to open up a little bit more - that's my vision for my career...and here's how you can help.

 

What You Get:

Largest overall gift: 2 hour songwriting session with me.

 - $10-$24: My eternal gratitude!

- $25-$49: Exclusive access to the NV Club where you will be the first to see updates/content/posts from my tour.

 ***All gifts $25 and above will be put in the NV Club and receive access to exclusive content***

 **************************************************************

 - $50-$99: 1 NV Club T-shirt

- $100-$199: Personalized postcard from my tour

- $200-$299: gift: Exclusive unreleased TRACK from my show at The Living Room originally aired on XM/Sirius Radio.

- $300-$399: Exclusive Live FULL SHOW Recording from The Living Room originally aired on XM/Sirius Radio. Includes unreleased tracks!

- $400-$500: 1 hour singing lesson with me. (If you are outside of NYC, then we can arrange either a Skype or a Google Hangout.)

 

Funding packages:

- Cover cost of CDs/Promo materials: Free download and physical signed copy of my first EP "SOUNDS".

- Cover cost of Amsterdam leg: 45 minute Skype session with me + a 4 song liveperformance. We can chat, laugh, and share some music. $920

 

- Cover cost of both Berlin legs:  45 minute Skype session with me + a 4 song performance. We can chat, laugh, and share some music. $1040

 

- Cover cost of London leg: Private, in-home/in-apt 1 hour performance in the NYC metro area with you and a group of your friends. (Note: If outside of NYC, cost of travel and stay will need to be covered.) $1300

 

 The Breakdown:

 Total funding request: $5000

 Summary: $1100 (flight*) + $480(Berlin #1) + $1300 (London) + $920 (Amsterdam) + $560 (Berlin #2) + $640 (300 CDs/Promo**) = $5,000

 *Note: Cost of roundtrip flight to Berlin: $900 + $200 (includes travel to and from airport + cost of baggage) = $1100

**CDs/Promo materials = Quote from DiscMakers CD Duplication company = $640

 

 The Tour:

 Berlin: April 18th stay to April 21st:

- Estimated cost: 4($60 (housing per day) + $60 (food, metro, etc per day)) = $480

 

London: April 22th – April 28th:

- Train to London: $250

- Estimated cost for leg: 7($75 (housing per day + $75 (food, metro, etc per day)) = $1,050

- Total: $250 + $1,050 = $1,300

 

Amsterdam: April 29th to May 6th :

- Train to Amsterdam: $200

- Estimated cost for leg: 6($60 (housing per day) + $60 (food, metro, etc per day)) = $720

- Total: $200 + $720 = $920

 

 Berlin (return): May 7th to May 10th:

- Train to Berlin: $200

- Estimated cost for leg: 3($60 (housing per day) + 60 (food, metro, etc per day)) = $360

- Total: $200 + $360 = $560

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Since I know/understand that there are causes we believe in, there are other ways to help out

 Social Media:

 - Twitter: Tweet using BOTH my twitter handle (@normanvladimir) AND the hashtag "#NVTOUR2013" to answer trivia questions or to re-tweet posts from my tour. There will be prizes awarded to the first person who answers correctly, and there will be a prize for the person who tweets/re-tweets me the most during my tour!

 - Facebook: Tell your friends on FB to like my fan page (www.facebook.com/normanvladimir) by posting and hyperlinking my page and their page and including the hashtag #NVTOUR2013. Ex: "Hey @bobjones, you gotta like @NormanVladimir on FB! He's the cat's pajamas. #NVTOUR2013". Whoever posts the most of these during my tour will get a personal shoutout video and blog post!

story:
Hola!

Welcome! 
I am very thankful for the time you are spending reading this.

My name is Moana Avvenenti. I am a 23-year old singer and songwriter from Saint-Martin, Caribbean. In 2009, I moved to Boston, Massachusetts to attend Berklee College of Music. In my 7 semesters there, I studied with some of the best faculty in the world, and I worked with the most gifted musicians I had ever met. After graduating, and years of performing in cover bands, I am finally focusing on my career as an original artist.

Throughout the past 4 years, I have confectioned many songs, and I have selected 13 of them that I am now hoping to bring to life. 
Each song reflects the uniqueness of my cultural background from a different light. And in addition to my own experiences, the talented multi-cultural musicians that I'm working with (Berklee faculty, students and alumni from all over the world) are helping to bring even more variety and colors to my music! 
Now, the time has come to record and assemble these pieces of music into an album.

So, let's attack this project from the problematic part. 
$10,000!?!?! 
Yes, you read that right. 
I know this may seem like a magnanimous sum at first. Trust me, that’s how I felt, too! 
But if you break it down like I did with my production team, you'll come to realize that we actually cut down on a lot of expenses.

Here's where the money will go:

Studio: $1500
Musicians: $3500
Production: $3500 
Manufacturing/Distribution: $1500

As an artist, depending on this much money to create my project is not a comfortable feeling. 
It is scary to think that my art could never be born because of economical reasons.

This is why I need your help.
But not only your financial contribution:
I want to add you and your own colors to the team, too!

Once you are on board, I will send you videos, photos and messages throughout the whole process, to ask you for your advice and feedback.
Your opinion will be considered for every step and every decision, and you will get access to the behind the scenes of how to make an album. 
We will film just about everything, so it will be like you are there with us along the way!

The more people that I get to be involved in this, the more chances I have to record the album, but also to make it a good one, at that!

We can only make this together! 
Then, you can tell your grandchildren how you have taken part into the making of a record.

Thank you so very much. Every bit helps and I am completely and whole-heartdely appreciative of every act of generosity.

story:
Bands and solo acts comprised of Marin middle and high school aged musicians will be playing a concert to raise funds for the Red Cross/Hurricane Sandy Relief effort.

The event will take place at  The Marin Country Mart in Larkspur, CA on November 30th, 2012 from 5-7:30 pm

Each performer will be asking family, friends, and others to sponsor them for their performances.  Those unable to attend but who are interested in sponsoring the performers are encouraged to donate to the relief effort via this site.

We will also be collecting donations at the event.  So come out and enjoy good food from all the restaurants and great music by local, young musicians. 

Thanks to the Marin Country Mart for hosting this important and fun event.

story:
Dear Supporters,

I have embarked on a very monumental journey in my life. I have decided to start my solo music project in hopes of branching out and making a successful career out of the music I make. One of the first steps on this journey is recording the material I have written. I have decided to work with Ethan Kaufmann in Los Angeles, California to record this new EP and distribute it to all of you beautiful people. However, this process does not come at a low cost. Being that I must travel to Los Angeles and spend quite a lot of money during the recording process, I will need a lot of financial support to make the project successful. I would be so incredibly appreciative for anybody that could contribute financially to this project, even if just one dollar. As you can see, there are rewards depending on the amount of money you donate. This opportunity is a dream come true for me, and to have all of my supporters involved in the process would mean the absolute world.

Thank you for your support,

Michael McQuaid

story:
The Music Video

The song "Daddy's Girl" is about a girl's experience of her father leaving her, among other things. The video will not necessarily interpret that experience exactly, but will instead concentrate on the theme of abandonment. 

The video centres around two girls on the brink of adolescence. All on their own, the girls drift through abandoned drive-ins, play baseball in empty parks, make pets out of 'live bait' worms, and allow themselves to become hypnotized by race cars circling around a track. After all their wandering, they finally arrive at the water - the edge of the world - at sunset. Here they meet Falcon Jane who adorns them with floral crowns and warrior paint. Together they play along the shoreline until the sun sets, bringing their last day of childhood freedom to a close before the reality of adulthood sets in.

 

About Falcon Jane & Take Off

Released on October 19th was Falcon Jane’s full-length album Take Off, which is a beautiful mix of rhythms that draws you in and does not disappoint. Ms. Jane describes the album as being about “loss in all its forms. It’s about running away from both the good and the bad. I tried to take all the negative feelings I had of fear, hatred, loneliness, worthlessness, and abandonment, turn them into something positive through music, and distance myself from them.” Take Off is a haunting assortment of sounds, lyrics and raw emotions that will have listeners enter into a dreamlike world of storytelling. It’s a simple yet dynamic mixture of talent from Hayden Farrar on bass and Laura Conning singing backing vocals. Described by Ms. Falcon Jane herself: “My music is a way for me to capture the present and all the emotions, happenings and bullshit that seems to go along with it and to preserve it so that it can be interpreted and understood by those who care to listen.”

 

For more information please visit:

http://music.cbc.ca/#/artists/Falcon-Jane
 
https://www.facebook.com/FalconJane

story: The New Direction, Fargo’s premier all ages music venue is launching a campaign called “We Are The New Direction” to fund improvements to the space. Opened in 2011, TND has hosted well over 100 all-ages events for the Fargo/ Moorhead arts community. The venue is not for profit, with every dollar made being used to pay bills, make general improvements and, most importantly, pay local and touring artists. The We Are The New Direction campaign aims to make improvements that are out of reach with the monthly income alone. It also aims to give the community a sense of ownership in the space, that it is a space for everyone to enjoy no matter what walk of life you come from. Central to the Campaign is a fundraising drive through IndieGoGo.  We aim to raise at least $2,000 through the site to improve the sound system, concert area, and general look of the space. Some of the highlights include new speakers, a new logo, and a redesigned stage. As an incentive/ reward for donating, contributors will get their name on a wall of support at the venue. If they pledge enough they will also receive a tee shirt commemorating their contribution. The drive will run from June 20th to July 31st. More information on The New Direction and events held there can be found at the venue’s Facebook page, their website listed below, or by emailing newdirectionfargo@gmail.com.

story:
Introduction

My name is Jesse Atkinson and I am the CEO of Urban Threshold Inc and I am the author of the critically acclaimed book "The Independent Music Grind." Equally important, I am the co-founder of the Underground Music Awards, which has become the biggest national award show for independent urban music artists. The Underground Music Awards were created to acknowledge and honor the achievements and contributions of independent artists & producers within the urban music scene. 

After 10 successful years, Urban Threshold Enterprises Inc. continues to make it our top priority to bring together music professionals, artists, DJ's, fans, media outlets and more to network, build relationships and celebrate the culture of independent urban music. Past winners of the UMA's include Nicki Minaj, MGK, Maino, Cory Gunz, Papoose, Fred The Godson and so many others. 

Not only do we pay homage to the future stars, we also honor the legends in the Urban Music genre. Past Honorees of Urban Threshold's Underground Music Awards include: Ice T, Naughty By Nature, DJ Marley Marl, The Force MD's, EPMD, Kid Capri, MOP, Slick Rick, Run DMC, Whoodini, and many more.
In the previous years this event has been covered by such prestigious press as MTV, XXL, AllHipHop.com, Thisis50.com, The Village Voice, and more.

Rap Legends Whodini Receive The Icons Award at the Underground Music Awards

THE MAGNITUDE OF YOUR SUPPORT NEEDED TO CREATE THIS EVENT:

The underground is what keeps Hip Hop alive. The underground is what keeps Hip Hop leveled. We have dedicated ourselves to bridging the gap between the unsigned artist and the music industry. Your contribution will assist us in taking the Underground Music Awards to another level. 

We would greatly appreciate a donation to help us honor the future stars and legends of the urban music genre . In return for your generosity, we are able to provide various different benefits to you such as a copy of the critically acclaimed book "The Independent Music Grind," tickets to the 2014 UMA's and more.

Hip Hop Titan Styles P receives The People's Choice Award At The UMA's

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking your assistance to complete a total funding of $20,000 for the 2014 Underground Music Awards event, which is scheduled to take place September 21, 2014 in NYC. Here’s what your contribution will go towards:

  • Venue rental fee: BB Kings in Times square, NYC
  • Printed Program Booklets
  • Step n Repeat (print & delivery)
  • Production of Awards/Trophies 
  • Additional Security
  • Flyers
  • VIP invites for music executives

Rapstress Remy Martin Wins Big at The Underground Music Awards

The Impact

Every year there are incredible records released by independent labels and artists. Very rarely do the institutional accolades of the music industry reach or embrace the independent music community of artists and fans who now represent 32% of all global music sales. Hence, the Underground Music Awards Program was born to fill that void.

We encourage community awareness, artistry enrichment, family responsibility & we teach the importance of maintaining stable business relationships. For over 10 years, Urban Threshold has provided valuable services to educate, energize and inspire independent music artists and producers. 

We hope that you understand and support our vision by helping us to fund the 2014 Underground Music Awards.

Rap Superstar Nicki Minaj Won The Award For Female Artist of The Year at The 2008 UMA's and then Signed to Young Money a year later.


Challenges

Our mission is to continue to present the Underground Music Awards on a major platform. The urban independent music community deserves that. We plan on presenting the 2014 UMA's at The legendary BB Kings concert hall in the heart of Times Square, NYC. BB Kings is an amazing venue. However, it is also a very expensive venue. Right now, funding the rental of the BB Kings Concert Hall is our biggest challenge. We are targeting a myriad of potential sponsors to help to underwrite the costs. However, we do need the support of the many fans and artists of the urban music community to make the 2014 Underground Music Awards a success.

    Rap Star Maino, Jesse Jess and the legendary DJ Kay Slay at UMA's

    Other Ways You Can Help

    For those of you who can't contribute financially, please help by getting the word out about our campaign for the 2014 Underground Music Awards. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Welcome to the AndyRooniverse!

"This is children's music that will not make you want to put your head under a truck tire. Totally recommended for parents." 
-Shea Serrano, Houston Press

My name is Andrew Karnavas and I write music for kids as AndyRoo and the AndyRooniverse. I believe that kids need a soundtrack for their childhood that is fun, educational, and engaging, and that parents should be able to listen to that soundtrack and sing along without losing their minds. Join AndyRoo on a musical journey to a magical place created by the ever-expanding landscape of children’s imaginations and featuring characters like Podgy the Platypus, Sy the Sloth, JoJo the Monkey, and more, illustrated by Grace Rodriguez. 

  • My passions in life are performance, songwriting, recording, and education. The Color Your World Album and Activity Book combine all of those passions to present a multi-media, multi-sensory experience to kids.
  • For five years, I have been writing all kinds of songs across three music projects and touring nationwide. I absolutely love performing and writing music for kids. I have an independent record label called Yawp Records. 
  • With your support, the AndyRooniverse will encourage good habits and playfulness while introducing kids to a variety of musical genres worldwide.
  • The world and its music belong to everyone, and together we can make it a magical place. 

Your Dollars in Action.

We are seeking $8000 to cover:

  • Color Your World CD and activity book pressing
  • A three-month national publicity campaign with kids music publicity specialist Elizabeth Waldman Frazier of Waldmania PR
  • Touring and Distribution 
  • If we do not reach the entire goal, we will have to scale back our publicity and touring budgets for a more abbreviated release, but we would really like to avoid having to do that because we have a such a strong team ready to spread the word. This will be my fifth full-length album and my second AndyRooniverse album, and I can tell you from experience that it takes a village to handle the booking, distribution, publicity, and tour management.

Let's Build the AndyRooniverse Together.

In 2011, I recorded the first AndyRooniverse album with my own money and did all of my own publicity and booking. I worked two jobs and I spent everything I had traveling to places on tour when I couldn't afford it because I knew the hard work and sacrifice would pay off, and it did with shows at the Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History in Washington D.C. and an opening slot for Trombone Shorty at SXSW for the PBS Kids party. I have laid the foundation, and with your help we can build the rest of the AndyRooniverse together. I already have some wonderful tour dates on the calendar, and your support will create even more opportunities for kids everywhere. 

The past few years of traveling and singing have been some of the best years of my life. Here are some kind words from around the country:

  • “The energetic debut album from AndyRoo is bursting with imagination and creativity. AndyRoo’s extensive music background provides a solid basis for an album that can be enjoyed by the entire family, over and over again!”

    - Lauren Ramsey, Radio Host, Radio Disney AM 1590

  • “AndyRoo’s music inspires children’s imagination. They were hopping on imaginary hopscotches, brushing their teeth, and swinging through the trees like chimpanzees. Their smiling faces showed the joy that AndyRoo’s music can bring.”

    -Cara Clark, Discovery Room Coordinator, Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History 

  • “The AndyRooniverse is a constellation of luminous songs and cosmic experiences.  With every single stroke of his guitar, Andy takes you on a transcendental journey of his unbounded imagination.  His music is capable of enlightening a kid’s universe or anyone’s for that matter.”

    -Henry Yau, PR and Promotions Director, Children’s Museum of Houston 


Other Ways You Can Help.

Besides donations, there are a number of ways to help with the campaign:

Use the Indiegogo share tools on the page to share the campaign on your favorite social media platform. I am very active on Twitter andFacebook.

Take a look at the show calendar on http://www.andyrooniverse.com

Have an idea for a great incentive for this campaign? Send me a comment on this page or email me at andyroo@andyrooniverse.com 

Thank you for your support!


Color Your World, 


AndyRoo

story:
Hey everyone,

I hope that video made you smile, its pretty amazing the effect that music can have on us. My name is Chris Britton, I'm a 23 year old artist living in Toronto, and that was a clip from a fundraising event that my former saxophone quartet performed at.

Ever since the first day I walked into my middle-school music class, I've been playing the saxophone. Saxophone has afforded me many great opportunities and offered me the pleasure of meeting and performing for/with so many great people that it has become arguably the most important part of my life. I play everyday, have studied in university and have many commitments that are dependent on me having my saxophones (gigs, ensembles, recordings, etc...) so without them my life is in for a big change.

With that said, about two weeks ago, a Toronto taxi driver made off with not one but TWO saxophones in his trunk. I tried to give the benefit of the doubt and believe that it was an accident, however after a week of following up with; every major taxi company, police, city of Toronto, and local music stores etc... the worst has happened and they are gone.

These horns are irreplaceable (one of them is vintage....)  to me as I've spent the last 10 years of my life developing my sound and familiarity with it. However playing is far to an important part of my life to give up, so with your help I'm hoping to make a dent in my losses and get playing again.

That taxi made off with $7500 worth of my gear. And being recently out of university and making my way in the working world, trying to recover from a blow like that seems daunting if not impossible.

The major loss of the whole situation is the fact that the one of the two horns stolen was on loan to me from a good friend and colleague of mine. That's where you guys come in! I'm hoping to raise $1500 to put a down payment on a new saxophone for him. He is also an active musician now without the tool of his trade, thus any funds raised will go towards purchasing my colleague a new horn to replace his lost one.

If in the future the saxophones are located and returned all proceeds from this fundraiser will be donated to "Keys to the Studio" - a fantastic music program designed for individuals with developmental disabilities.
Read more about them here:
http://keystothestudio.com/

Alright.... And what are you going to get out of this? Well, seeing as I'm already in the hole pretty deep I've got to get creative for you. When I'm not playing the saxophone I'm the pastry-chef / line-cook at an upscale Latin nightclub and I would be more than happy to put my skills to work for you. I've got everything from dinner to dessert up for grabs as well as a few band freebies!

Please help keep our bands alive! Check out a few of the musical acts you will be supporting:

Yasgur's Farm - https://www.facebook.com/pages/Yasgurs-Farm/150968730727

The Back 40 - https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Back-40/337672256333640

First Act Productions - http://www.firstactproductions.ca/

And Many More.....

Any and all of your help is greatly appreciated, this has been a pretty tough loss but hopefully with your help it doesn't have to last long. Please help spread the word, and keep the music playing!

Many Thanks,

Chris Britton

story:
A New Beginning: 

Hello my fellow friends and fans, Trip Richmond here,

The past few years have been a series of ups and downs, trials and triumphs, joy and tears. I am excited to announce my new alliance with Parthenon Records // AllAboutMyBand, a production company out of Dallas Texas who will be assisting me and my music career through 2014 and beyond.

What we are doing here is offering you, my fans a chance to be a part of the newest and biggest phase of my career to date. Using this website we hope to reach out to all of my fans both new and old to be a part of history. Although I cannot give too many details YET, what I can say is that there are HUGE things planned for 2014 and I want my closest friends and supporters to have a front row seat from the beginning. That is what this campaign is all about. 

This campaign is more than a "fundraiser." It is a rebirth of all that I have spent my life trying to achieve, and a new start that I believe is the beginning of a whole new side of me I have yet to share. Your generous support in this adventure is necessary to make it a reality and it also gives you a chance to obtain valuable benefits both monetary and nostalgic! 


The Details:

  • We are currently trying to raise $30,000 to help with costs for the following items:
  • A Professional Music Video
  • The Costs For New Recordings
  • Live Shows to YOUR TOWNS!
  • Attendance to Nashville Music Seminars and Concerts
  • Distribution and Licensing
  • National Radio Airplay, and more.

The total amount of money that it costs to achieve these goals is over $100,000 however AAMB (AllAboutMyBand) is willing to cover most of the costs, provided that together, you and I can raise enough to cover this small part. 

This is why I, along with AAMB have compiled a unique collection of perks in exchange for your contribution to the continuing music of Trip Richmond. Reading down the column to the right, you will see many opportunities to help out. Regardless of how much you are able to contribute, the smallest contribution helps and I am grateful to you all for all the love and support you have shown me throughout the years. 

The Future:

When we make this happen, it will be the beginning of a new start for me and my career. I need your help one last time to make it a reality. Please join me today and reserve a new CD, some memorabilia, free concert tickets, or simply share this link on your Facebook page! Everything you do helps and does not go unnoticed. 

Thank you once again y'all! LET'S ROCK IT!

story:
Short Summary

The Scarlet Fever have become a staple in the Toronto alt-rock scene, combining their flair for energetic and dramatic stage shows with a sound that blends the darker and more surreal side of psychedelia with their post punk and glam rock roots. Their accomplishments include a nomination for best independent album at the Toronto Independent Music Awards, and holding their own in an opening slot for cult heroes The Sex Gang Children.

We, as a band, have always tried to remain a self sustaining entity, but the magnitude of finishing our sophomore album has proven to be more than we can handle by ourselves at this time. With hopes of providing our fans with the best product possible, we are reaching out to you, to join us in making this our best work to date.  With seven tracks all but completed, and three to four more ready to record, we are close enough to taste the finish line.

We truly love our fans and supporters and we not only want to bring them the best sonic experience, as only The Scarlet Fever can, but have also constructed a campaign to excite the music fan in all of us.

What We Need

We're pretty close to a finished product as is, but we still have 3 to 4 more tracks to lay down before we reach a solid LP length album. Plus, there are the costs of final mixing and mastering, and then the costs of manufacturing the CD's themselves. Why stop at just CDs though?! If we reach our final goal it would be our dream to give this collection of songs the proper release the music deserves with both CD and vinyl formats. Just imagine laying down a slab of scarlet red vinyl on your turntable and cranking the volume way up! Sexy? We think so!

To give you a more clear idea of where the money is going, here is a quick run down:

  • To finish recording the album:

       -Studio Rental  $450

       -Mixing Final Tracks  $1000

       -Mastering  $700

  •  CD manufacturing:    (approx) $2000
  • Vinyl manufacturing:   (approx) $2000

What You Get!

What?! You want more than the satisfaction of helping someone out?? Well, you got it! We have a very exciting list of perks ranging from our retro cool styled gig posters, the album itself, and an hour with our very own super talented massage therapist. You could even see your name next to producer’s credits of your very own Scarlet Fever album!

The Impact

In an age where there is little value left for hard working bands, live music, and the sweat and blood that goes into the art of a well crafted album, you have a chance to help rekindle the fire of a dying art form by a band that truly loves the medium. We want to bring you an album that you will listen to from front to back, many times over, for many years. An experience that you can take as you please, when you feel the urge for that one specific song, or immerse yourself in with your headphones on and the rest of the world tuned out. This suspended reality will exist in your speakers because of your generosity and passion for the art of rock n roll.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a financial donation, or you just feel the need to give in every way possible, there are lots of alternative ways you can still help us! 

-Post a comment to this campaign. By doing so, you helping us boost our campaign's GoGo Factor and help raise awareness!

-Share a link to our campaign on your Facebook page.

-Share links to our sites with your friends and help spread the Scarlet Fever!

http://thescarletfever.bandcamp.com/

http://www.thescarletfever.ca/

https://www.facebook.com/thescarletfeverca

-Download our songs, come out to our shows, and tell everyone you know!

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your support!

The Scarlet Fever

of final mixing and mastering, and then the costs of manufacturing the CD's
themselves. Why stop at just CDs though?! If we reach our final goal it would
be our dream to give this collection of songs the proper release the music
deserves with both CD and vinyl formats. Just imagine
laying down a slab of scarlet red vinyl on your turntable and cranking the
volume way up! Sexy? We think so! 
To give
you a more clear idea of where the money is going, here is a quick run down:
To finish recording the album:
       -Studio
Rental  $450
       -Mixing
Final Tracks  $1000
       -Mastering  $700

 CD
manufacturing:    (approx) $2000


Vinyl
manufacturing:   (approx) $2000


What You Get!
What?!
You want more than the satisfaction of helping someone out?? Well, you got it!
We have a very exciting list of perks ranging from our retro cool styled gig
posters, the album itself, and an hour with our very own super talented massage
therapist. You could even see your name next to producer’s credits of your very
own Scarlet Fever album!
The Impact 
In an age where there is little value left for hard working bands, live music, and the sweat and blood that goes into the art of a well crafted album, you have a chance to help rekindle the fire of a dying art form by a band that truly loves the medium. We want to bring you an album that you will listen to from front to back, many times over, for many years. An experience that you can take as you please, when you feel the urge for that one specific song, or immerse yourself in with your headphones on and the rest of the world tuned out. This suspended reality will exist in your speakers because of your generosity and passion for the art of rock n roll. 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you
are unable to make a financial donation, or you just feel the need to give in
every way possible, there are lots of alternative ways you can still help
us!  
-Post a comment to this campaign. By
doing so, you helping us boost our campaign's GoGo Factor and help raise
awareness!
-Share a link to our campaign on your Facebook
page. 
-Share links to our sites with your
friends and help spread the Scarlet Fever!
http://thescarletfever.bandcamp.com/
http://www.thescarletfever.ca/
https://www.facebook.com/thescarletfeverca
-Download our songs, come out to our shows,
and tell everyone you know! 
Thank you
from the bottom of our hearts for your support! 
The
Scarlet Fever

story:
Hi Everyone, 

My name is Gil. Maybe you know me already, maybe you don't. Either way, I am starting to record a new album and it would be brilliant if you could hop on board and help me get it finished up and printed. (Also, in April I will be heading to Europe on tour and it would be awesome to be able to take my new album with me.)

Very briefly, about four years ago I decided to become an all-singing, sometimes-dancing, mostly-strumming musician. Since then I have played more than 300 shows around South Africa (and a couple in Mozambique) and recorded two albums (well, one album and an EP). Now, it is time for album number three. 

Over the past couple years I have managed to put together a nice little home studio, so in terms of funding I am all good for the actual recording process. What I do need help with, however, are the finishing touches: mixing, mastering and printing the actual CDs. 

I hope you will get involved and help me out. Please check out the various perks you will get by contributing to this project. 

I am very excited about this album. I have many new songs to choose from and a bunch of ideas that go beyond my normal singer-songwriter fare. I think that the outcome could be super cool. 

Alrighty then. I'm going to launch this thing. Thank you for getting involved! 

Gil

Ps. In the meantime, you can find a bunch of my music  at  soundcloud.com/gilhockman

story:
About Me & The Album:

My name is Donald Hunt.  I'm a singer-songwriter (and recent Berklee College of Music graduate) preparing to record my debut album entitled “Life Or Imagination”. The album is to be recorded in January 2014.

The album will contain 13 songs consisting of nine original songs and four jazz standards of which include “Shiny Stockings”, “I’ll Get By”,  “Love Dance” and “Lush Life. The album’s musical styles are very diverse with swing, Latin swing, Argentine tango, bolero, bossanova, straight 8ths, gypsy jazz and ballads all being representative.

Nik Rodewald and I serve as the album’s producers with Nik also engineering each track. This special project will feature the Grammy award-winning Turtle Island Quartet as well as some of Nashville’s most seasoned musicians. Cedric Hanriot will write the string arrangements for the Turtle Island Quartet.

Above, you will find two live performances of "Will You?" and "Savor the Now, Forget the Rest". These two tracks will appear on the album and are written by Nik Rodewald and myself! You can also visit my official website at www.donaldhuntmusic.com to get a taste of what to expect on the album!

About The Musical Production Team:

Nik Rodewald – Producer/Composer/Engineer/Saxophonist

At the age of 21, saxophonist/engineer/producer/composer Nik Rodewald’s musical journey is one that spans numerous facets of the music world, and continues to expand to new genres and new musical possibilities.

Rodewald made his debut as a saxophonist at the age of 16, performing with the Merchants of Cool Big Band in Columbia, TN. Shortly thereafter, Rodewald would begin gigging around the Nashville area with his quartet, The Goodburgers, and at the age of 18, Rodewald began working with Grammy-Award-Winning engineer/producer/keyboardist Kevin McKendree (Brian Setzer, Delbert McClinton, John Oates) at his Rock House Recording Studio in Franklin, TN, where Rodewald has worked as an engineer for a number of blues legends including Reese Wynans, Tom Hambridge, Anson Funderburgh, and many more.

Since entering the prestigious Berklee College of Music, Rodewald has begun focusing on composing and songwriting, studying with Ayn Inserto and Dick Lowell. Rodewald’s compositions include jazz tunes, big band arrangements, duets, choral music, and Sacred Music.

Rodewald has also been an in-demand session player at Berklee, and his saxophone playing has found it’s way onto jazz, funk, indie-rock, and pop recordings, and his flute onto film scores. In November of 2011, Rodewald was selected as a member of the house band at the National Catholic Youth Conference in Indianapolis, IN, under the direction of Grammy and Dove winning artist Tom Booth. As a saxophonist and percussionist, Rodewald backed up a number of the top artists in the Contemporary Catholic genre, including Booth, Steve Angrisano, ValLimar Jansen, Sarah Hart, and many others. At Berklee, Rodewald has studied saxophone performance with Harry Skoler, Shannon LeClaire, and Dino Govoni.

Rodewald also works as a contributing writer for Blues Rock Review, and a staff writer for the Berklee Jazz Community, writing to promote jazz and the Berklee High School Jazz Festival. Rodewald will graduate from Berklee with degrees in Performance and Jazz Composition in May 2015.

Cedric Hanriot- String Arranger

Cedric Hanriot would generally be considered a latecomer to the world of music. After earning his Master’s Degree in Electronics & Digital Audio Processing at the age of 21, his life took an unexpected turn as he sat at the piano for the first time in his life. Then at this late age of 21 years old, he started studying music and playing the piano.

Within only a few years, Fulbright recipient, French pianist pianist, composer, producer and arranger Cedric Hanriot has performed and recorded with luminaries such as drummer Terri Lyne Carrington, bass player John Patitucci, bass player/singer Me’shell Ndegeocello, drummer Cindy Blackman, saxophonist Joe Lovano, and Grammy Awards winning singer Dee Dee Bridgewater.

Cedric Hanriot has appeared at many prestigious performance venues worldwide including The Iridium New York (USA), the Vancouver International Jazz Festival (Canada), the Tanglewood International Jazz Festival (USA), the Universal Exposition 2010 (Shanghai, China) and the Jazz a Vienne Festival (F).  Mr. Hanriot has also appeared at La Defense Jazz Festival Paris (F), Transe-Atlantique Festival (Morocco), at the famous NPR radio Talk Show “Says you” and the Victoria Jazz Festival (Canada).

Besides a Fulbright grant, Hanriot has won major composition and solo prizes throughout the world including the Jazz at St Germain Festival, International Jazz Soloist Contest in Monaco and Enghien les Bains Festival. He has won the prestigious French-American Arthur King Peters Memorial Grant, the Mary Jane Earnhart Ellison Endowed Scholarship as well as scholarships to Berklee College of Music, Boston (USA).

Cedric Hanriot has studied with world-class artists such as Danilo Perez, Greg Osby, Jean Michel Pilc, Joe Lovano, Hal Crook.

Mr. Hanriot holds a Masters Degree in Electronic Engineering and Audio Signal Processing from the University of Nancy, France and a Degree in Professional Music from Berklee College of Music, Boston (USA).

Your Donations Will Be Used For:

·  Paying Nik Rodewald to engineer and produce the album

·  Paying Cedric Hanriot to arrange for the Turtle Island Quartet

·  Paying musicians to record on the album

·  Paying to have the album mixed and mastered

What You Get In Return:

We truly appreciate the loyalty and trust that you give us by contributing to this album, so we have designed perks with a wide range of rewards (which you will find on the side window) for this campaign as a way of thanking you. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

·  Tell your friends and family about the campaign

·  Use the IndieGoGo share tools to spread the word

·  Share this campaign with fellow music lovers

story:
"CAPTIVE" Featuring platinum recording artist Jade Starling of PRETTY POISON, EDM DJ Lee Dagger, DJ producers Laszlo and Franck Dona.

THE LEGEND CONTINUES

The History
I rose to fast fame in 1987 as the lead singer of the platinum selling group Pretty Poison when our single “Catch Me I’m Falling” hit the trifecta of sorts by simultaneously topping the Billboard Club chart, and occupying positions in the top 10 of Billboards Hot 100 as well as top 15 on the R&B chart. “Catch Me I’m Falling” became one of those songs that personified a decade, a classic ground breaking record that helped pave the way for so many other artists that came after.
Over the years “Catch Me I’m Falling” was featured on numerous TV shows and movies, (including “Breaking Bad”, “Don’t Mess with The Zohan”, and Jamie Kennedy’s “Kickin It Old Skool”) it was also featured on 3 VH-1 specials including the Jessica McClure ( little girl who fell into a well in Texas) popup video edition and has been used on over 2 dozen CD compilations. It was most recently featured on the "Garbage Feet" segment of MTV's "Ridiculousness" starring Derek Hough from ABC's Dancing with the Star's.

Since her success with “Catch Me I'm Falling”, Jade has charted 7 times on Billboard.

BREAKING BAD SEASON 4



Kickin It Old Skool

 

Don't Mess With The Zohan

THE CAMPAIGN


"CAPTIVE" is my debut solo album and I'm very proud of it!!

"Insomniak", the first single from "CAPTIVE" broke into Billboard's Top 30 Club Singles Chart earlier this year. "Insomniak" was the result of a successful KICKSTARTER campaign that I launched in July of 2013 when I successfully raised just over $21,000. This allowed me to pay for 3 remixes at an average of $2500 ea, radio promotion, club promotion (both in the US and in Europe) and make & promote a video.  


For "CAPTIVE" I'm going to need a minimum of $15,000 to pay for advertising, social media promotion, and club & radio promotion for the 2nd single "THINKIN ABOUT U".
Any additional money that is raised during this INDIEGOGO campaign will go towards the creation of additional videos, aggressive radio promotion and to launch a fully routed ground based tour. 
The success of  "INSOMNIAK" was just the beginning. "CAPTIVE" has the potential to be my most successful release since “Catch Me I’m Falling” ruled the charts. "CAPTIVE" features several collaborations between me, my long time writing partner Whey Cooler and popular British DJ/remixer Lee Dagger of “BIMBO JONES” fame as well as the fast rising star Laszlo and French Universal recording artist Franck Dona.

LEE DAGGER of BIMBO JONES


“I met Lee while SKYPING with Bimbo Jones last June to discuss their remixing my song “Dance Revolution” which appears on "CAPTIVE". After they delivered an amazing remix, I asked Lee if he had any tracks that we could collaborate on. He emailed me 20 or so tracks and I along with Whey picked a few and started writing. The results were so good that we kept writing and writing until we had a dozen new songs.
“INSOMNIAK”, "ONLY LOVE","SPONTANEOUS",THINKIN ABOUT U","SUBLIMINAL","EVERY LIL BEAT","A PLACE IN THE SUN" and "AWAKE" are all featured on the "CAPTIVE" LP and among the best songs I've ever written. These are songs for and of the SKYPE era where writing and recording could occur between people a world away simultaneously.
I finally got to meet up with Lee for real in Miami when we presented an award together at the Winter Music Conference’s International Dance Music Awards (IDMAs) last year.
I had a similar experience with hot new comer LASZLO who is based in Denver with songs like "Love of a Lifetime", "Better and Better", "Runaway Hearts" and "Step by Step" all of which are featured on "CAPTIVE".
With Franck Dona, I was introduced to him through long time friend Chris Schwartz who gave the world Lauryn Hill and the Fugees, with his Ruff House Records.
Franck Dona was making noise in France and on Chris' radar. Franck had some tracks and was looking to collaborate with other writers. He sent me a few tracks and one just really spoke to me, the result is "Everything in the World".




I played “THINKIN ABOUT U” around for some tough audiences and everyone was reacting to this record! Lee had similar reactions in Prague, Switzerland and Australia where he played it in his sets!!!



Of course just having a great song is a small piece of the puzzle especially when dealing with the EDM community. (Electronic Dance Music)
In order to chart a record on the Billboard Club Chart, you need at least 3-6 different mixes all of which cost money, then you have to buy a club promotion because you need someone to organize the DJs to report the record to Billboard at the same time not to mention the Dance Radio promotion!!(which cost twice as much as the club promotion)

I’ve used promotion companies (Loren Chaidez Promotions & Promo Only) who are among the best in the business. (With that said, they charge accordingly lol) The project will be managed by my long time associate Vince Corea who will oversee the promotion staff, video production and remixes.


So to recap, I’m trying to raise the $15,000 necessary to pay for the remixes, and promotion campaign.
I have been performing around the US at clubs and as part of the FREESTYLE EXPLOSION concert series along with Lisa Lisa, Stevie B, Expose, Cover Girls, Stacy Q, Debbie Deb, Shannon, Johnny O, Nu Shooz, Cynthia and Nocera.

These shows are a lot of fun and hugely successful with 5,000 – 10,000 fans showing up at each show. It’s amazing that there is still so much love out there for the music and the fans that show up for the shows range in age from 5 to 75.
I’m blessed to be able to still do this and excited beyond words about the new LP!




 “CAPTIVE”  is a serious record loaded with potential hits and it’s so important to launch it the right way. I think this new album is the best I’ve ever made and I fully plan to tour behind it. Even though you can hear a sample of "CAPTIVE" midway through the intro movie to this campaign, I made a separate clip so you can hear it again :-)


I’d love to meet everyone that helps me with my “CAPTIVE INDIEGOGO" and will be sending regular updates on its progress and the progress of my tour. I also plan to do meet and greets so that I can hopefully meet you and thank you in person!

story:
Short Summary


We are an Alaskan metal/hardcore band with an enormous amount of passion for our music. We pride ourselves on our aggressive intimate performances, and strive to deliver the best possible quality recordings we can afford. As a band we decided for the time being that we would not charge for the music we produce in order to share it with as many people as possible. 

It is for this reason that we humbly ask for your support financially in order to facilitate our desire to produce an amazing album. It is an expensive endeavor to produce an album as we are all starving musicians. 

With your donations we will be able to produce an album that is as good in sound quality as it is in content. We have added a wide variety of incentives to help encourage donations. Every little bit helps!!! 

                            

We need your munies.


  • 1000 dollars is exactly how much we need to produce our goal of three songs, however additional money may allow us to produce even more depending on the amount.

    We racked our brains to come up with incentives both amazing and degrading. We've got exclusive prints, shirts and hoodies,  food-pizza crafted for you mouth-hole, Jens torture and extortion, Matt labor, Tattoo's and much much more. Take a look, There's some pretty amazing offers to choose from.

The goal.


The music industry is cutthroat, But we are sonic pirates. We hope to add the finished album to our press kit and send it out to labels, industry reps, and similar artist scouting institutions. You could be a major contributing factor to us achieving our goal.


Help get the word out.


If your a fan and cant contribute financially please share this with everyone you can. 
Stop posting pictures of your stupid cat memes and throw this out into the world.
Let people know we need help.

Thank you for time,
                       GRiFFiTH
story_txt:
Short Summary

We are an Alaskan metal/hardcore band with an enormous amount of passion for our music. We pride ourselves on our aggressive intimate performances, and strive to deliver the best possible quality recordings we can afford. As a band we decided for the time being that we would not charge for the music we produce in order to share it with as many people as possible. 
It is for this reason that we humbly ask for your support financially in order to facilitate our desire to produce an amazing album. It is an expensive endeavor to produce an album as we are all starving musicians. 
With your donations we will be able to produce an album that is as good in sound quality as it is in content. We have added a wide variety of incentives to help encourage donations. Every little bit helps!!! 
                            


We need your munies.

1000 dollars is exactly how much we need to produce our goal of three songs, however additional money may allow us to produce even more depending on the amount.We racked our brains to come up with incentives both amazing and degrading. We've got exclusive prints, shirts and hoodies,  food-pizza crafted for you mouth-hole, Jens torture and extortion, Matt labor, Tattoo's and much much more. Take a look, There's some pretty amazing offers to choose from.



The goal.

The music industry is cutthroat, But we are sonic pirates. We hope to add the finished album to our press kit and send it out to labels, industry reps, and similar artist scouting institutions. You could be a major contributing factor to us achieving our goal.



Help get the word out.

If your a fan and cant contribute financially please share this with everyone you can. Stop posting pictures of your stupid cat memes and throw this out into the world.Let people know we need help.Thank you for time,                       GRiFFiTH

story:
Short Summary

Seattle's own Blackpool Astronomy is preparing to record a new album with producer Jeff McNulty at Seattle's Vera project and then release it through Distressed records in the spring.  

  • Blackpool Astronomy is a powerful, gothic shoegaze duo made up of Jeff McCollough (formerly of The High Priests of Panic, Past Burning and Drown) and Ben Madonna (currently of Mary Abaddon & Left Askew and formerly of The High Priests of Panic and U.N.)
  • This is our second release and it will be the best we have ever put out because it is much more of a collaborative effort than our first which was primarily written and recorded by Jeff. 
  • By supporting this project you will allow us share some of the best music we have ever written with you and the rest of the world. We will be able to record in high fidelity exactly what we have been performing live for most of the year as well as create a great recording that will truly capture our sound.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise roughly $1000 to cover the costs of recording and mastering and materials like strings and replacement cymbals which Ben really needs.  Plus we will need roughly another $1000 to press CD's and pay for the layout of the cd.
  • For those of you who help us you will have our eternal thanks and some sweet perks to keep you happy you helped us. We can't wait share this journey with all of you!
  • Any funds contributed will be used to complete this goal.  Nothing will be used for personal gratification or new duds or a pizza party.  It will all be used to create a record that will expand our reach and provide our fans a high quality recording for their enjoyment.

The Impact

  • The new songs are very deep, full of serious contemplation and thought.  They are some of our best work and they are worth recording for everyone to enjoy.  
  • We have put out releases before but we want this one to be so well produced that is a joy to listen to without sounding over produced. 
  • With your help we can record a real work of art and not just scratchy barely listenable demos.

Other Ways You Can Help

  If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • You can help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can do this by using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Or you can just share the link on your Facebook, Twitter or Tumblr page.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Heather Shallowpoint,  most of you are familiar with our band Shallowpoint from Tn. Up until this moment we have completely funded everything we have done, our album/music, our videos and even bought our own van to travel in. We have reached a major roadblock when it comes to touring! Here is where we need your help! touring is very expensive, We are really not guaranteed any certain amount of money that we will make while on the road, especially since we are just starting out. Your help with funding can mean the world as to if this band continues to survive or not. All we ask is for a $5 donation from each of you.  Your support will literally keep us alive! 

What We Need & What You Get

With every five dollar donation we will send a personal shout out on our social media. Your funding will help with road expenses. If we do not meet our goal, all monies will still be spent on the band, and trust me, there are plenty of every day expenses!  lol

The Impact

We feel at this moment that the lack of funds is the ONLY thing holding us back. Your contribution will mean the world to us.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

: If you are unable to contribute please help us make a lot of noise about this campaign, please share this and spread the word for us!

story:
Hello, this is Robert. Thank you for visiting my campaign! The Project "Healing" is almost done and now it is an exciting time for the fundraiser for producing the CD.  I have been hard at work on recording a new collection of entirely improvisational pieces and have 11 songs songs I know you will love. (One you can download for free, and one you can preview) 

By pre-ordering your CD and donating to this project your are keeping classical improv alive in my community and directly supporting my gift.


Thank you for supporting my first album, I have had amazing response and feedback about my music, many people are still driving around with the CD playing in the cars! This new collection of songs is said to be an even greater quality and more moving compositions derived from my creative outpouring. It is important that Idaho and the Northwest have humanities. Your support allows me to share my music. 



What We Need & What You Get

Donations will cover the costs and production of the CDs, online communications and downloading, and promotions for the project including

  • Mastering & Mixing
  • CD Design & Art
  • Online Promotions & Distribution

Online fundraising is a great way for you to pre-order the CD and support the arts see the great perks for each level of donation to the right of this page.

Breakdown of costs:

2,000 CDs $2,350.20 (Full color 4-Panel Eco-Wallets)

Graphic Design Layout $600 (Including Posters, Flyers)

Mastering $300

Distribution & Shipping $347

(Plus campaign costs 4%)
________________

 Total $3,797.20 GOAL

Most projects like this cost double to triple this price, but because of deep discounts from local supporters Robert can create a quality project for much less.

If we do not quite meet our goal but get close to it, we plan to order a smaller run of CD's. (But we actually end up paying more per disc below the 2,000 break.)

Robert is planning to donate 1,000 CDs to The Stanton Project pregnancy centers. So your donation go deeper into our community.

(Any additional funds raised will go to purchasing new equipment for Robert. Specifically his keyboard which has has worn out by playing so ferociously!)


In 2011 we raised just under $3,500 in 35 days to produce Robert's first album.

  • Thanks to you; my family, friends, local community, and the world now have access to my music.

Together, we can do it again!

Thank you for your careful consideration. In a time when so many are too busy to stop, breath, and reflect, this music is all the more important. I don't need big contracts or fancy record producers, I just need you to be the wind in my sails.


Some of you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please share this campaign using the share tools for Facebook & Twitter.
  • Spout off to your friends and family by forwarding my campaign by email.
  • Place a campaign badge on your website.
  • Download my song, and share the link.
