story:
Help DETROIT MUTANT RADIO hit the ROAD!

We are Detroit Mutant Radio, a five piece, rock fusion band of "D.I.Y" musicians based in Atlanta, GA. Recently, we completed our debut EP... MUTANITE: Rise of the MUTANTS! It's been receiving great reviews, the spins are starting to pick up and all the local shows we have played in Atlanta have been killer! 
 
With that being said...as much as we love the 'ATL music scene, the fine venues (Hard Rock Cafe, Masquerade, The Five Spot, ESL, the Atrium, Terminal West, BeAtlanta House and numerous other spots.)
This summer folks...it's time to roll!!!
 
This is Where You Come In! 
 
We need $3,000 to grab a 'reliable touring van for our EP's summer tour.
After funding our album's production, duplication, and merchandising...renting a van is not an option we can afford. So...good people of the WORLD...we NEED your HELP to put us on the road!
 
We are Not Asking without Giving!

Now that would be a bum move...lol! Every contribution tier has it's own special incentives! (MUTANITE ep, t-shirts, stickers, buttons, album art, band autographs , get added to our guest list for a FREE SHOW, and your name mentioned in a 'special THANK YOU video.) Please accept these as love tokens...artsitic consideration's for your financial support. Find what tier you can afford and be more than a FAN!!! 

 

3 More Ways to Help DMR Roll!

  1. Help us promote, promote, promote! (Share our indiegogo campaign on your social networks!)
  2. PLEASE repeat step 1 DAILY! 
  3. Come experience DMR live...when we hit your town!

story:
All Hands on Deck!

We are Disforia, a progressive metal band from Salt Lake City with a penchant for science fiction and outrageous shenanigans. 

We have made good progress on our first full-length album, titled 'The Age of Ether', but we've hit some road-bumps which we all experience from time to time. We are SO close to completing the album but are in dire straits, financially speaking. This album is going to be very special, and we know that with your help it will be even more so! 

What We Need & What You Get

The breakdown:

  • We need about $3,500 to complete the album. Studio time is expensive and we also need to mix, master, and produce the album. The perks will cost us a few pretty pennies as well, so we've raised the goal to $4,000. We're hoping to come close to breaking even this time around.
  • We have some truly unique and exciting perks which will make your donations extremely worth while! Everything from a personalized Facebook shoutout to a Disforia mud-wrestling match.

The Impact

The completion of this album is extremely important. We've been at this for a long time but constant line-up changes and interstellar warfare have made progress sporadic. We finally have a stable line-up and a solidified sense of who we are, musically. This album will cement Disforia's identity in the underground metal world, and we're SO close! We're really excited to bring these perks to life and give back to those who have so generously kept our wings soaring.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate (ye scallywag!) then sharing our campaign on your social media sites is an extremely valuable way of helping us reach our goal. Word of mouth isn't to be forgotten as well, mentioning this campaign to friends can also help make a considerable difference.

Cover art by Dan Mumford

What Rank Are You? (Perks)

T-design by Austin Bentley

Many More Perks On The Right!

story:
Today, Crosspulse opens the sixth annual International Body Music Festival (IBMF).  Running November 5-10, this will be a truly international event featuring 75 artists from 9 countries. I began producing the Festival in 2008 after receiving a Guggenheim Fellowship, and we have alternated locations between the Bay Area and abroad (São Paulo in 2010 and Istanbul in 2012). This year’s Festival is the most ambitious to date. Based in Oakland, San Francisco and Berkeley we’ll offer concerts, classes, workshops, and in-school events, reaching an incredibly diverse audience.

We’re enormously proud of the success and recognition that the Festival has achieved both nationally and internationally. It has become the focal point for both the artists and audiences involved in the world’s oldest musical form. I’m sure that you understand that producing a festival of this scope and magnitude requires the hard work of a dedicated staff and scores of volunteers. It also requires the generosity of our friends in the community such as you. That’s why we would like to ask you to join with us to make the year’s Festival the most memorable one yet. 

We do face some special hurdles this time around. The government shutdown made the always onerous task of obtaining visas for our visiting artists almost impossible. We hired a lawyer skilled in the area of visas for international artists in order to complete this process in time. However the extra costs involved here – which includes having to book last minute, expensive airfares – has put a strain on our already frugal budget. 

A few weeks ago we launched an indiegogo fundraising campaign to meet a matching grant awarded to Crosspulse from the East Bay Community Foundation to support the IBMF's opening spectacle that takes place tonight in downtown Oakland - a free, outdoor event featuring IBMF artists and vertical dance company, Bandaloop.  We recently met that goal and are now seeking to raise additional funds to help offset these unforeseen visa and travel costs created as a result of the government shutdown.

With the help of our friends we are confident that the Festival will be a spectacular and unique artistic event here in the Bay Area. Would you please join our team by making a contribution today?

We deeply appreciate your consideration.

Sincerely,

Keith Terry

Director


--------------------------------


My name is Keith Terry and I’m the Artistic Director of Crosspulse, a non-profit arts organization based in Oakland, California.  On November 5, 2013, a swarm of international Body Musicians—snapping, clapping, stepping, singing — will descend on the San Francisco Bay Area for the 6th International Body Music Festival (IBMF).  It’s the biggest and most ambitious festival we’ve ever produced and the Opening Event is unlike anything we've ever done.  

Crosspulse has been awarded an $8,000 matching grant from the East Bay Community Foundation for aerial dancers Bandaloop to perform on the side of a building in Downtown Oakland, with a Body Music Orchestra below them, providing the score.  The orchestra will be comprised of groups Corposonic (Oakland, CA), Barbatuques (São Paulo, Brazil), Çudamani (Bali, Indonesia), many other Festival Artists, and YOU, the audience!

This amazing and unusual collaboration encapsulates everything the IBMF is about —connecting people and communities, artist and audience. It is art that is accessible, present, and dynamic.  It infuses our home community of Oakland with this international spark of talent and energy, and shows off our resurgent city at its best. This Opening Event of the Festival is brand new, extremely exciting, and FREE.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $8000 to match this grant.  But honestly, we could use much, much more to produce the full 6 days of the Festival to its best capacity. We have fantastic perks in exchange for your contribution, plus we welcome you into the incredible experience of being a part of an unusual, 3-dimensional live performance, in the heart of a diverse urban scene.

The Impact

Body Music is a very human artform, the oldest music on the planet.  Music you can SEE, dance you can HEAR, Body Music connects people on a visceral level.  Where we fear foreign influence and ideas, when we tighten our borders, Body Music is a common language - we all share basically the same instrument. 

The IBMF is a gathering of talents and traditions, curated into an open and welcoming festival environment. We are bringing a host of artists from Brazil, Indonesia, Spain, Greece, Turkey, Israel, Canada and across the US to present and collaborate within our community—with local artists, with our audiences and with many different communities throughout the San Francisco Bay Area.  

In 2011, many of you helped us successfully raise over $13,000 for the 4th IBMF.  That kept us in the black so that we could take the Festival to Istanbul, Turkey in 2012.  For the next few years the IBMF will be produced overseas.  Please help us produce this incredible event now, in our hometown.  If we don’t meet our goal we will not receive the matching grant, but whatever funds we raise will still be used to create this vibrant project.

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your contribution to meet our matching grant.  If we exceed our goal, even better, we can put it to good use.  And if you can’t donate, you can still help us by sharing this page with your friends and families.  Thank you for your support.

story:
About Us and the EP

We of Flashpoint are a young trio of folk musicians from Dallas playing tunes rooted in the Irish and surrounding traditions.   We are comprised of brothers David and Daniel Mehalko and Joseph Carmichael.

After meeting at the O'Flaherty Irish Music Youth Camp back in the summer of 2009 we got our start playing at a local Farmer's Market in McKinney, slowly developing our playing styles and repertoire, and eventually establishing ourselves as a fully-fledged band.

As a band and individually we have performed at venues and festivals throughout the US, such as the North Texas Irish Festival, Austin Celtic Fest, Kansas City Irish Festival, and have recently had the great privilege of opening for bands such as Solas and FullSet.

In the winter of 2011-2012 we recorded our debut album, "Jammed", comprised of traditional and contemporary tunes.

Since then we've honed our ideas and want to get back into the studio to bring them to you all in the form of a 5-track EP.

Stylistically we expect this recording to be much different than the first, including more modern arrangements, vocals, and a select few guest musicians. We hope to end up with something representative of where we are today while still staying true to the roots of the music that's inspired us.

The Plan

We've already got about $1,000 set aside from sales of our previous CD, but we hope to raise another $3,000 with your help.

The $3,000 will go towards the studio costs of recording, mixing and mastering. The other $1,000 we already have saved will go towards the costs of CD printing and distribution, studio musician pay, photography and graphic design. Anything raised above the goal will go into any extra costs of the recording, as well as helping fund a fall tour to promote the album.

We'll be recording in September, with plans to release the EP at the end of October.

Give it a listen!

Here's one of the tunes we plan to record on the EP, a composition by our friend Lizzy Doe called "Threads."  It will of course be significantly more polished than this rough, live version, but nevertheless, this is small a taste of what you will hear!


You can also listen to a sampler of past recordings we've made by visiting
our page on Noisetrade.

story:
If you're gonna go somewhere......

 

Who are we? Well without getting too intimate, we are Carly Thomas and Lori Girard, two singer songwriters with a desire to share our songs and live the dream. Doing what you're passionate about isn't easy - but it's without a doubt worth it; unfortunately, it rarely comes free. We all want to do what makes us happy and we all want to share that happiness with others and nothing would make us happier than living in a van and singing across Canada for 17 days! Really! Hopping on a train-car undetected with our guitars, CDs and merch is not really feasible so to make our very first -yes very first!- tour a success, we need your help. We are hoping to get by with a little help from our friends. The cost of gas is our biggest concern and you can help us turn dreams into gasoline so we can exhale with relief and focus on making every show the very best it can be! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need some extra cash to fund our gas bills, so that we don't have to rip our hair out while driving across the country! 

What YOU get is some great perks that don't smell like gas at all. Like, want Lori's BRAND NEW CD? Easy! She'll send you a signed copy. Want To hear Carly or Lori cover a song just for you on Youtube?? Your request becomes our command and your kindness comes back to you. Want some sweet merch? Buy it here so we can put it in our tanks! Want to give us a tip? Any amount you give is going directly into fueling our dreams! We so appreciate the support from our friends, family and fans. What you give you always get back. So check out the donation options and get yourself some sweet and often limited edition stuff!! And as always, high fives and hugs are always free at our shows!

The Impact

If we can share our music across the country without racking up a huge debt, it will be that much more possible to do it again! You would be helping to make our musical dreams come true! (So cheesy but true).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can still help. Be part of a street team that puts posters up where we are playing! Host a house concert in your town or city! Call up your crazy uncle who happens to work for a radio station and get us some exposure! Come to a show or tell your friends and family about our shows.  Give us a place to stay on the tour or recommend a venue for a date that we have open!!!

 

Here are the dates so far! We hope to see you along the way! 

 

August 11th - Sudbury, ON - The Townehouse

August 12th – Sault Ste Marie- Quattro Chophouse and Bar

August 13th - Thunder Bay, ON  - Beaux Daddys

August 14th - Kenora, ON  -   Shooters

August 15th - Winnipeg, MB - The Neighbourhood Bookstore and Cafe

August 16th - Moose Jaw, SK -Venue 123

August 17th - Calgary, AB  - Blind Beggar Pub

August 18th - Calgary, AB - Lord Nelsons

August 19th -  OPEN

August 20 - OPEN

August 21  - OPEN 

August 22nd - Vancouver, BC - Raw Canvas

August 23rd - OPEN 

August 24th - Vancouver, BC - Falconettis

August 25th -- OPEN

August 26th - OPEN

August 27th - OPEN

story:
Harold Rosenbaum's choral organization, Canticorum Virtuosi, Inc., has been offered a fundraising challenge.

An anonymous donor will give up to $40,000 to The New York Virtuoso Singers, The Canticum Novum Singers, and The Canticum Novum Youth Choir if we can raise the funds to match -- and we need your help!

Who are we? 

We are three highly-regarded musical organizations in one: the all-professional New York Virtuoso Singers (NYVS), the volunteer and community-based Canticum Novum Singers (CNS), and The Canticum Novum Youth Choir, all under the direction of founder and conductor, Harold Rosenbaum.  Collectively, the groups are under the 501(c)3 umbrella of Canticorum Virtuosi, Inc.

We are almost halfway to our $40,000 goal -- and this is where you can help us.

Why should you contribute to this campaign?

We’ll give you seven good reasons:

  1. When you give to our 2013 Matching Fund Challenge, you support all three vocal ensembles.  Each group performs for a different and distinct part of the New York metropolitan area concert audience, so all three combine to make for a large and extremely diverse public that your support helps us reach.
  2. It’s good to know you’re giving to one of the best and most visible organizations in American choral music.  For The New York Virtuoso Singers alone, Harold Rosenbaum has commissioned over 50 new choral works from internationally-recognized composers, many of whom have received such high honors as the Pulitzer Prize.  Both NYVS and Canticum Novum have created an extensive catalog of choral recordings, and have toured in the US and Europe.
  3. We work with great musicians – our Founder/Conductor, Harold Rosenbaum, is universally recognized as one of the finest choral conductors of our time. The singers of NYVS are the finest the New York area has to offer. The all-volunteer Canticum Novum is widely acclaimed for its very high quality, and has done 4 international tours. We also present world-class soloists who join our groups in spectacular performances of timeless classics and new works by many of the world’s great composers.
  4. Music, the arts, and music education are good for business – Communities with strong music and arts organizations and education programs are communities that attract and sustain business. The Canticum Novum Youth Choir is a strong example of music education and the difference it can make: our Youth Choir members have the opportunity to sing music at a much higher level to which they would be exposed in their schools.
  5. We need more than we earn – Sustaining and growing a high-level arts organization like ours costs a bit of money, and concert ticket sales alone cannot cover our entire budget.
  6. We have a vision – our groups have a bright future and big plans, and with your help will continue to bring music to people in New York City and beyond for many years to come:
    • NYVS will commission ten recent young award-winning composers who have not yet written choral works.  Harold Rosenbaum will mentor them during the creative process and NYVS will perform them.
    •  CNS will present masterworks with professional orchestra and soloists.
    • NYVS will perform World Premieres of recent works and U.S. Premieres of those from past centuries.
    • The youth choir will perform with CNS in Bach’s St. Matthew Passion.
  7. Nobody will tax your generosity – all donations to Canticorum Virtuosi, Inc. are tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law.


Want to know more about us?

Please visit our websites:

The New York Virtuoso Singers: http://www.nyvirtuoso.org/

The Canticum Novum Singers: http://www.canticumnovum.org/

Thank you for your support!

Even if you can't contribute today, you can still help us by spreading the word online and off.  And if you do contribute, please ask your friends to do the same.

Please share this campaign page with your music-loving friends and let them know how much their support will help us keep the music going.  Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

We are DEAD SEASON, an independent metal/rock band from Maine formed in 2003.  Over the past decade we’ve made a name for ourselves writing songs with meaningful lyrics, top notch musicianship, and playing hundreds of intense live shows for our fans. We've sold 25,000+ cd's and proud to have done it all on our own, completely self-funded.

We decided to launch this campaign because we need your help.  Commercial radio is only playing and supporting national major label artists, people are buying less cd's than ever before, and attendance at shows is down due to the struggling economy.  Over the years we've been able to pay-off recording debts through cd sales and income from live shows but due to the issues mentioned previously we are struggling to afford the costs of recording new music.  Many continue to ask us "when are you guys going to come out with some new music?"…well, this is your chance to make it happen!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the best part...we are going to give you something in return for helping us.  We are offering our new, unreleased song "Beyond Sympathy" to everyone that contributes $10 to our campaign!  We haven’t put anything out since 2011’s “The Negative NUMBers” ep so here’s how you can finally get a new ass-kicking song to add to your DEAD SEASON collection! There are also other cool perks for those able to contribute more than $10 such as t-shirts, live DEAD SEASON show at your house, and much more!  We are hoping to raise $10,000 which we’ll use to record new songs.  If we are unable to reach the entire goal we'll still be able to receive whatever funds have been raised.  Obviously the more funding we get, the more music we'll be able to put out.  Who knows, maybe we can surpass this goal if we get an overwhelming amount of support.  Depending on how much money is raised, we may be able to put together a small recording studio allowing us to record an unlimited amount of new music in the future!

The Impact

Many fans have contacted us over the years to tell us how much our music means to them and how it’s helped them through hard times in their lives (loss of loved ones, suicide, drug addiction, depression, etc).  These songs that we write and record are timeless, they will outlive us all.  Your contributions will allow us to keep putting new music into the world for everyone to enjoy for years to come.

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand if you are unable to contribute to our campaign at this time.  You can still help by spreading the word about and making a lot of noise about it on Facebook, etc.  If you can get others to contribute, that is a huge help to us and we greatly appreciate it!  Indiegogo has some great “share” tools to use on Facebook as well that we hope you will use to promote this campaign to all your friends and family.

We can't thank you enough for all your support over the years and for helping us out with this campaign!!!

Matt, Ian, Andy, and Steve

story:
Let's Get Neutrino-P a New PC!

Neutrino-P is a musician from Romania who has been a part of many collaborative efforts in the Vocaloid community, the most recent being Synthesized Reality Productions, a Vocaloid concert group that puts on 3D concerts at various conventions around the US.

Neutrino-P's computer is his life, allowing him to record, create and play music, and connect to his friends and collaborators from around the world. 

However, the old PC that's served him well for the past several years recently died, leaving him unable to continue to work on his main passion: music.

Neutrino-P has also been involved in both Citizen 16 and Vocalekt Visions. He does audio mastering, 3D rendering and much more for SRP.

SoundCloud

Twitter

Synthesized Reality Productions

Citizen 16 

Vocalekt Visions' Official Facebook

Neutrino-P's Facebook

Help us, Neutrino-P's friends, fans and fellow members of SRP, give something back to this man who has done so much for us!


Our friends at the Vocaloid fan page wanted to help With a game called Osu!

For those not familiar with Osu!, it is a free rhythm game available for Windows, Mac, and linux*at http://osu.ppy.sh/. Fans of the game are encouraged to create “beatmaps”, which are what is needed to play the game. Each beatmap is synched to a song and the player has to keep the rhythm of it.
In regular Osu!, one does this by hitting hit circles, sliding sliders, and spinning spinners. Players are rewarded for making larger combos and being as accurate as possible by getting bonuses which lead to a higher score. In the games that will be hosted by the Vocaloid Fanpage, the highest score wins the round.

*Linux Osu! is available as an experimental release or can be run using third party programs such as WINE.

They will be streaming! Help Them help us!

story:
Short Summary

Hey y'all! For anyone new here, my name is Seph Schlueter, and I am an young Christian artist from Ohio. In the summer of 2019, I felt called to start recording and releasing songs I wrote, and I released my first one that fall. The Lord said to keep going, so shortly afterwards, I crowdfunded my next song and released it. That was nearly a year ago. Here's a little snapshot of the things that have happened since:

-I led a new Catholic Worship movement, Damascus Worship movement, to put out our first full album

- We released our first live song/music video shortly after, called "I Believe." 

-I got to go to Texas to write with some awesome people, and am going back to record a song I wrote with them

-I spent a week in Nashville writing and making demos with some super talented writers/producers there

-I had the opportunity to open for Phil Wickham in a 3 day concert in Florida,

-And so much more!

It's been a crazy yet beautiful year in many ways, and I am so excited to begin to show you some of the fruit of what I've been up to in the last year. But, I need your help.

Making a song is expensive, and it's something that I can't do on my own. So, I'm here looking for people interested in helping make this a reality. And to have some fun along the way.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm looking to raise $1,500 for this project. This will cover every step of the song; recording, producing, mixing, mastering, and the marketing of it. I've made a lot of really cool connections in the past months which will allow for this song to really sound better than ever before, but also quality is pricier. 

However, like I said, I want to have some fun with this. And what's more fun than some special perks to go along with supporting a meaningful project, right? (Definitely a few things, but we'll just leave it there for now.) Here are some of the perks for supporting:

$10: Get the song a week early (the "I Liked It Before It Was Cool" perk)

$25: ^ + Exclusive Acoustic Video of Song (The "For All You Visual People Out There" perk)

$50: ^^ + Video Explaining/Teaching Songwriting Process (The "I Like The Behind The Scenes" perk)

$100: ^^^ + Free Merch! (Long-Sleeve Shirt) (The "Boutta Look FLY" perk)

$250: ^^^^ + Demos of 3 Future Songs (The "Ahead Of The Times" perk)

$500: ^^^^^ + In-House/On Campus Worship Night (The "My House Is A Temple" perk)

So. That's pretty fun, right? 

The Impact

I am still so continuously blown away by all the messages I still regularly get about my last song, and how it has changed/still impacts their lives. When I set out to do that song, I had no idea the scope or influence the Lord was about to give it, and I am still in wonder at it all.

So I guess this is the same. To have the chance to write a song that has the opportunity to reach and touch hundreds of thousands of hearts is mind-blowing. But that's the reality of where we're at. That this song can reach hundreds of thousands with the message that despite our circumstances, God is still in control (song title hint? ? ) So your support will directly contribute to that.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you aren't able to contribute financially. But there are other ways you can help:

-Keep this project, this song, and me in your prayers; that God will guide everything from start to finish, and that all will be for His glory.

-Tell other people about it! Maybe you have friends or family who can help. Give them a chance to use their finances to help make a difference.

-Go social! Share it on social media; Instagram, Tik Tok, Facebook, Twitter, etc. (Reddit anyone?). Let's spread the word!

The Lord said to keep going, so shortly afterwards, I crowdfunded my next song and released it. That was nearly a year ago. Here's a little snapshot of the things that have happened since:
-I led a new Catholic Worship movement, Damascus Worship movement, to put out our first full album
- We released our first live song/music video shortly after, called "I Believe." 
-I got to go to Texas to write with some awesome people, and am going back to record a song I wrote with them
-I spent a week in Nashville writing and making demos with some super talented writers/producers there
-I had the opportunity to open for Phil Wickham in a 3 day concert in Florida,
-And so much more!
It's been a crazy yet beautiful year in many ways, and I am so excited to begin to show you some of the fruit of what I've been up to in the last year. But, I need your help.
Making a song is expensive, and it's something that I can't do on my own. So, I'm here looking for people interested in helping make this a reality. And to have some fun along the way.

What We Need & What You Get
I'm looking to raise $1,500 for this project. This will cover every step of the song; recording, producing, mixing, mastering, and the marketing of it. I've made a lot of really cool connections in the past months which will allow for this song to really sound better than ever before, but also quality is pricier. 
However, like I said, I want to have some fun with this. And what's more fun than some special perks to go along with supporting a meaningful project, right? (Definitely a few things, but we'll just leave it there for now.) Here are some of the perks for supporting:
$10: Get the song a week early (the "I Liked It Before It Was Cool" perk)
$25: ^ + Exclusive Acoustic Video of Song (The "For All You Visual People Out There" perk)
$50: ^^ + Video Explaining/Teaching Songwriting Process (The "I Like The Behind The Scenes" perk)
$100: ^^^ + Free Merch! (Long-Sleeve Shirt) (The "Boutta Look FLY" perk)
$250: ^^^^ + Demos of 3 Future Songs (The "Ahead Of The Times" perk)
$500: ^^^^^ + In-House/On Campus Worship Night (The "My House Is A Temple" perk)
So. That's pretty fun, right? 

The Impact
I am still so continuously blown away by all the messages I still regularly get about my last song, and how it has changed/still impacts their lives. When I set out to do that song, I had no idea the scope or influence the Lord was about to give it, and I am still in wonder at it all.
So I guess this is the same. To have the chance to write a song that has the opportunity to reach and touch hundreds of thousands of hearts is mind-blowing. But that's the reality of where we're at. That this song can reach hundreds of thousands with the message that despite our circumstances, God is still in control (song title hint? ? ) So your support will directly contribute to that.

Other Ways You Can Help
Maybe you aren't able to contribute financially. But there are other ways you can help:
-Keep this project, this song, and me in your prayers; that God will guide everything from start to finish, and that all will be for His glory.
-Tell other people about it! Maybe you have friends or family who can help. Give them a chance to use their finances to help make a difference.
-Go social! Share it on social media; Instagram, Tik Tok, Facebook, Twitter, etc. (Reddit anyone?). Let's spread the word!

story:
Waddap!

     Yo! My name is Dillon Vaughan Maurer and I currently live in Atlanta, Ga. I grew up in Jacksonville, Fl, I make rap music, try to be funny, and eat like a king. I need your help putting out a new collection of joints which is another way to say rap songs... and as we head into 2012, I ain't playin!


Nobody Cares, Dillon

     Ummm... yes you do (please!) If you're familiar with 'The Southern Scramble', 'Studies in Hunger' (Produced by Paten Locke) or 'Cupid's Revenge' (Produced by Batsauce), you fuggin love me! Or you hate me...but you're still reading this so...

     Anywho, 'Dillon Ain't Playin' is a collection of (mainly) new joints that I've done with my core team of beat providing accomplices: Paten Locke, Willie Evans Jr., Batsauce, Anthony Accurate, Supa Dave West and Diamond D. In addition, you may hear some rapping from Boog Brown, beats & skratches provided by yours truly, as well as some other people who are better at doing that than I am.


What I Need & What You Get

     Basically, I'm putting this out entirely myself, and being the Earth-type dude that I am, I am putting the CD packaging together by hand (it's recyclable craft board from Portland, hippies) and am stamping the (organic, soy-based) ink artwork on too. I'm only making 300 copies, and i will (probably) write something stupid on each one, so they will be a unique piece of music wielding awesomeness.

     I need money so that I can buy the materials, get the CD's replicated (not duplicated, which is shitty), buy custom rubber stamps, and put all of this together. Of course there's the printing cost of (organic) hoodies and tee-shirts. Artwork, various promotional thangs like stickers, buttons & probably beer. That's just for me though. I will also need money for mixing, mastering, creating and filming music videos, trees, cheap wine, coffee and avocados. And (very) cheap champagne for when all of this is done.


So...thanks for checking me out.

     I appreciate your time and hope that you enjoyed stopping by. If you dig it, do something about it, would ya please?! Also, check out all the cats that I'm working with, and eat a whole lotta vegetables. What up?!

story:
( Gespenst = GERMAN for ghost/spirit/spectre )

The Music:

Whatever I create is inspired by dance, improvisation, by the vast amount of powerful or sensual sounds a string instrument can produce, and by the haunting and colorful images in my musical brain. 

GESPENSTER DANCES will be the soundtrack to four ghosts meeting in the dark and performing an otherworldly dance suite with each other and by themselves, or both. It was performed only once in the chapel of Greenwood Cemetery in Brooklyn and received standing ovations by a very diverse audience of all ages and backgrounds. This incredibly positive feedback inspired me to work towards an album to be released on Halloween 2018. Recording this album - my second after 7 years - will be a big milestone for me personally, the string quartet being the Königsdisziplin (literally: king's discipline) for music composers of any century, and I am already grateful for every contribution to make this sPooky violin music dream of mine a reality.

Speaking of reality, here is the breakdown for what we need to achieve:

$1000 studio + engineer
$1000 mixing + mastering  
$1650 musicians fees
$550 CD printing
$300 indiegogo fees + campaign costs
= $4500

>> This is the minimum amount needed to make this possible. If we raise more, we will be able to record, mix and master a second composition (a duo for 2 violins), promote this album properly without the help of any record label, and release a full length animated music video created by Lazymills.

You:

If you are the contemporary digital type, we will have downloads and personal recordings and messages dedicated to you. Choose:

  • Download 10$
  • the EXCLUSIVE digital package 100$

If you are the music and art loving type, we will have CD's, printed artwork and original signed artwork dedicated to you. Choose:

  • Signed CD + Download $20
  • More POOK music $30
  • the EXCLUSIVE physical package $100
  • the personalized VIP package $300

If you are the personal type, get a personalized VIP package or invite us into your NYC home to play music exclusively for you, solo or string quartet. Choose:

  • the EXCLUSIVE digital package $100
  • the EXCLUSIVE physical package $100
  • the personalized VIP package $300
  • the LIVE experience $400
  • the ultimate LIVE experience $1200

And if you are the hero type, be our producer and appear on the album with your name. Choose:

  • the PRODUCER credit $1500

The Team:
 

 

THE VISUAL ARTIST:
New York City born L.A. based artist Shawna Mills a.k.a. Lazymills has deeply inspired me with her dynamic and fierce art and animations since I met her in 2011. She has been my visual and personal companion ever since, creating the cover for my first album and all promotional material and flyer images. Besides her beautiful art making, she founded her own video game and media production company Soda Monkey and works as a story board artist for Lucas Film and Dreamworks.

THE ENGINEER:
Chris McLaughlin is known for his open and unique approach to sound and his incredible knowledge of recording gear, and after working with him on numerous projects I can say with confidence that I haven't met anyone so dedicated to this art and science in a long time.

THE POOK4TET:
I am lucky to have some of the best improvisers and contemporary string players from the New York music scene on board: Tomoko Omura (violin) has made a name for herself on the Jazz scene for her unique  arrangements of Japanese folk songs, Allyson Clare (viola) has inspired many dance artists with her dramatic approach to interpretation and improvising, and Brian Sanders (cello) is likely one of the most versatile musicians I've ever met, having performed in countless old and new styles.
 

Let's do this:

Only with your contribution, this album will be born!

Feel free to share this campaign with your family and friends, or whoever you think loves beautiful, haunting, sometimes creepy and always honest and contemporary string quartet music.
 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Self-Taught Girl Drummer

I am a self-taught girl drummer. I live in a village not far from Kyiv, the capital of Ukraine. I started drumming when I was 6. I create drum covers of rock and pop songs and put them on my YouTube channel Youtube.com/KateKuziakina

Drums mean to me much more than dolls and games - music is my passion and my toy. I fall asleep with my pink drumsticks more often than with a teddy bear.

In comments to my videos people say that I am very talented and have a bright future. But I know exactly that my drum covers are not perfect yet and there is no future without solid music foundation.

So my biggest dream is to get good music education to create music and videos that people love and that encourage children to learn drumming.

What I Hope to Raise

I hope to take about 10 lessons per month for 10 months. On the average it is 300-350 USD per month - this includes tuition fees, educational materials (textbooks, etc), and drum gear maintenance. So totally with overheads I need 3500 USD.

Why I Need Your Support

  • There is no music school nearby in the radius of ~70 km, especially with the course Drums. Therefore, we have to find a tutor.
  • High tutoring rates: Good tutors (nearest to us) are in the country capital. Their rates are high. Also, add to this the transportation costs to reach the village where we live now.
  • Overheads: Drumheads wear out, plates crack, drumsticks break. To tune drums, we need special tools. Also, we need microphones and equipment for recording videos.
  • Drums and tools are expensive, especially in comparison with local salaries.
  • My parents and my older sister help me very, very much. But it is not so easy to raise three children (I have also a younger syster). 
  • Sometimes friends help us - give me lessons and drum gifts. But that cannot replace the tutor.
  • We minimize our expenses - for example, we shoot and edit videos ourselves.
  • I try to gain some money too. But
  • Videos does NOT give earnings: I make drum covers of rock songs. According to the copyright laws, even if ads are shown, all money goes to the copyright owners. I get NOTHING.

That is why we need additional money. These funds are strictly intended for tuition and drums maintenance.

If We Don't Reach Entire Goal

If we don't reach our entire goal, then the funds will go for paying tuition fees for as many drum lessons as possible. If there's some money left over that cannot be used for tuition (for example, it is less than necessary for 1 lesson), then we will use it for buying drum gear.

Am I a Talent?

You may say: "Hey, girl! Why are you sure that you are a talent? Your Mom that said?" No. I've tried to check it out and won such awards:

  • Finalist of the International Contest of female drummers "Hit Like A Girl", USA, 2016
  • Grand Prix at the International Art Festival "ArtistA", Benalmádena, Spain, October 2016
  • Grand Prix at the Festival of Creative Collectives "Antelope Gold", Kyiv, Ukraine, 2016
  • First place at the International Festival "Christmas star", Vuokatti, Finland, 2017
  • Grand Prix at the International Children's Festival "Golden Dream", Las Vegas, USA, 2017
  • The First Prize at the competition "Wonder Kid" in the nomination "Most Creative Child", Kyiv, Ukraine, 2017

Is It My First Campaing?

This is not our first campaign - the money for the trip to the USA mentioned above we mainly raised here on Indiegogo.

Future of Talent in Your Hands

Helping me, you support a talent. Helping me, you make my dreams come true. Supporting me, you help to eliminate the injustice when people have no equal rights to get education. I do believe that these all make our world a bit better.

Possible Risks

Yes, there is a risk. Its name is procrastination. But thank God I have an older sister and my Dad and Mom. My sister Valerie is my manager. She selects songs to play, films clips, edits videos, and manages social networks. She encourages me and supports me. Due Valerie we have overcome a lot of obstacles. My Dad helps me a lot too. We are a united family. And we are a reliable team to cope with any such risks.

Other Ways You Can Help

I would appreciate it very much if you could

  • Subscribe to my channel Youtube.com/KateKuziakina
  • Share my videos on Facebook, Twitter, and other networks
  • Tell your friends about me and my drum covers
  • Tell other people about my campaign - please use Indiegogo share tools

A huge Thank You for believing in me
Thank you for making my future possible!
May all your dreams come true!

story:
Help Us Reach $3,000 in 3 Days!

We made our goal and we couldn't have done it without each and every one of you. Now we have a new one.

Everyone who donates any amount from August 12th to the end of the campaign on Monday, August 15th will receive a special handmade mystery gift and an unreleased Spark and Echo demo track in addition to the normal perks!

So donate now and help us make this an album to remember.


Cup O' Joy Concert:

We had a fantastic show this past weekend at the Cup O' Joy in Green Bay. We were able to perform all the new things we have been working on, including almost all of the songs from our upcoming album! Thank you to all those who came out and showed their support both with their presence and their donations. Want to hear a song from the album? Click here to listen to a demo of More Than Rubies, a beautiful song by Jonathon. The album version includes Emily on her as-yet-unnamed clarinet!

This Just In:

We are thrilled to announce that renowned musician and producer Jay Foote will be producing this album! You may know him from Welcome Wagon, from one of his many appearances playing bass on every late night talk show, or you may know him from one of his many other gigs.
Learn all about him at www.JayFoote.com.


Our Story

After two years of playing his piano/vocal songs solo in NYC clubs, Jonathon Roberts wanted to play with other musicians.  Meanwhile, his lovely wife (me) was looking for ways to play more music. As we started singing together, our voices magically blended and the spark was lit. When Boris the Bassoon entered the picture, followed by Christopher Robin the Baritone Ukulele and friends, we had a band!

We also have a non-profit for which to play. As ambassadors of good cheer we have performed valiantly through New York City and the wild woods of Wisconsin, spreading our music and telling audiences about Spark and Echo Arts.

Spark and Echo Arts (501(c)3) was founded over a year ago in New York City by Jonathon and I, and is now a community of talented artists and volunteers.  The goal of Spark and Echo Arts is to create a giant multi-disciplinary "illuminated" Bible with a piece of art, music, dance, theater or poetry covering every passage of the Bible.  We create, inspire, support and showcase new art from emerging artists in NYC and beyond.


The Project

A full length album produced in New York City, featuring Spark and Echo the Band. The album will consist of original songs responding to biblical text, written by Jonathon Roberts. The core of the band is Jonathon Roberts on vocals and piano, and me (Emily Clare Zempel) on vocals, bassoon, baritone ukulele, Melodica and clarinet. For the album we will be joined by some of the fabulous musicians we have connected with through the Spark and Echo Arts community.  The album will be rehearsed this summer, followed by recording sessions and a release in the Fall.   


The Impact

At www.SparkAndEcho.org you can already listen to many of Jonathon’s songs that have been recorded as demos. By making a professionally produced album we will raise the quality of music on our website and spread awareness about the great work by some amazing artists that is coming out of Spark and Echo Arts.  

Spark and Echo Arts was started by a generous founding grant and individual donations from supporters like you.  We've done well our first year featuring work covering over 500 passages in the Bible and holding many live events. To continue sustaining this pace we need to develop new income streams. This album will be a fun, inspiring way to keep the non-profit running effectively. Once the album is released all income from CD sales will go directly to Spark and Echo Arts, helping us continue supporting the artistic community around us.


What We Need

Our budget is $6,500, of which we have already raised $4,000 through individual donations. We’re hoping you can help us raise the last $2,500 to make this an album of competitive quality and to get it out to the public.

The costs involved include paying our producer, booking studio time, hiring an engineer, hiring additional musicians, mixing, mastering, duplicating, and marketing.

If we don’t reach our fundraising goal, we will still make an album, but it will be less likely that the album will help make our non-profit sustainable, and we will not have the money to reach our audience.

We worked hard crafting some great perks for your donations. Be sure to check them out! Remember, even a donation of $5 can make a difference.

And since we're a non-profit, all donations made through PayPal are deductible! (You don't need a PayPal account).

Other Ways You Can Help

The best way you can help, apart from your generous donations, is to spread the word about this campaign and Spark and Echo Arts!

Please share the campaign via the social media links above, and check out our website www.SparkAndEcho.org



Thanks for all your help, we couldn't do it without you!

Emily Clare Zempel

By making a professionally produced album we will raise the quality of music on our website and spread awareness about the great work by some amazing artists that is coming out of Spark and Echo Arts.  

Spark and Echo Arts was started by a generous founding grant and individual donations from supporters like you.  We've done well our first year featuring work covering over 500 passages in the Bible and holding many live events. To continue sustaining this pace we need to develop new income streams. This album will be a fun, inspiring way to keep the non-profit running effectively. Once the album is released all income from CD sales will go directly to Spark and Echo Arts, helping us continue supporting the artistic community around us. 
What We Need 
Our budget is $6,500, of which we have already raised $4,000 through individual donations. We’re hoping you can help us raise the last $2,500 to make this an album of competitive quality and to get it out to the public. 

The costs involved include paying our producer, booking studio time, hiring an engineer, hiring additional musicians, mixing, mastering, duplicating, and marketing. 


If we don’t reach our fundraising goal, we will still make an album, but it will be less likely that the album will help make our non-profit sustainable, and we will not have the money to reach our audience. 


We worked hard crafting some great perks for your donations. Be sure to check them out! Remember, even a donation of $5 can make a difference. 

And since we're a non-profit, all donations made through PayPal are deductible! (You don't need a PayPal account). 
Other Ways You Can Help
The best way you can help, apart from your generous donations, is to spread the word about this campaign and Spark and Echo Arts! 

Please share the campaign via the social media links above, and check out our website www.SparkAndEcho.org

Thanks for all your help, we couldn't do it without you!
Emily Clare Zempel

story:
Background

Music is one of the most complex and difficult to study of all disciplines. A variety of learners study from their childhood. One of the barriers they have to come across is, how to remember so many sheet music more than 10 pages?

Of course, you can play with sheet music. However, it must be disruptive that a few sheets drop out when a pianist turns pages during the playing. To avoid this happening in a grand concert, some musicians even hire an assistant to turn pages for them.

"It is surprisingly difficult to find reliable people to assist in live concert page-turning." Some musicians complained.

"On slower pieces I can usually do it, but I'm playing a fairly quick piece now and I basically cannot find a convenient time to flip the page while playing." A beginner sadly said.

"I  was so worried to miss a beat so I flipped the pages fast until I ripped down a page." A child lowered his head.

So, what can we do with these embarrassing things?

No matter you are an amateur or a professional, Boox Blue can let you enjoy your music without page flipping issue.

  

 

Boox Blue

Boox Blue is a wireless pedal specifically used for flipping digital sheet music, which can free your hands and lets you dive into playing music. 

 

Minimalist Design

By virtue of the minimalist design of its appearance and practical feature, the Boox Blue wins Red Dot Design Award 2019. The combination of metal button and black base makes it premium and durable. The Red Dot Design Award is an international product design and communication design prize awarded by the Design Zentrum Nordrhein Westfalen in Essen, Germany.

 

Prompt Interaction

The Boox Blue is specifically designed as a perfect partner for Boox Max 2. It has a capacity of promptly interacting with Max 2 with a wireless connection. The friendly pedal plate allows you to turn to the previous or next page by a solid press.
 

 

 

Skid-resistant Design 

The Skid-resistant base helps to prevent slipping and sliding during use, which makes sure your play goes well without any accident.

 

Compatibility

It not only works perfectly with Boox eReaders, but also compatible with Android and Apple devices. Choose from 4 default key modes that cover most Android and Apple apps. 

 

Easy Pairing

Pairing your device is easy. You can do it just like you pair a general Bluetooth device to your mobile phone.

 

The most compatible device -- Boox Max 2

Boox Max 2 is one of the largest devices in Boox eReader lineup. As an eReader, it does win a great reputation from thousands of customers as a result of its peerless paperlike reading experience.

 

Glare-Free

Boox Max 2 Adopts glare-free E-ink screen technology that it is readable from any angle. And players are able to view sheet music even under stage lighting. 

 

A4 Paper Size

Same size as A4 paper size E-ink screen that represents authentic music sheet effect. Read music sheet in full size without zooming in and out. 

 

Take notes on sheet music

Easily take notes on sheet music anytime. As a  player, you may want to mark down what you think and what you feel to a melody. Do it!

 

Low power consumption

One of the most outstanding features of E-ink is long battery life. E-ink screen only consumes power when something changes on screens. So compared to the general tablets, you do not have to worry about its power suddenly drains in a live concert.

 

Timeline

The prototype of the Boox Blue has been done. We will start the manufacture as soon as the end of the campaign. The scheduled shipment will begin by the end of Oct 2019. 

 

Specification

Size: 252.46*97.67*37.17mm

Weight: 370g

Effective Distance: 10m

Battery Capacity: 400mAh

Battery Life: 90 days (standby mode)

Port: USB Type-C

BT Version: BLE 5.0

Screen: 13.3"  Mobius E-ink display

Resolution: 2200 x 1650 pix (207PPI)

Cores: Quad-core  1.6 GHz CPU

RAM: 2GB

Capacity: 32GB

Touch: Capacitive touch + Electromagnetic pen touch（WACOM）

Dimension: 325x237x7.5 mm

Weight: ≤ 550g

Battery Capacity: 4100mAh

Battery Life: Up to 4 weeks (standby mode)

Port: Micro USB

Wireless: WiFi + BT 4.1

story:
UPDATE: 7/20/2012: We reached our goal last night and this morning our facebook page was deleted as well. Almost as if they were watching. Things have escalted and we need to take it to court. We need to raise more money to do that, Please help!! Thank you! 

 

PROTECT THE INDEPENDENT. SAVE THE MUSIC.

 

Hello!

We're Trap House Rave! an independent experimental rock band from Cleveland, Ohio. Long story short, someone owns the trademark rights to "Trap House" (however they actually own"TrappHouse"), an obvious part of our band name, and they have been getting our videos deleted from youtube, and our entire pages and content removed from sites like reverbnation.com and last.fm, among others.

We've contacted a legal team and they told us that we need to trademark our band name as it's own entity, at which time the deletions and cease and desist orders will have to stop. Until then we are riding a luck train through Searchville trying not to get spotted and deleted.

In order to file for the trademark and copyright everything we've done so far - and will do in the future - it will cost approx. $535.00. This wouldn't normally be that big of a deal for us, however, over the past year and a half we've put every extra cent we had into the production, recording and promotion of our new album, "CONTAGIOUS!" which was slated for release in August.

We originally intended to get physical pressings made, but with all of this happening at once we won't be able to afford it. Furthermore, if we don't have everything trademarked with copyrights in place upon it's release, we're in line for more legal issues. Any money we raise, over our goal of $500.00 will go into getting more copies of our album pressed and distributed.  

Anyone that donates $5.00 or more will recieve a digital copy of the album upon it's release. $15.00 or more gets a physical copy of the new album and our entire library thus far in digital form. That's only one small way that we can and will say thank you.

This music video had over 20,000 hits on youtube. Now it's gone.
This is the email we got from reverbnation letting us know that our account, of 3 years was deleted. 25,000+ fans, all of our show history, press, band information.. everything. - GONE.
This is the email that the company sent Kolgate after he messaged them to see why they were claiming infringement.

We just want to have fun, make music and share it with the world. Please help us do that without throwing away everything we've worked so hard to build.

story:
Hello,

My name is Hillary Esqueda. I am writing on behalf of a small, but powerful opera company in NYC called OperaOggiNY. I have worked as a singer for OperaOggiNY for over a year, and I have now been given the chance to direct their winter performance, Englebert Humperdinck's Hansel and Gretel.

OperaOggiNY is a rare and magical company run by singers. Our goal is to bring opera to the people in their own communities by creating portable productions that we tour within the tri-state area. We foster the talent of many young singers and accompanists through our productions, and urge our singers to use their many different talents towards putting together a full production in whatever locale we inhabit.

Though we have tried our best to gain a following, our company is still struggling to put together productions with little to no budget. Our gala fundraiser was scheduled for November 4th in Soho, and had to be canceled due to the flooding following Hurricane Sandy, leaving us with no way of collecting funds for Hansel and Gretel.

We are not asking for a lot. We are just asking that you donate what you can to help us get the bare necessities for this show. Anything collected beyond the costs of this production will be donated directly to OperaOggiNY to fund our future productions. We understand that in these times, donating is not easy, but just as we have always worked as a team, I urge you to, as well. If everyone who sees this donates 5 or 10 dollars, we will reach our goal in no time. 

However, if you DO chose to give more, we can offer you a few perks as our way of saying Thank You!

-For a donation of $75 you can claim 1 ticket to a performance of Hansel and Gretel.

-For a donation of $150 you can claim 2 tickets to a performance of Hansel and Gretel.

-And if you are very generous and make a donation of $500, you can schedule a 45 minute concert with our singers in your own home!

These Perks are only available to those in the Tristate area (approximately a 60 mile radius around NYC), or those visiting the NYC area for the performance. In the case of the concert, you must arrange your concert by January 31, 2013. For tickets, please donate at least 48 hours before the date you wish to attend.

(If you would just like to buy advanced tickets, please visit operaogginy.info for more information on dates and times!)

We thank you for your support!

story:
What is Hospital Heroes?

Hospital Heroes is an exciting new charitable endeavor in which I, Dustin Dorough, will be hitting the road to visit at least one children's hospital in every one of the 48 continental United States and at least three Canadian provinces while wearing my movie quality Superman uniforms.

During these visits, the children will receive:

  • An autographed 8x10 picture of Superman (Thanks to Superhero Photography by Adam Jay www.superherophotography.co.uk )
  • A "Certificate of Heroism" in recognition for the bravery exhibited in their personal struggles and all those that they have been able to inspire with their strength in fighting their illnesses.
  • Various items donated by businesses around the country (Children's books, comics, blankets, toys, etc.)
  • A chat with the "real" Superman, photo opportunities, etc. I will be 100% in character the entire time.
  • The most important thing a hero can give: Hope.

Who is Dustin Dorough?

I'm a 25 year old Superman fan, actor, costumer and general do-gooder. I've been active in the costuming community since 2007, though I was born on Halloween, so I've been wearing costumes most of my life. I'm just a comic nerd who wants to share the joy that my heroes brought to me as a child with a younger generation. When I'm not wearing spandex, you can find me working as an emcee for the Spartan Race series (www.spartanrace.com).

Didn't you already have a fundraiser?

Why yes, I did! Though, while trying to be EXTRA frugal, I accidentally underestimated the expenses. As the tour has grown, so have the costs associated with it. Not all of the gifts for the children are donated and most of it has to be paid for. I'm going to be visiting multiple thousands of children while on this tour and I don't want any of them to be left behind.

Also, since the original fundraiser began, prices on many essential items (especially fuel costs) have risen significantly. I'm holding this secondary fundraiser to make sure that I don't get stranded in the middle of the desert with no fuel, haha.

These updated costs still do NOT include lodging. In order to keep the costs down for the donors, I have opted to sleep in my car for the entire trip and to shower using my nationwide LA Fitness membership. Hopefully there will be some nice people who offer their sofas along the way, but I'm trying not to rely on it. I just want this tour to happen no matter what inconveniences I have to endure.

If I DON'T meet the fundraising goal, then the trip will just take longer. I AM going to visit these kids if I have to wait for my paychecks to come in while I'm on the road and pay for this out-of-pocket. Your donation would just make things much smoother for everyone involved.

Why are you doing this?

I'm going on this trip to brighten the lives of thousands of children who are in such desperate need of hope. I feel that the most important duty of any superhero is not so much saving people directly, but rather in inspiring them to save themselves.

The character of Superman has had a profound impact on my life and the way I view the world. He's a man with the power to rule the world, but instead chooses to serve it. He lost his home planet, but chooses to protect ours. He has every reason to be angry, but he lives to inspire others with the sheer power of hope. I feel like Superman is exactly what these kids need when dealing with such intense struggles of their own.

I also often see individuals who truly wish to do great things for others in the most selfless of ways, but unfortunately we live in a world where kindness is immediately cause for ridicule. Far too often do I see someone with good intentions hold back for fear of embarrassment. As part of this tour, I want to help inspire all those who hear of it to remind them that old-fashioned kindness still has a place in the modern world. I want to remind them that it's still okay to be a good person.

How can I help?

Monetary donations are certainly appreciated, but I do fully understand that times are tough for a lot of people and they might not be able to give as freely as they would like to.

I will be setting up a P.O. Box next week so that I will be able to receive tangible donations as well. Useful things would be gift cards you hadn't planned on using, gas cards, etc. You can also just send me a letter if you wish.

You can find a list of other ways to help on my Facebook page here: http://www.facebook.com/notes/dustin-dorough-official/hospital-heroes-how-you-can-help/10151047509598798

Right now, the most important thing is getting the word out and sharing this Indiegogo page with as many people as you can. The more traffic this site gets, the more likely that I will be able to go on this journey to help these kids.

I want to know more!

Good! I'm glad you're interested. You can find plenty of information, updates, pictures, videos and other assorted goodies at the following websites:

www.facebook.com/dustindoroughofficial

www.dustindorough.com/hospitalheroes (Currently down for repairs)

You might also enjoy this list of websites on which the Hospital Heroes project has been featured. A few of them include interviews!

http://victoriacosplay.blogspot.com/2012/08/hospital-heroes-tour-with-dustin-dorough.html

http://geeklisted.com/2012/hospital-heroes-supermans-charity-tour

http://www.cosplayinamerica.com/2012/08/dustin-doroughs-hospital-heroes-tour.html

http://nerdcaliber.com/a-man-of-steel-support-dustin-doroughs-hospital-heroes-project/

http://www.comicbookmovie.com/fansites/SuperHeroStuff/news/?a=65855

A personal message from Dustin:

Thank you all so much for your interest in this campaign as well as the utterly amazing amount of support that you've given. It can be so overwhelming to deal with the stresses of planning a trip like this on my own, so every kind word any of you has given me has helped to inspire me to have the strength to move forward. I'll never have enough words to thank you for that.

Let's go change the world.

A few of them include interviews!http://victoriacosplay.blogspot.com/2012/08/hospital-heroes-tour-with-dustin-dorough.htmlhttp://geeklisted.com/2012/hospital-heroes-supermans-charity-tourhttp://www.cosplayinamerica.com/2012/08/dustin-doroughs-hospital-heroes-tour.htmlhttp://nerdcaliber.com/a-man-of-steel-support-dustin-doroughs-hospital-heroes-project/http://www.comicbookmovie.com/fansites/SuperHeroStuff/news/?a=65855

story:
Six Solo Violin Sonatas(*2) and Partitas


A true artist cannot live in isolation, but I think it would be wrong to state—as many classical musicians seem to have claimed—that a classical musician must live with or even around other classical musicians. If the true artist is living with their Beloved—whoever and whatever that is—and amongst his fellow human beings—then I think those conditions are enough for him to make his art; the truth being that all human beings have within them the capacity of true artistry, and that to live with one’s Beloved is to live with and amongst one’s True Self… which the artist then comes to realize is everywhere, permeates all things, and is in all beings.

This is especially true of the soloist, as I think it has been for soloists throughout history, when I reflect upon the teachings of my musical training. My name is Paul Yeager, and I’m a 32 year old classically trained virtuoso solo violinist. The above video is me performing Eugéne Ysaÿe’s Third Solo Violin Sonata entitled “Ballade” in a concert I gave at Old First Church, San Francisco, in 2009. Yes, that was me performing 20th century atonal classical music in a zebra pimp jacket from Amsterdam, in a church. ;)

My Musical Background


I’ve been studying music and practicing the classical violin since I was five years old, and my first teacher was my mother. My family, though not financially wealthy like many families of classical musicians I’ve known, is from a culturally rich American-European classical music background. I play on a violin which was handed down through the family, which was played on by a great-grandmother with equally-fast fingers apparently. I also had one ancestor who played for a brief time in the courts of a German emperor. My more immediate genetic lineage is littered with European orally-transmitted/“folk” and liturgical music from the protestant and German Evangelical traditions as well as being influenced by "big band."“ Sometime in the late 19th-20th century, all that transformed into much more than a democratic majority of both sides of my family being able to read music from the staff (vs. playing by ear). That flowered into a deep appreciation for being educated and spreading education in the classical arts in general, throughout the 20th century, starting with all my great-grandparents and their children, and all that was ultimately and finally transmitted to me. I don’t come from gypsies or Jews strangely (although there’s one or two in the genealogy, however covertly), but I do come from… I guess we might just call it: “a diaspora of high Bohemianism.”

Out of those genes, and my mother teaching violin from the time I was in the womb, I eventually asked when I was 3.5 years old for a “vah-vhan” (my three year old word for “violin”) and it was obvious to my parents what I was asking for. My mother gave me a plastic toy violin to satiate my childish and heartfelt desire, since she knew I was at risk of breaking a real one at that age, so it was later I got a real one when I was five (I had just turned six in the pic below).

If this were program notes at a classical performance venue—which it’s obviously not—I might continue on here to list all my influential teachers beginning with my mother and ending with some of the classical greats with whom I was fortunate enough to have musical contact, and/or concluding with the fact that I am a certified, registered, and otherwise credentialed Bachelor of Music with supposedly lofty academic connections, but let’s face it; none of that means anything to the new and glorious age I’m grateful to be alive in.

Why I Am Here on Indiegogo


I’m a former child prodigy with admittedly some burned bridges in the small-and-insular world of classical music, where you the reader might be quite surprised to know is/was as political as a House of Cards, only sometimes more brutal! I witnessed while growing up a great and sometimes very painful distance between all those hours I spent giving my passion and dedication over the last nearly-three decades for the music I so deeply love VS. the political forces of "high culture" which seem to dominate access to the classical stage and recording industry, almost as if "the limelight" is a territory fought over by the noble lords of feudal Europe vs. awarded according to passion, skill, and work, as many other vocations are in our 21st global century (i.e. see this link to a CD of my Giornovichi Concerto #1 , or this link to my Giornovichi Concertos #'s 3 and 9 , or this one to my premier of an atonal 20th century work "Transformations" by Gerhard Samuel as examples of CD recordings I made between the ages of 12-14 for which I've yet to receive any royalties).

I'm excited to be making my request here on Indiegogo, not only because I'm excited about the opportunity to finally record and sustainably distribute my life's solo works (and with the adult musical maturity I know I now fully possess), but also because I see crowdfunding as a way to heal a serious cultural disparity in the world. That healing I believe, just like the beautiful and rich classical music tradition I carry in my musical identity, is actually the rightful property and privilege of all humankind, and that's why I've been so happy to take part in funding classical musicians via crowdfunding on occasion myself as well! In short, I believe this new funding mechanism inherently shares and embraces my ultimate ideal of classical music becoming universally accessible, and is a great mechanism for achieving that ideal in the world.

The Virtuoso Will Return With Your Help


I played as a soloist in front of many symphony orchestras between the ages of eight and fourteen, such as I was below playing Pablo de Sarasate’s “Zigeunerweisen” when I was ten with the Indianapolis Symphony, as a result of winning their solo competition:


I also played here when I was a little older (12-14, somewhere in there), playing Max Bruch’s “Scottish Fantasy” with the Northern Kentucky Symphony (click on to youtube to continue watching through all five movements):


I haven’t even nearly devoted my whole life to music, which many people have found saddening, and a lot of people would say I wasted a big part of my life, especially in my twenties between the beginning and end of my “college days.” But, I will just note that mostly I was having a blast and working hard—however temporarily—at my “live fast, die young” motto of those times. ;p

Now I’m [A LOT] more balanced and have a deep appreciation for the smaller pleasures of life. I’m also newly married to a beautiful and nurturing woman from Northeast India and live in a place I’m proud to call my new home, Bangkok, Thailand. I’m again getting serious about the core/transcendent purpose(s) of my life, let's just say: after some minor bad blows in my home country (America) regarding my ability to live there with my goddess. I’m lucky, fortunate, and otherwise blessed enough to know exactly what the first of all of those possible transcendent purposes is at this very moment, and that’s why I’m here to try and get this one the fuel it’s gonna need to burn on past… hopefully, my own mortal frame or even those of future generations!

“EXACTLY WHAT MUSIC IS HE TALKING ABOUT?”

...you’re hopefully now itching to know…


Recordings of:

  • My Six J.S. Bach Sonatas and Partitas
  • My Six Eugéne Ysaÿe Sonatas.
This is an amount of music any classical violinist would agree is a massive undertaking to record. This will require three Discs/compilations, two in a box for the Bach (“Box for the Bach”—hm, maybe that should be its name) and one for the Six Ysaÿes. I will need to re-immerse myself in daily 8+ hour/day practice sessions for several months in order to achieve this recording feat -to-snuff, while devoting funding towards an epic amount of time in the professional recording studio amidst. And then there's distribution. Regarding distribution, I aim to get the music not only into “more mainstream” channels like iTunes and Amazon, but also where it needs to go to poor and starving people in developing countries where I believe my music specifically and desperately needs to be heard (i.e. via mobilizable organizations I may be able to work with who could potentially leverage that), --and I will also note-- into channels where the music can be consumed more sustainably regardless of even whatever "force majeure" sorta events may be likely to occur globally in the 21st century (i.e. via non-fiat currencies like the Swedish kronar or others with sturdy backings, or via electronic currencies where legality abides).

Impacts of Your Donation


Perhaps I'm thinking a tad like a megalomaniac for a minute here (please forgive me if that's the case but I want this is to be perfectly clear in terms of the extent of the Impacts I am aiming for), I’m aiming to get the recordings into channels where I can feel reasonably reassured that if someday, extraterrestrials come to planet earth to dig up the archeological remains of the human race long after it’s destroyed itself, that they might even find my recordings of the J.S. Bach Sonatas and Partitas and Ysaÿe Sonatas, thus adding to their conclusion that human beings “weren’t all bad”… in fact they might even find the CD liner notes where I’ll be making mystical-sounding annotations such as noting the fact that Bach inscribed on every one of his manuscripts “to the glory of God alone,” leaving the aliens wondering why all human beings' didn't develop more in that kind of mystical-creative-immersive direction in their lives, since the music is, well, so pleasurably satisfying to listen to and to create.

Or, perhaps my recordings might have something to do with preventing the destruction of humankind altogether in ways I can't understand or predict! As my mother used to say, “music makes the world go round.” And maybe she was somehow more right than she realized.

Incentives and Perks


SO, here’s some ueber-incentives and perks to funding this:

  • By giving $50 USD you’re hereby guaranteed—regarding all three CDs of this monumental amount of solo violin music I will have manifested before 2014 is out—that you will receive all of it First amongst all my funders, and Free of Charge.
  • By giving $25, you’ll receive one of those CDs, my Six Eugéne Ysaÿe Sonatas.
  • By giving $10, you will be my friend until and after I am dead and your email will be added to my VIP list.
  • By giving $5 or more, you will be invited to some huge private party on a tropical island, which might then belong solely to me or some organization in which I am incremental (as a result of the upward spiral you’re no doubt helping into motion by making a donation here), in the year 2023. Of course, we all also have to work at stopping climate change, for this to actually happen.
  • By giving even $1, you are affirming that my life’s deepest work in classical music has not gone to waste, as a mantra, and that’s how my wife will feel about it too;

Thanks a Million,
Paul

story:
Summary

Hello!  We are Auditory Armory, a band out of Altamonte Springs, Florida; welcome to our IndieGoGo Fundraiser page!

Our band draws from many genres of music, including progressive, jazz, alternative, metal, rock, blues, new age, funk, and classical.  Auditory Armory started in 2010 as a solo project of vocalist and guitarist April Montallana.  Starting in 2011 with the help of her boyfriend Justice Maynard and friends Oscar Garcia and Dennis Burns, the project has evolved into a full band and has been getting the attention of listeners in the Central Florida scene and challenging the notion of what a female-fronted rock band can be.

"The Awakening" is Auditory Armory's first full-length album as a full band and was recorded by Alex Spradling at Alpaca Ranch Recording in Winter Park, Florida and mastered by Chris Jay in Orlando.  Up until this point, we have funded everything ourselves and really need YOUR help to get this album into your hands!  Your contribution will allow us to package the album and distribute the album to the whole world.  As you may know, the music industry is not what it used to be.  It is an extremely competitive market where local musicians and bands all over the world have to fund everything independently, most times without the help of a label.  Luckily, with the advent of technology, crowdfunding websites allow fans of art and music to help fund the bands that they love.  Please help us carve our own niche in the music world!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $950 to get our cd duplication done from Discmakers.  This means the packaging of the full-color digipak album, digital download cards, and distribution on cdBaby, iTunes, Amazon, Pandora, etc.  This money will also help us finalize any additional artwork for the album and additional merchandise.  See the awesome perks of contribution on the right of this page or watch our video above!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this moment, you can still help us by sharing our IGG campaign with friends & family as well as liking and sharing our Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/auditoryarmory


THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Hello everyone!! We are a modern rock band from the heartland... Omaha, Ne... WE ARE EMPHATIC!!!  We have had 4 songs in the top 40 on the rock charts, sold thousands of records and haven't made a penny on sales. Our last deal ended with a low life greedy thief stealing money, destroying a label imprint and making it near impossible to get our record back.  We worked hard for months day and night away from our families to give you something we were proud of.... however, every time you buy a record or purchase a download 100% of that is going straight into one mans pocket while we are left to figure out how to keep the lights on.  We do this for the love of the music and with the hope that we may have a positive impact on peoples lives... We have been blessed to meet so many amazing people along the way, seen so many increadible places and have lived our dream of being on stage. We have seen the beauty of what music can do for people and we have seen the ugly face of a person that can destroy it all in a single breath. We have learned what not to do and thats why we have recently signed a new  "partnership"  deal with Pavement Entertainment.  We have learned that the only way to survive in this business is to go into every venture as partners... share responsibilities and share the potential rewards of working hard.   

So, instead of going hundreds of thousands of dollars in debt with a label, giving them ownership of our music and agreeing to let them control everything we decided a better option would be to do this record with you!  We're not just asking you to hand over your hard earned money, we're offering some one of a kind unique items in return for donations so we can raise the money do the record we have alway wanted to do... a record that has no boundries, no higher ups calling the shots, no strings attached... well except for on the guitars but you get the idea.  We need to raise as much money as possible to pay for the record and future touring but we are setting a goal of $25,000.

There are many important things deserving of funding in this world and honestly many far more important than this... but imagine a world without music... scary.  Music has had an impact on so many peoples lives and we have always done everything in our power to create something special for people to connect with.  By contributing to this campaign you will be helping more than just this band, you will be helping many others through music.
