story:
Twin Cities 4th Annual Roots, Rock and Deep Blues Festival

Patrick's Cabaret needs YOUR help to put on this amazing festival!

"Best Rock Festival 2014" as named by City Pages and "Best Block Party 2014" as named by Minneapolis Star Tribune

Patrick's Cabaret is a unique, non-profit arts organization in South Minneapolis, committed to supporting artists in their growth and development. For 28 years, we have encouraged a diverse range of artists to take risks and push boundaries. For 28 years, our audiences have helped us hold the space to make sure every artist has a stage to call their own. We especially reach out to local artists, artists of color, GLBTQ-identified artists, and those with disabilities.

For the past three years, Patrick's Cabaret has presented the Twin Cities Roots, Rock and Deep Blues Festival - a fundraiser to support our programming throughout the year, ensuring that we can keep our doors open and our stage available to artists of all backgrounds, cultures, experience levels and artistic disciplines.

This year's Twin Cities Roots, Rock and Deep Blues Festival will take place July 19, 2014, and will feature an impressive array of local, regional and national musical acts on multiple stages at Patrick's Cabaret and the neighboring Harriet Brewing. With visual artists selling their goods, food trucks lining the street, and performers mingling with the crowd, it's an urban festival with a neighborhood feel.

And because of our reputation for supporting emerging artists, many of the festival's past headliners have performed for much less than they would normally get paid. It's their way of giving back. They understand that Patrick's Cabaret has awfully big dreams for such a small organization. They understand that we need all the help we can get to pull off an event this big.

Here is a sample of some of the bands that will be performing at this year's festival:

Sonny Knight & the Lakers

Black Eyed Snakes 

Kent Burnside & the New Generation (MS)

Black Market Brass 

Crankshaft & The Gear Grinders

Erik Koskinen

i like you

Mrs Glass (TX)

Carson McHone (TX)

Spider John Koerner 

Eleganza

Mike Gunther

The 757's

The Flood Brothers (MO)

Black Diet

Molly Maher

Joe & Vicky Price (IA)

Kitten Forever

Ben Balinger (TX)

Nikki & The Ruemates

Molly Dean

The Dead Pigeons 

Dirt Road Ramblers 

There are more to come! Stay tuned!

If these bands interest you, a $20 donation or higher will reserve your spot at this year's festival!

What We Will Use the Funds For

We need $10,000 to reach our goal! We will use this money for performers, rent tents, stages, permits, ice, road blocks, tickets, printing, and everything else that goes into mounting a production of this scale.

The money raised from the festival will be used to support programming at Patrick's Cabaret throughout the year. It will help us continue to showcase artists who challenge, provoke and inspire, and provide audiences access to vibrant, diverse and uncensored performances.

And that's where YOU come in! Help us put on the best outdoor music festival of the summer,  and you'll not only receive our undying gratitude, but we'll show you all kinds of appreciation!

Perks for Patrons of the Arts

A Drop in the Bucket (EVERY dollar helps!)

$1-4 earns you:

  • Our sincere, heartfelt thanks and a warm, fuzzy feeling. Far out, man!

A Root

$5-9 earns you:

  • Our heartfelt thanks and a warm, fuzzy feeling
  • Plus a music download from the upcoming Live! at Patrick's Cabaret CD. Dig it!

Audience Whistler

$10-19 earns you:

  • Our heartfelt thanks
  • A music download from the Live! at Patrick's Cabaret CD
  • Plus a ticket for two bottles of water from our Lounge at any show at Patrick's Cabaret. Refreshing!

Cohort

$20-24 earns you:

  • Our heartfelt thanks
  • A music download from the Live! at Patrick's Cabaret CD
  • Plus ONE ticket to the Twin Cities Roots, Rock and Deep Blues Festival July 19th. Shake it!

Testifier

$25-49 earns you:

  • Our heartfelt thanks
  • A music download from the Live! at Patrick's Cabaret CD
  • One ticket to the Festival
  • Plus your name in the program and on the Great Mural of Thanks! Testify!

Mojo Maker

$50-74 earns you:

  • Our heartfelt thanks
  • Your name in the program and on the Great Mural of Thanks
  • The ENTIRE Live! at Patrick's Cabaret CD
  • TWO tickets to the Festival
  • Plus two tickets to any upcoming Patrick's Cabaret Presents show!

Enabler

$75-99 earns you:

  • Our heartfelt thanks
  • Two tickets to the Festival
  • The Live! at Patrick's Cabaret CD
  • Your name in the program and on the Great Mural of Thanks
  • Two tickets to any upcoming Patrick's Cabaret Presents show
  • Plus two tickets to any of Patrick's Cabaret monthly Singer Songwriter Series, where we turn down the lights and get intimate. Sultry!

Big Bad Back-Up Buddy

$100-149 earns you:

  • Our heartfelt thanks
  • Two tickets to the Festival
  • The Live! at Patrick's Cabaret CD
  • Your name in the program and on the Great Mural of Thanks
  • Two tickets to any upcoming Patrick's Cabaret Presents show
  • Two tickets to any of Patrick's Cabaret monthly Singer Songwriter Series
  • Plus two beverage tickets
  • Plus you'll get a call out from the main stage right before the headliner cranks it up! Feel the love!

Bluesy Impresario

$150-199 earns you:

  • Our heartfelt thanks
  • Two tickets to the Festival
  • The Live! at Patrick's Cabaret CD
  • Your name in the program and on the Great Mural of Thanks
  • Two tickets to any upcoming Patrick's Cabaret Presents show
  • Two beverage tickets
  • A call out from the main stage
  • AND - instead of two tickets - you get a transferable, eight-punch ticket for any of our monthly Singer Songwriter programs. Yeah! That's what we're talking about!

Back-Up Singer

$200-299 earns you:

  • Our heartfelt thanks
  • FOUR tickets to the Festival
  • The Live! at Patrick's Cabaret CD
  • Your name in the program and on the Great Mural of Thanks
  • Two tickets to any upcoming Patrick's Cabaret Presents show
  • Two beverage tickets
  • A call out from the main stage
  • An eight-punch ticket for any of our monthly Singer Songwriter programs
  • Plus a limited edition Roots poster signed by three featured musicians
  • Plus - what the hell - go ahead and crash the green room to mingle with the performers and grab a slice of pizza. Enjoy the perks of being a star without the hassle of the sound check or wondering where the roadies went!

Co-Producer

$300-499 earns you:

  • Our heartfelt thanks
  • Four tickets to the Festival
  • The Live! at Patrick's Cabaret CD
  • Your name in the program and on the Great Mural of Thanks
  • Two tickets to any upcoming Patrick's Cabaret Presents show
  • Two beverage tickets
  • A call out from the main stage
  • TWO eight-punch ticket for our monthly Singer Songwriter programs
  • A limited edition Roots poster signed by three featured musicians
  • Access to the green room
  • Plus a special, private brunch for two at Patrick's Cabaret. If doing this is wrong, I don't want to be a writer! Ha! I love those crazy lyrics!

Master of the Universe

$500+ earns you:

  • Our heartfelt thanks
  • Four tickets to the Festival
  • The Live! at Patrick's Cabaret CD
  • Your name in the program and on the Great Mural of Thanks
  • Two tickets to any upcoming Patrick's Cabaret Presents show
  • Two beverage tickets
  • A call out from the main stage
  • Two eight-punch ticket for our monthly Singer Songwriter programs
  • A limited edition Roots poster signed by three featured musicians
  • Access to the green room
  • Private brunch for two at Patrick's Cabaret
  • Plus seventy minutes of stellar musical and comedy/spoken word entertainment at your next party of event (from among Patrick's stable of maniacs - and maniacs are rarely stable!). Hell, at this level, you can sit on the stage throughout the whole show if you want! We'll run to the green room to get pizza for you! We'll name one of the Porta Potties after you with wildly appreciative and respectful signage! At $500, we'll give you practically anything you want. Honest!


Earlier this month, the Twin Cities Roots, Rock and Deep Blues Festival was named City Pages "Best Rock Festival," an incredible honor given the grassroots nature of our event. Here's what City Pages had to say about it:


"We didn't have a single quibble with this past summer's Twin Cities Roots, Rock and Deep Blues Festival ... Nearly 30 artists performed on four stages in and around Harriet Brewing, Patrick's Cabaret, and Mosaic Cafe near the intersection of Lake and Minnehaha in South Minneapolis for the third annual event ... We don't know what's on tap for this summer's festival yet, but we'd bet on another version of a perfect Minneapolis summer day."


So there you have it. We're small, but we dream big. And we need your help to make this festival the best it can be.
story_txt:
Twin Cities 4th Annual Roots, Rock and Deep Blues FestivalPatrick's Cabaret needs YOUR help to put on this amazing festival!"Best Rock Festival 2014" as named by City Pages and "Best Block Party 2014" as named by Minneapolis Star TribunePatrick's Cabaret is a unique, non-profit arts organization in South Minneapolis, committed to supporting artists in their growth and development. For 28 years, we have encouraged a diverse range of artists to take risks and push boundaries. For 28 years, our audiences have helped us hold the space to make sure every artist has a stage to call their own. We especially reach out to local artists, artists of color, GLBTQ-identified artists, and those with disabilities.For the past three years, Patrick's Cabaret has presented the Twin Cities Roots, Rock and Deep Blues Festival - a fundraiser to support our programming throughout the year, ensuring that we can keep our doors open and our stage available to artists of all backgrounds, cultures, experience levels and artistic disciplines.This year's Twin Cities Roots, Rock and Deep Blues Festival will take place July 19, 2014, and will feature an impressive array of local, regional and national musical acts on multiple stages at Patrick's Cabaret and the neighboring Harriet Brewing. With visual artists selling their goods, food trucks lining the street, and performers mingling with the crowd, it's an urban festival with a neighborhood feel.And because of our reputation for supporting emerging artists, many of the festival's past headliners have performed for much less than they would normally get paid. It's their way of giving back. They understand that Patrick's Cabaret has awfully big dreams for such a small organization. They understand that we need all the help we can get to pull off an event this big.Here is a sample of some of the bands that will be performing 
at this year's festival:Sonny Knight & the LakersBlack Eyed Snakes Kent Burnside & the New Generation (MS)Black Market Brass Crankshaft & The Gear GrindersErik Koskineni like youMrs Glass (TX)Carson McHone (TX)Spider John Koerner EleganzaMike GuntherThe 757'sThe Flood Brothers (MO)Black DietMolly MaherJoe & Vicky Price (IA)Kitten ForeverBen Balinger (TX)Nikki & The RuematesMolly DeanThe Dead Pigeons Dirt Road Ramblers There are more to come! Stay tuned!If these bands interest you, a $20 donation or higher will reserve your spot at this year's festival!

story:
The upcoming cd release includes 5 original songs by Angel Cheney and Kim McLean:

1) In The Waiting

2) Find You

3) All About You

4) Redemption

5) Barefoot Waltz

 

THE NEW VIDEO IS UP AND WWW.ANGELCHENEY.COM IS READY TO GO!!!! PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD SO WE CAN GET THIS CD PRESSED!!!!

 

 

 

***The cd is completed!!!!! WOOOHOOOOOOO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!***

 

CHECK OUT THE OTHER VIDEOS BY CLICKING ON THE UPDATES TAB!  - ALSO, PLEASE PAY BY PAYPAL IF YOU CAN SO THAT THE FUNDS WILL COME SOONER AND CAN GO TOWARD THE STUDIO FEES JUNE 23-25. THANKS!

THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING THIS CD PROJECT. THIS IS A MINISTRY PROJECT AND IS ALL FOR GOD'S GLORY! HE IS AWESOME!

It is very important to me that you realize that this is a ministry project. The purpose of this cd is to share the music that God has put on my heart (because I believe that He has told me to share it) and to be able to have tracks to sing with so that I can use my music when I sing for various conferences and ministry events. It is my desire that God be glorified through this endeavor and am not seeking fame or fortune, but simply that the name of Jesus would be lifted up through music.  :):)

 

My name is Angel Cheney. I am 34 years old and am a mom of four, wife of 15 years to the love of my life, singer/songwriter, artist, author, poet, and I love to sing!! More importantly I LOVE TO SING FOR JESUS! He is the reason behind everything I do.

I can remember being six years old, barefoot in my backyard with the pristine backdrop of the Pacific Northwest, cassette player in hand, singing songs that I made up at the top of my voice. Then I would eagerly rewind the cassette tape and listen to my creation, knowing in my heart that one day I would have to do that for real. :)

Unfortunately my dad passed away from cancer last year before he got to see that become a reality. However, before he passed he made me promise not to give up and to make it happen. So, that is what I must do. Daddy, this first cd is dedicated to you.

I have been working with the amazing, award-winning songwriter/singer/producer Kim McLean(www.kimmclean.com) on my first album of original music and am happy to say that studio time is waiting for me in Nashville this summer.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Thank you to those that have already contributed to this project!! The funds in hand are a bit short to finish within the timeline established for this project so we NEED YOUR HELP!  I am believing that God has a plan and that this really can be pulled off in the next week. Believe with me! 

The money from this campaign will be used to fully fund our budget and pay the professional musicians, studio, engineer, and producer. It will also allow for the manufacture of cds, graphics, and a small promotions budget.

Any extra money will go toward the purchase of a macbook pro so that I can utilize it for songwriting purposes. Any money after that will be held in an account for the expenses of the next full length cd.

AND THERE ARE PERKS!!!!

Check out the awesome perks you can claim for contributing to this campaign! Free stuff! Original art!!! Check out my shop ArtAwakening on Etsy to view some of my art. Trust me, you want to get in on this!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • PRAY! Please pray that God will be glorified and that the Holy Spirit will be present in every aspect of this process, in the studio; that He will sing through every note.
  • Spread the news! PLEASE let people know about this campaign. This can't happen withoutyou!

Thank you!!! You are all loved!

story:
“Hey Brian, where can I buy your concert DVD?” 

 

That has been a question I’ve been getting a lot over the past few years.

The answer is, “I don’t have a live concert DVD.”

 

I’ve been touring now for over 24 years, having done my first solo show in May of 1994. In the beginning, I must admit I was very shy on stage. However, over the years I have grown to absolutely love performing! This is one of the reasons why I continue to pour all of my resources into my live show, I just enjoy the stage and thrill of the audience so much and want to put on the absolute best show possible. 

I believe it’s because of that, that so many people have been inquiring about a DVD of my live show.

The second sentence in my response has always been, “Do you have a few hundred grand laying around that I can borrow??” LOL

That statement isn’t that far off... 

Producing a high-quality concert film is extremely costly and very time-consuming. This is the main reason why you don’t see many (if any) jazz DVD releases into the marketplace. 

Well, I’ve taken it upon myself to break this mold and to do everything possible to put out a Blu-ray Disc of my most ambitious tour to date, The Colors of Love Tour. So, I personally have paid to capture the show on film while in Las Vegas this past May. While it was a financial gamble (spending close to $40,000 so far), I am extremely happy with the footage.

 

This is where YOU come into the picture...

In order for me to pay for the rest of the ‘post-production’ costs (I’ll break it down for you shortly), I really need your financial support to finish it. Our projections show an additional $60,000 is needed to complete everything (my goal here on Indiegogo is 75k which will NET close to 60k after fees and expenses). Since I remain an independent artist, I simply don’t have the deep pockets of the major record labels to do projects like this. 

 

Here’s the breakdown of where the money raised is going:

 

• Video Editing (including the editor and post-production supervisor)

• Mixing the audio (Bob Horn will be co-mixing with me again)

• Mastering (with Gene Grimaldi at Oasis Mastering in Burbank, CA)

• 5.1 Surround Sound Mix (after we mix and master the ‘stereo’ audio, we then take it apart and do the surround mix)

• Coloring the raw video Footage (each camera’s raw footage looks different, therefore every single clip needs to be ‘evened out’ and also we bump up the saturation and deepen the blacks to make the video POP) 

• Music clearance supervisor (She is in charge of negotiating the rights to use all of the songs on video. Since I did not write every song 100%, we have to get proper clearance from all of the different publishers out there. This is a very lengthy and expensive process).

• Music SYNC Licenses (for every song used on the Blu-ray and uploaded to YouTube and other social media outlets, we have to pay a fee in order to include it. This can be very costly depending on who owns which song)

• Securing Music Publishing Mechanical Licenses (this is different than sync licenses)

• Artwork & Design (for both the Blu-ray packaging and CD packaging)

• Blu-ray ‘Menu’ Design (after you insert the Blu-ray Disc, what comes up on the screen? All that has to be designed by someone)

• Blu-ray Authoring

• Manufacturing & Shipping

• and more... 

 

This is all on top of what has already been done and paid for, including:

 

• Multi-camera shoot in Las Vegas ($25,000)

• Multi-Track Audio recording in Las Vegas ($3,500)

• Pre-editing in LA ($10,000)

 

As you see, this is a very daunting task of completing a finished Blu-ray for commercial release. Obviously, there is a lot more to it than just putting out another album. 

However, I’m up to the task and committed to making it great!

YOU can help contribute to this project via the many ‘Perks’ available to choose from. Starting at just $25 all the way up to $25,000 :)

And if you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help get the word out. Please tell your friends, family, and co-workers about this campaign and feel free to use the 'share' tools right here on the Indiegogo site. It would be so appreciated.

I sincerely thank you for any and all support and can’t wait to get this done.

Brian Culbertson

BAND:
Marqueal Jordan - Saxophones, Vocals, and Percussion
Eddie Miller - Keyboards and Vocals
Tyrone Chase - Guitar
Joewaun Scott - Bass & Key Bass
Chris Miskel - Drums

CREDITS:
Directed by Scott Sternberg
Produced by Brian Culbertson & Ben Haley
Edited by Kevin Connolly
Show Concept & Design by Brian Culbertson
Lighting & Video Design & Programming by Matt Saunier

story:
Hello!


Welcome to my Indiegogo Campaign!


Since I was a little girl (very little, littler than I am now), I've been singing and writing music as often as I can. I sang in the car, I sang in the shower, I sang when my mom really wanted me to be quiet. Music seemed like this incredible, beautiful language that I somehow just knew, and I always wanted more and more of it. And so, one day, I decided I would have more of it.


I've been performing for a couple of years now. I started with parties-- singing for people I felt comfortable with, and then eventually moved on to open mics, where I began to feel comfortable playing my original songs for people. I had my first solo gig on May 26th, 2012, at a café called Java Madness. I brought in more people (and money) than any of their performers to this date. Since then, I've played several more shows, performed at parties, jam sessions, new open mics.


Over the summer, my good friend and fellow musician, Eric Darcy, had a friend visiting from Nashville. This friend, Chris Stone, happened to be a producer and sound engineer. Eric had me play some music for Chris, and before I could blink twice, I was on the phone with Eric planning a trip to Nashville to record my demo CD.


This fundraiser campaign is my ticket to Nashville. 


My whole life, music has been steady and constant and beautiful, without falter. I can hear it on the highway, in the clocks, on the subway, in the wheels of a bicycle, in your breathing, in the mountains. Everywhere. Through music, I've heard the sounds of people's hearts, of their tragedies and their happiest days, of their hardships and their victories. And with my voice, I have been able to let people hear my own, and I want to keep doing that. Cheese-ball as it all is-- music is a universal language that everybody can hear and understand. I want to be part of that web where people communicate with these sounds. Think about when you heard your favorite song for the first time; that feeling is the feeling I get every time I write a song, or perform for people, and I want to give people that feeling with my music. With support from my mother, my sister and my friends and fans, I have been able to pursue my music with dedication and passion. And with support from you, I will be able to take the next step in sharing my music with you and the rest of the world.


What We Need & What You Get


We need a minimum of $3000 to make it happen.  It's a considerable gas expense to travel 2600 miles round trip, and because we are taking our drummer and his kit, along with our other equipment...we gotta rent a bigger car or mini-van.  On top of that, there's food (hey, the creative brain needs nourishment!), and some lodging expenses.  My mom, who is my manager, needs to take a big chunk of unpaid time off, and well...I want to pay her for getting me there, and managing my trip.
If I don't reach my entire goal?  This is a once-in-a-lifetime chance, so with your help....we ARE going to Nashville.  Whatever you give will be used for the trip.  And if we are fortunate enough to exceed our goal, the additional funds will be used to put some additional polish and shine on the project:  photography, graphic design, printing the CDs. 


The Impact


This is the first step in launching my professional career!  I am making a pro-demo with a great producer, Chris Stone, and we'll begin shopping it around sometime later this year, in hopes of getting some real representation in the music business. 
I have worked hard, focused solely on my music for two years, and it's beginning to really show some growth, and I've got some incredible, enthusiastic and loving support from my friends, family and fans. 


Other Ways You Can Help


Any small contribution is going to help, so if all you can do is $5, please know my gratitude is great.  And if all you can do is spread the word, come out to a show, send me some love, that all helps and I will know it, see it, feel it!

If you have a great spot, party, or other venue where I can perform to help promote this trip, and you can hook that up for me, that is also an invaluable contribution! 

Check out the perks for contributors....everyone gets something!  A surprising amount of time is needed to complete the project, so be patient while waiting for your perks!  You'll also be added to an email list so you can receive updates on the progress of the Demo!

story:
Our Story

Believing in the importance of providing music for all, the mission of the Notre Temps String Ensemble, Inc. is to provide access to string music making to the members of the community regardless of musical experience or age.

Through structured rehearsals and concerts the ensemble members will gain basic knowledge in music making in a non-competitive setting.


The Impact

"What an opportunity! As I made plans for retirement, I knew music would be a part of those plans. It had been 50 years since my last piano and clarinet lessons. However, I purchased a cello, signed up for lessons at the SDSU

Community Music School and announced that I would like to be able to bring music into nursing homes and elementary classrooms as part of a small ensemble some day. This would be my way of learning something new, getting out of myself and possibly bringing some joy to others.

Notre Temps String Ensemble has provided me with all of the opportunities I had hoped for and more.  The musicians, all far better players than me, have welcomed and encouraged me during rehearsals and performances." - Suzi

"I studied viola rather seriously as a child up through high school. I had a beautiful instrument and loved to play. In addition to taking weekly lessons, I participated in numerous symphony and chamber orchestras and even a jazz ensemble! But as soon as I went to college, my viola began to collect dust. Fast forward to 20 years later, and I decided that my beautiful viola shouldn't just sit in storage, and that someone else should have the pleasure of playing it. So I headed over to a local music store to try and sell it. Well, I suddenly decided I couldn't part with it and, moreover, decided that I would instead start taking lessons! A 20-year break from practicing definitely took its toll, but I was astonished to realize how much I remembered, both physically and mentally. Over the past year, I have been gradually restoring my skills, and this is due in no small part to joining the Notre Temps String Ensemble. Rediscovering the viola after a 20-year hiatus was a little scary to me, but being a part of an orchestra that is low in stress and high in comradery has made it quite fun. I’m very much enjoying the friendships that I have developed as a result of joining the orchestra, and I look forward to growing with the orchestra over the years. Playing the viola again has filled a void in my life; I didn’t know how much I missed it until I started playing again. I feel so lucky to have the opportunity to play music with others in my community" - Jessica


What We Need & What You Get

We at Notre Temps are looking for donations to help pay for sheet music, copies, a rehearsal space, and advertising to recruit more people into our orchestra. But those are only the short term goals. The orchestra would like to eventually sponsor an aspiring musician with an instrument and lessons so that they may also have an outlet for music. We would also love to pay our Creative Director, Michael, who has graciously worked pro bono for the past 2 years.


If you donate to Notre Temps, you will be helping musicians to have an outlet for their love of music.


"Music cleanses the understanding; inspires it, and lifts it into a realm which it would not reach if it were left to itself."

~Henry Ward Beecher

story:
Opera Competition and Master Class in Spain!

Dear Friends and Family,

A month ago I got the great news that I was selected to participate in the International Opera Competition hosted by Soprano Monserrat Caballé in Zaragoza, Spain as well as the Master Classes that follow, having one-on-one training with Madame Caballé.

As a young Venezuelan Tenor living in Miami, it is an immense and amazing opportunity to be selected to be part of this competition and training. It will open a lot of doors and opportunities in the future and non of this could have happened with the support and encouragement I have gotten from everyone throughout this long journey that I have partaken so far. 

As you may know, applying, traveling, and competing in all these various places takes a lot of time and money which I have had the priviledge of having thus far.

The Process and how You can help me!

Now, the trip to Spain will be for about 2 weeks and there will be two main parts to this competition.

As part of the international competition, they have picked singers from all over the world to compete against each other in a 5 day process of elimination. I have the honor of being part of the singers picked! Each singer goes through three rounds until they reach the finals where, if chosen, I would have the opportunity to win a cash prize ranging from 3,000 euros to 12,000 euros. 

The second part of this invitation is the Master Classes that I will be taking personally with Madame Caballé. These are training sessions, in front of an audience, that include training and critique on various aspects of a selection that I would be singing for her. This is what I am most excited about! The chance to meet and get coaching from one of the greatest sopranos in opera that has ever sung. Getting picked to be part of the Master Class is a priviledge and an incredible opportunity.

At the end of these two weeks, Madame Caballé will hand pick a few singers from the competition and master classes to sing in a concert with her and singers from all over the world. 

With all that said, now I would like to ask for your support. I will be leaving September 8th and staying in Zaragoza until the 20th. The invitation does not cover any expenses that include airfare, lodging, and living over in Zaragoza. So that means that I will have a month to raise as much money as I can that will aid me in this journey. 

I know it is a lot to ask but any support you can give me, including words of encouragement, is well recieved and appreciated as well as spreading the word to everyone and attending future performances that I have planned locally in the fall!

 

Thank you so much for you time and support!!!

 

With the Kindest Regards,

 

Andrés Eduardo

story:
Short Summary

Hi guys, my names Fabio. Im 17 years old and from a town called Eastbourne in East Sussex, UK! I was born in Wales, then moved down south with my family at aged 3. My parents broke up when i was 8 and moved across town to another house with my mum. I now currently live in a flat with my mum. She doesn't have a job and is finding it really hard to live. Im trying my hardest to get a job but they're so hard to find these days for a part time job.

My dad was in the music business back in the 70s, and hes really keen for me to follow in his footsteps. So am i! Music is my passion and to be in the music business is a dream for me.

I play drums, and i got my first drum kit when i was 8. However, the drum kit is at my dads house, who now lives about an hour away out of town, and whenever i tried to play, the neighbours complained. I was forced to take the drum kit down, and i haven't been able to play it in 3 years. 

This was very upsetting for both me and my dad. The only chance to get to play the drums is once a week during my drum lessons. I love playing the drums. Its the only thing i consider myself to be good at. This campaign is so important to me, because without my drums and my music, I wouldn't see much point in waking up in the mornings.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding i would love to recieve is around £700. This is would be the perfect amount for a mid-ranged Tama drum kit i found online for about £500. It looks so nice, i cant stop looking at pictures and watching videos of it. The rest of the money would go on to book time at a practice room so i would have a place to play and practice.

 

I feel i have a natural flare for drumming. and if this compaign were to come true and i were to get the drum kit, my hope is to make a Youtube channel where i would make drum cover videos. I love to entertain people, so making drum covers on Youtube and getting viewers would be so amazing!

 

The Impact

I feel the project is, first off, exetremely valuable to me. Im not just a 17 year old boy wanting money for doing nothing. This is me trying to chase my dream, and, with your help, i'll be one step closer to accomplishing the things i've only ever dreamt about.

If i were to recieve any money at all after the campaign, i would post videos on Youtube about my progress and make sure all of you guys knew where your money had gone :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if i weren't to recieve any money, if ANY of you are involved with music production, sound engineering or anything to do with recording studios and session musicianship, i would love to have the opportunity to come and experience it!

story:
Short Summary

We are two Mexican brothers, Leonardo and Igor, who, along with several other talented artists, will be creating a documentary based on the creation of 4 music videos throughout Mexico.  BOLE, (www.bolemusica.com) a musical group consisting of 3 highly talented artists has recorded four songs: Water, Wind, Fire and Earth.  Each of these songs represents healing, harmony, and unity. BOLE's mission through their music is to provide a space for healing and allow those who experience their music to find unity and harmony within themselves.

As they create a visual representation of these four songs, they invite the world into their creative process. The making of this documentary serves to raise their mission to a higher level, spreading their message ever further.

OUR PLAN: 
To begin this exploration, we start with the Mexican Caribbean, recording WATER. From there we will travel by road into the jungle of Chiapas to record the video EARTH.  Next, we are off to the high altitudes in the Sierra Madre Occidental (mountains of the west) to record WIND, and wrapping up in Wirikuta, the dessert of the north, to film the video FIRE.

The documentary will capture our experience on the road, the making of these four videos, and exploring the meaning of each element in the world and in you.

As we focus on the cultural bridges and universal understanding of music, love, and harmony, we hope to touch the hearts of people around the world and bring about healing, harmony, and unity among all.  BOLE's music is an experience, and our project will allow us to share this experience with THE WORLD.


What We Need & What You Get

We are so grateful that the crew we have gathered to produce the documentary are all professionals, who are donating their time and expertise because they believe so much in this project and the ultimate goal of the mission.    

Our estimated budget for this project is over $18,000 USD.  We are all putting in our own funds, energy, and time into this project and our remaining goal for funding is $14,000 USD.  We are so excited to be able to invite you along the journey and without your help and support, this may not be possible.

We are excited for you to join us!!

Check out our perks page for the individual donation amounts and what you will receive in return, apart from our undying gratitude!!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand you may be unable to contribute monetarily. However, you can still help us with this by sharing our mission with the world and help us make our dreams into a reality.

You can use the share button to get your friends and family the direct link to this site!

story:
--Short Summary--

Transcendent Pathways was conceived because I knew there were people out there that felt alone and isolated due to health conditions, and I knew that music could help them feel connected again.  I knew music could remind them that there were people out there that cared and hadn’t forgotten them.  I want to set up a system that collects donations, that go to hiring concert musicians to play music for people in places like children’s hospitals, nursing homes, institutions for the mentally ill, any place where people might feel alone and forgotten.  I think that music can alleviate these feelings, and remind people that they are never alone.  

The goal of TP is to champion these qualities through music.  And it all starts with this concert during mental illness awareness week.  On October 7th at SFCM, TP will hold its debut concert and will feature top notch local groups such as Magik Magik Orchestra and Nonsemble 6.  

Help me debut Transcendent Pathways as the new face of Arts and Medicine in the Bay Area by supporting this concert, and by extension supporting the people who desperately need that reminder.  You are not alone.  You have not been forgotten. There are real people who care about you.  ...

You can show that you care by supporting this campaign.  Your donation is tax deductible, and on top of that, every dollar you give will be matched by the Brin/Wojcicki Foundation so no amount is too small.  


--The Concert--

This concert will establish Transcendent Pathways as a prominent live music production non profit that will redefine arts and medicine in the Bay Area.  The concert details can be found here:

·  When: October 7th, 2013 8p

·  Where: The San Francisco Conservatory of Music (50 Oak Street)

·  How much: Admission will be completely free, so all are welcome!


IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO ATTEND THE CONCERT, PLEASE CONTACT THE SFCM BOX OFFICE AT (415) 503-6275


There is an outstanding program lined up for the night of the concert, featuring the following works...

- Spiegel im Spiegel, by Arvo Pärt 

Liana Berube, violin

Jeff LaDuer, piano

- Pierrot Lunaire, by Arnold Schoenberg 

Nonsemble 6

- Agony/Ecstasy, by Mark Ackerley (World Premier) 

Magik*Magik Orchestra


--The Impact--

Transcendent Pathways will bring a new edge to arts and medicine in the Bay Area.  We want to bring powerful live performances of new music to those who feel marginalized by their affliction.  We believe that by providing this, we can remind individuals that they are never alone.  Music has that power.  And it all starts with this concert.


--Matching Grant!!!--

This radical idea, that music can heal, has received the generous pledge of a matching grant from the Brin/Wojcicki Foundation.  So every dollar raised will be matched!


--How Is The Money Used?--

ALL PROCEEDS go to funding the ensembles, venue, and production costs. Transcendent Pathways does not stand to profit financially from your donations.  


--Other Ways You Can Help--

If you have been impacted by mental illness, I invite you to help us make this concert a reality.  If you believe that music can be a transformative tool, please:

  • Share this with family, friends, and anyone you think might believe like I do, that music can be a transformative tool in the pursuit of transcendence.  
  • Like us on Facebook
  • Come to the concert - it's free!
story_txt:
--Short Summary--



Transcendent Pathways was conceived because I knew there were people out there that felt alone and isolated due to health conditions, and I knew that music could help them feel connected again.  I knew music could remind them that there were people out there that cared and hadn’t forgotten them.  I want to set up a system that collects donations, that go to hiring concert musicians to play music for people in places like children’s hospitals, nursing homes, institutions for the mentally ill, any place where people might feel alone and forgotten.  I think that music can alleviate these feelings, and remind people that they are never alone.  
The goal of TP is to champion these qualities through music.  And it all starts with this concert during mental illness awareness week.  On October 7th at SFCM, TP will hold its debut concert and will feature top notch local groups such as Magik Magik Orchestra and Nonsemble 6.  
Help me debut Transcendent Pathways as the new face of Arts and Medicine in the Bay Area by supporting this concert, and by extension supporting the people who desperately need that reminder.  You are not alone.  You have not been forgotten. There are real people who care about you.  ...
You can show that you care by supporting this campaign.  Your donation is tax deductible, and on top of that, every dollar you give will be matched by the Brin/Wojcicki Foundation so no amount is too small.  




--The Concert--

This concert will establish Transcendent Pathways as a prominent live music
production non profit that will redefine arts and medicine in the Bay Area.  The concert details can be found here:
· 
When: October 7th, 2013 8p
· 
Where: The San Francisco Conservatory
of Music (50 Oak Street)
· 
How much: Admission will be

story:
I've got a new album (listen here), featuring the song Sweet Friend of Mine, that you can get now. You'll receive extra songs (see the list below), bonus features and better quality audio. Why should you get the album directly from me now? 

I'm thrilled with this album and want to make sure it gets heard. I've learned the hard way that if you don't promote an album well, very few people even learn that it is available. But it takes money to promote an album well. It costs thousands of dollars to do publicity or send songs to just one radio format, for instance. Here's what I'm hoping to do next at radio. There's a great team excited about helping me make sure this album gets noticed but I've had to turn many of them down because I can't afford them. 

That's where you come in. You could look for the album in stores but you'll get fewer songs, none of the extras and you won't get the higher quality audio files that are included in the downloads here. Here's why this model works better and is essential to my getting to interact with you more and to my ability to continue to record.

I’ve got some great rewards for individuals, groups and charities -- something for everyone. Each one has a different delivery date so you'll know when you should receive it. Check them out over there. -->

You can also invite me to your town - for a Conversation or a concert. You’ll find the details–yep, you guessed it–right over there. -->

Click a "Claim This Perk" button to see more information about ordering it, delivery dates, etc. If you pay by credit card, Indiegogo doesn't complete the transaction until several days after the campaign ends, so your delivery date is after that. If you use PayPal, the delivery date will be earlier than the one posted. 

Thanks again for your interest in my music.  Please share this page with your friends... choose the cool stuff you want... and check out some of the songs on my Conversations album.

Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations.

I look forward to connecting with you and learning what you think about these songs on social media like Indiegogo, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Kondoot, ReverbNation, Stageit, MySpace and Pinterest. 


P.S. I am also a founding member of the Sweet Comfort Band. We have a new album called The Waiting Is Over and you can get a copy, which I'll autograph, here too.

FAQ

What is included in the Conversations Deluxe Download?

Sweet Friend Of Mine
You Make Me Love You
Know It
I Can’t Imagine
One Missing Piece
Got Ya Where You Want Me
Little Bit At A Time
Lovin’ You
I See You
No Words
Nothing To Prove
Every Father Is A Son
Say What You Mean
God Wins
Silent Night
This Christmas
Peace
Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas
Christmas Time Is Here
What a Wonderful World
I See You (Radio Version) 

I Can't Imagine (Radio Version)

Bonus Audio
Ringtones
Album Graphics & Poster

Which songs are on the Conversations CD?

Sweet Friend Of Mine
You Make Me Love You
Know It
I Can’t Imagine
One Missing Piece
Got Ya Where You Want Me
Little Bit At A Time
Lovin’ You
I See You
No Words
Nothing To Prove
Every Father Is A Son
Say What You Mean
God Wins
Silent Night
This Christmas
Peace
Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas
Christmas Time Is Here

Why have you set your goal so low?

Indiegogo charges higher fees if I don't reach my goal. So, I set a low goal in hopes of exceeding it and paying lower fees.

Can I participate even if I don't live in the United States?

Absolutely! I’ve had such great experiences with my international audience and I want you involved. Plus, the guy who helped me put this campaign together is a Canadian and he’s helped me figure out how to make it easier for you be a part.

You can choose any of the perks that are delivered by e-mail (Reports From The Soul Furnace, Digital Album Download, Let's Talk, etc.) without any extra cost. 

There are some extra shipping costs, compared to mailing the same items to an address in the United States, if you choose a perk that is rewarded by mailing you something -- CDs, shirts, etc. So, you can simply add a bit to your pledge to cover those costs. I’ll trust you to be fair when estimating that amount. Here are some typical extra costs for shipping one CD to these countries:

Canada & Australia: $1.50-2.00 extra for one CD

United Kingdom: $4-4.50 extra for one CD

Netherlands: $3 extra for one CD

Japan: $3 extra for one CD

If you choose a reward package that involves travel you’ll be responsible for the travel costs.

Can I give the album or other perks to my friends?

You betcha! Indiegogo allows you specify who you want the perk sent to and indicate that it is a gift. You can even include a note for the recipient of your gift.

What do you need for concert rewards?

It's pretty basic: You provide a sound system suitable for the size of audience and venue, along with a keyboard, an acoustic/electric guitar and two direct in boxes/connections.

My accommodation needs are simple too: One hotel room (two for Christmas concerts), meals and transportation to/from the airport. Additional travel costs will apply if you do not live within 90 minutes of a major U.S. hub airport that offers direct flights from Los Angeles.

Can you tell me more about the estimated delivery dates?

If I can send your rewards earlier than estimated cost-effectively, I will. I'll work hard to get your perks to you as quickly as possible after I receive payment from Indiegogo. PayPal payments happen fairly quickly but credit card payments aren't processed until several business days after the campaign closes. Some perks, especially those that involve travel, will require a bit more time to schedule but we’ll work that out together.

What happens if you don't reach your goal?

You'll still get whatever perk you've selected. I'll have to pay higher fees to Indiegogo if I don't reach the goal but you'll still get everything.

How can I help with this campaign?

There's lots you can do in addition to backing this campaign and sharing this page. Any comments you post help raise the profile of this page. Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations. You can also send Christopher a message here if you'd like to be added to my Indiegogo campaign team (see the group below).

What if I have a question that isn't answered here or want a perk that isn't offered?

Send me a message. There is a big "Send User A Message" button on my Indiegogo profile page.

story:
When Brad Myrick said he wanted to produce my next album of original songs, he didn’t have to twist my arm much.  I’ve had the pleasure of sharing the stage with Brad for about four years now, and every gig is a party.  The energy level goes up and the music comes alive.  That’s the way it is, and should be, when you collaborate with great musicians.

I couldn’t say no to his generous offer, but it’s not without a little reluctance.  I want to do this right, and right takes money – more than I can scrape together on my own.  And that’s where you come in. 

This new album will happen – how well it happens depends on the support from friends and fans that have enjoyed my music for over thirty years as a soloist and member of The Late Harvest Band, The Roberts Brothers Band, and The Swunk Brothers.

This will be a fun project and we’d love to include some great talent to compliment Brad’s arrangements and production.  Marketing and sales have never been my strong suit, so I’ll make my request as graciously as possible.  Thank you for your generous support.

story:
We are Amarante and we have begun writing our next album!

For this next album we wanted to do something different.  We wanted to improve the sound and collaborate with other artists and our fans.  

Over the past year we have reached over 1.6 million plays on soundcloud and have built friendships with many youtubers.  We've always been a D.I.Y. band and wanted to continue on that path so we can be in control of our own sound.  By going through indiegogo we can continue to be independent and include the fans in the process.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $8,000.

Some of the reasons why we are asking for funding is to create a better sound than our previous albums, get merchandise out to our fans, and to invest lots of time to create a unique album.  We are planning to involve some of our favorite YouTubers in the album.  We also want the fans to be apart of it as well.  

We will finally be able to give our fans Merchandise such as shirts and Hoodies:  

(Designs are tentative)

Regardless of meeting our goal or not, the album will still be made, as it is our passion, but we need your help and would love for you to be apart of it!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page everywhere and tell your friends.

story:
What is this project?

“Finding Asia in America” is a Winter Term photography project planned out by a group of 7 students from Oberlin College, Oberlin, OH. Although inspired by Humans of New York, it concentrates on the struggles faced by Asians and Asian-Americans living in the U.S. The project will be from January 12th to 28th, including  an excursion to New York and a photography exhibition in Oberlin. From January 12th to 19th, we will visit Asian-American communities in New York City to take photos and hear their stories. From the 19th to 28th, we will return to school to prepare for the project exhibition that will take place in the beginning of February here in Oberlin. Besides having an exhibition, we will also share our project on Facebook so that it will acknowledge and empower not only the Oberlin community but also others around the country and the world. 


Who are we and why are we doing this?

Linh K. Tran (Clover) | Freshman, Undecided Major | Project Founder

“The idea of combining traveling and taking photos of Vietnamese people in the US sparked in my head at first when I talked to my advisor - professor Laurie McMillin. After that, however, there was always an invisible voice urging me that I could and needed to do more. I started to realize how I, as a Vietnamese girl, shared so many similar experiences with my Asian friends. I started to realize how much we’ve had to struggle to fit in this American community. Culture shock, insecurity, homesickness, self-criticism, and lack of confidence: they haunted, or are still haunting, many of us everyday. Throughout this project, I want to learn more about the struggles of Asians and Asian-Americans here and how they have overcome them. I want to bring their, and our, stories to light, to let others know what it can be like to be an Asian in America, and to remind my fellow Asians that: We are not alone.”


Holly Hoang | Sophomore, Geology Major, East Asian Studies Minor

"I am the daughter of first-generation immigrants who sacrificed everything to come to the United States and obtain the “American dream.” I am the reason they struggled, and continue to struggle, in a society that does not care to understand the harsh reality they face on a daily basis. As racist jokes and remarks are tossed around as acceptable table conversation, I am reminded of this society we live in – one in which the narratives of immigrants, particularly those from Asia, are so often ignored and lost. By traveling to New York and documenting the stories of the A/PID communities there, I hope to learn about their experiences of living in America, how they have influenced their perceptions of their identity, and explore my own identity as an Asian American."


Jenny Xin Luan | Freshman, Undecided Major

"This is my first year in the States. Everything is so different but familiar to me; in other words, I prepared my whole life to be able to study here, an English-speaking country. I was born and raised in Beijing but I was exposed to everything of the western culture before I actually came to Oberlin. However, the loneliness still overwhelmed me on the first day of arrival on campus -- first time as a minority. Some factual questions strike me, "What should I do? Where should I stay? I studied so hard to be here.”  I know many international students also have these questions, not only students but also all of the Asians in the States. Through this project, I want to explore the circle of the Asian people, their experiences and their thoughts about their futures. I want to know If I am alone facing these questions, I want to hear their stories, how they make the decision to come to the States, study here, stay here and live here."


Naomi Langer | Freshman, Undecided Major

"I grew up with my grandmother’s stories of being Asian in America and my mother’s stories of being mixed race in small town New Jersey, knowing their feelings of being out of place, of being an “other” in the cultures they found themselves in. Though I am only a quarter Japanese I was raised to be very aware of my heritage and of how Asian identity affects growing up and living in America. With this project I hope to learn more stories of Asian Americans, explore my role in the Asian American community, and practice my love of photography. "


Jeong Hyun Hwang | Sophomore, Politics Major

"I was born and raised in South Korea, but attended elementary school for about 5 years in California. I’ve been into photography for about five years now and I’ve been taken on multiple projects, event photo-shoots, and a photography job at the college. This project is special to me as both a photographer and an Asian. As a photographer, I wish to capture the diverse aspects of the Asian-American community in New York and represent their stories, feelings, hardships, and joys accurately to the rest of the world. As an Asian I aim to learn about what it’s like to live and work in the United States."


Linda Zhu | Freshman, Undecided Major

"In life, I have encountered many intelligent and successful Asian Americans. I have seen the glamorous side of their life. Now I wonder what the other side looks like. Through this project, I hope that, together with group members, we can bring out “the story” behind individuals in the diverse Asian community; through their sharing, people can truly see and feel their life struggles, and in such way come to a better understanding of Asian Americans."


Tori Willbanks-Roos | Sophomore, History Major

""Identity" has never been clear cut for me. As a Chinese adoptee to a Caucasian American family, it has been hard to navigate which parts of me are Asian and which parts are American - and what that even means and if it can be divisible at all. In this sense, the term "Asian American", though it is the term I use to describe myself, is not a single definition, which I have come to understand more recently. Rather, it encompasses a wide variety of people with such different identities. I want to be a part of this project because I think it is important to hear about these people - people that I have things in common with, yet also vary from in so many ways. By being a part of this, I hope to learn of other people's journeys and stories relating to their identity as Asian American, and in doing so learn more about both Asian Americans around the country and my own identity."


What We Need & What You Get

Although the Winter Term lasts for 3 weeks, we chose to travel to NYC for only a week to save money! For 6 people (Tori is not going to NYC), we will need $2,250 for: 

  • Traveling: $700, including the bus tickets from NYC back to Oberlin ($40/person) and the public transportation in NYC. We will pay by ourselves to get to NYC. 
  • Lodging: $1,000 for an apartment for 6 people. (around $140/night, including other fees)
  • Exhibition: $550, including printing expense, materials and posters. 

Check out our perks to see what you can get from donating!


The Impact

Your support, no matter how much it is and in whatever way you choose, will mean a lot to us college students. We are taking our baby steps to create the changes we want to see in this world, so we hope that with your kind help and support, one day we will stand tall! 

We can't thank you all enough, but we promise we will not let you down with this project!


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our project on your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr... with the hashtag #findingAinA.
  • Refer our project to your friends and acquaintances who you think might be interested in helping.

sparked in my head at first when I talked to my advisor - professor Laurie McMillin. After that, however, there was always an
invisible voice urging me that I could and needed to do more. I started to realize
how I, as a Vietnamese girl, shared so many similar experiences with my Asian
friends. I started to realize how much we’ve had to struggle to fit in this
American community. Culture shock, insecurity, homesickness, self-criticism,
and lack of confidence: they haunted, or are still haunting, many of us
everyday. Throughout this project, I want to learn more about the struggles of
Asians and Asian-Americans here and how they have overcome them. I want to
bring their, and our, stories to light, to let others know what it can be like to
be an Asian in America, and to remind my fellow Asians that: We
are not
alone.”
Holly Hoang | Sophomore,
Geology Major, East Asian Studies Minor

"I am the daughter of first-generation immigrants who sacrificed everything to come to the United States and obtain the “American dream.” I am the reason they struggled, and continue to struggle, in a society that does not care to understand the harsh reality they face on a daily basis. As racist jokes and remarks are tossed around as acceptable table conversation, I am reminded of this society we live in – one in which the narratives of immigrants, particularly those from Asia, are so often ignored and lost. By traveling to New York and documenting the stories of the A/PID communities there, I hope to learn about their experiences of living in America, how they have influenced their perceptions of their identity, and explore my own identity as an Asian American."
Jenny Xin Luan
| Freshman, Undecided Major


"This is my first year in the States. Everything is so different but familiar to me; in other words, I prepared my whole life to be able to study here, an English-speaking country. I was born and raised in Beijing but I was exposed to everything of the western culture before I actually came to Oberlin. However, the loneliness still overwhelmed me on the first day of arrival on campus -- first time as a minority. Some factual questions strike me, "What should I do? Where should I stay? I studied so hard to be here.”  I know many international students also have these questions, not only students but also all of the Asians in the States. Through this project, I want to explore the circle of the Asian people, their experiences and their thoughts about their futures. I want to know If I am alone facing these questions, I want to hear their stories, how they make the decision to come to the States, study here, stay here and live here."
Naomi Langer | Freshman, Undecided Major


"I grew up with my grandmother’s stories of being Asian in America
and my mother’s stories of being mixed race in small town New Jersey, knowing
their feelings of being out of place, of being an “other” in the cultures they
found themselves in. Though I am only a quarter Japanese I was raised to be
very aware of my heritage and of how Asian identity affects growing up and
living in America. With this project I hope to learn more stories of Asian
Americans, explore my role in the Asian American community, and practice my
love of photography. "

Jeong Hyun Hwang | Sophomore, Politics Major

"I was born and raised in South Korea, but
attended elementary school for about 5 years in California. I’ve been into
photography for about five years now and I’ve been taken on multiple projects,
event photo-shoots, and a photography job at the college. This project is
special to me as both a photographer and an Asian. As a photographer, I wish to
capture the diverse aspects of the Asian-American community in New York and
represent their stories, feelings, hardships, and joys accurately to the rest
of the world. As an Asian I aim to learn about what it’s like to live and work
in the United States."


Linda Zhu | Freshman, Undecided Major

"In life, I have encountered many intelligent
and successful Asian Americans. I have seen the glamorous side of their life.
Now I wonder what the other side looks like. Through this project, I hope that,
together with group members, we can bring out “the story” behind individuals in
the diverse Asian community; through their sharing, people can truly see and
feel their life struggles, and in such way come to a better understanding of
Asian Americans."
Tori Willbanks-Roos | Sophomore, History Major

""Identity" has never been clear cut
for me. As a Chinese adoptee to a Caucasian American family, it has been hard
to navigate which parts of me are Asian and which parts are American - and what
that even means and if it can be divisible at all. In this sense, the term
"Asian American", though it is the term I use to describe myself, is
not a single definition, which I have come to understand more recently. Rather,
it encompasses a wide variety of people with such different identities. I want
to be a part of this project because I think it is important to hear about
these people - people that I have things in common with, yet also vary from in
so many ways. By being a part of this, I hope to learn of other people's
journeys and stories relating to their identity as Asian American, and in doing
so learn more about both Asian Americans around the country and my own
identity."
   What We Need & What You Get Although the Winter Term lasts for 3 weeks, we chose to travel to NYC for only a week to save money! For 6 people (Tori is not going to NYC), we will need $2,250 for:   Traveling: $700, including the bus tickets from NYC back to Oberlin ($40/person) and the public transportation in NYC. We will pay by ourselves to get to NYC.  Lodging: $1,000 for an apartment for 6 people. (around $140/night, including other fees) Exhibition: $550, including printing expense, materials and posters. 

    
Check out our perks to see what you can get from donating!
The Impact Your support, no matter how much it is and in whatever way you choose, will mean a lot to us college students. We are taking our baby steps to create the changes we want to see in this world, so we hope that with your kind help and support, one day we will stand tall! 
We can't thank you all enough, but we promise we will not let you down with this project!


Other Ways You Can Help
  Share our project on your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr... with the hashtag #findingAinA. Refer our project to your friends and acquaintances who you think might be interested in helping.

story:
Copperpot is back with a new record and we need your help. We're in the process of finishing up a 6 song EP that will be released digitally. This is all brand new material that we've been working on over the past 2 years and we're excited to finally be sharing it with you. It'd mean a great deal if Copperpot fans old and new could help donate and be a part of making it happen.  Anyone who donates, regardless of the amount, will get a song sent to them before the digital release of the EP. 

There's some cool perks for donating, including signed CD's, handwritten lyrics, and even a written/recorded song.

story:
Metropolitan Boys Choir - Tuition Assistance Program

The Metropolitan Boys Choir (MBC) is a 42 year-old non-profit youth organization with a unique mission* that seeks to help boys achieve four main goals: 

  • Nurture musical excellence
  • Build teamwork and leadership capabilities
  • Develop self-esteem through positive adult and peer relationships
  • Empower boys to make a positive impact within their communities

No boy is ever turned away from participating due to financial issues. 

What We Need

We need your help! At present, approximately 50% of our boys receive tuition assistance. The amount of assistance ranges from reduced tuition to full scholarship. Our efforts in this campaign are to ensure this year's Tuition Assistance Program has the necessary funds to fulfill our mission*.

What You Will Get

Our pledge gifts were carefully selected to ensure we stay on budget while providing something of value to you. Personalized Thank You Notes, Acknowledgement and Audio files of the boys singing will be the primary gifts for your contribution. A unique and exciting pledge level is choosing a song for the boys to sing at a concert - think of it as helping to create a MBC playlist! You could even have the boys perform a private concert just for you, your company, organization or event!

The Impact

With the Tuition Assistance Program funded, our efforts to recruit more boys to participate will be ramped up - furthering our reach while providing expanded opportunities of learning, fun, and fellowship for the boys.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone will be able to contribute. However, we would greatly appreciate your help in other ways such as:

  • Help get the word out! Tell your friends and family about our campaign - some of them may be able to contribute, they just don't know about it yet!
  • Subscribe to our email newsletter to be kept up-to-date with MBC activities - one of them may be something you'd like to participate in.

Thank you for learning about the Metropolitan Boys Choir - we hope you will consider supporting us today!

*The Metropolitan Boys Choir (MBC) mission:

To provide a unique program of musical excellence and personal growth for Twin Cities area boys of varied social, cultural, and economic backgrounds; to develop responsibility and leadership; to empower these young men to become positive influences in their communities.

story:
Bombolessé

a terminé d'enregistrer les pistes de base au studio Victor.

En attendant de finir les pistes, le mix, mastering, pochette, etc. ET grâce au savoir faire de notre Tromboniste Dominique Poirier, on a décidé de vous préparer :

"La Corrida" : une blonde qui pense & danse!

C'est un cadeau spécial EXCLUSIF à nos Bombofans qui viendront la chercher sur place à notre prochain spectacle.

Achetez le CD "Vice Versa" : venez le chercher le jour du lancement ou de notre prochain spectacle proche de chez vous et on vous offrira  "La Corrida".

Attention les quantités sont très limités :
Nous avons seulement 27 bouteilles de 660mL.


LES AUTRES CONTREPARTIES = PERKS
-si vous habitez loin et que vous préférez recevoir le CD directement chez vous, optez pour l'option : CDmail

-si vous préférez qu'on vous envoie par courriel seulement une version mp3 de l'album avec la pochette en .jpg optez pour l'option : CDigital

story:
Hello everone!

My name is Mylène Otou, I'm a singer-songwriter from Montreal, Canada.

I have been living in this wonderful country since I am 6 years-old, and I started singing (pop, R&B, Afrobeat, World Music, Gospel) since I was 8.

My first album "Nomade" was released in August 2011. It was a very tropical album, with African Influences, except for the last song, Gratitude, which was more Gospel.

After that album, I wrote many songs with the same theme as "Gratitude", which is Thanksgiving to God for His blessings.

I decided to "recycle" the Gratitude song and make it the title of that album.

What I need...

 Here's a little budget for the release of the album:

Recording, mixing & mastering: 1000$

Pressing, graphic design: 1000$

Promoting and Marketing: 500$

Making of one music video: 1000$

Launching Show in May 2015: 1000$

Other expenses (musicians, etc.): 500$

Total: 5000 $

My funding is set as Flexible, which means I will receive whatever amount I have raised, whether I reach my goal or not (I’ll use all the help I can get!). But I am confident that thanks to your help, I will reach my goals! Thank you in advance!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you might not be able to help, or simply don’t have a credit card. That’s okay! What you can do in that case is simply spread the word through social media!

Let’s make the world more greatful!

story: #WeTheChange Thats what its all about.
story_txt: #WeTheChange Thats what its all about.

story:
Hello, we are Sprockets a Alternative Punk, Rock band from Boise, ID / Las Vegas, NV.

We aim to create an on going way to raise funds for children charities meaning every album or song that creates revenue of any kind will donate a percentage to a children's charity. A little bit about us, we are a three piece band who have achieved many accomplishments in our musical career including “Uniformed Mascara” on NBC’s season two finale of “Life”, “Safety Nets & Fastened Windows” on CMJ.com’s Download This, 2011 Billboards Next Big Sound and “Your Infection” was a Grammy Nominated Contender for Best Indie Rock song in the 55th Grammy’s.

We want to get back to the studio to create an album that produces funds for people who need it rather then labels who don't even share it with the artist. In other words we need YOUR help. We feel very strongly about the music we have written, yet to record. They are by far the best songs we have written to date. I know together we can scale new uncharted mountains.

WHAT I NEED THE MONEY FOR:

There are many steps to recording an album and every step cost money, the better the quality the more it costs. Step one is already done, we have written the songs next is getting to the studio which we are looking to record in Bremerton, WA at Mike Herrera’s Monkey Trench Studios which is where we recorded “Medicated Empty” in 2009. We then track all the musical instruments and vocals, we send it to mixing and mastering which is a long and tedious process. Once we have a final product we have to get artwork and albums printed in cd and vinyl. EVERY ALBUM / VINYL SOLD WILL DONATE A PERCENTAGE TO A CHILDREN'S CHARITY. 

But unfortunately, pressing even limited quantities of vinyl just isn't cheap. Neither is pressing CD's or hiring artists to make these things look nice. And don't even get me started on how much it costs to ship a few hundred vinyl records. If this campaign is successful we are aiming to release this in by the end of 2014.

The amount of money we are trying to raise will pay everything above and travel from Washington to Home. Most of the bonuses are coming out of our pockets. No skimping here, my friends.

WHAT YOU GET IN RETURN

Ok…even at the lowest level of monetary support, you'll be offered the chance to enjoy a digital copy of the New Sprockets album before the general public hears it. We will post short clips of us recording the album on selected sites, so you will be there with us as we record seeing the process from the ground up. These are exclusive to the backers of this project, and will disappear shortly after this campaign is over.

But besides those things, at various levels of support, you'll get the chance to have:

•  Unreleased Acoustic Songs and Past Albums from Sprockets.

•  A personalized ringtone or outgoing voicemail message that I'll write and sing just for you

•  Your name listed in the thank you’s

•  Your name in a song

•  Limited Edition Shirts and Stickers created by you or with you on it

•  You have the chance to name the Album.

•  Producer credits meaning a percentage of the album

•  Record a song with Sprockets

•  Design the Album Art for the new Sprockets Album

•  Be the star in a Sprockets Music Video

All that, plus... well, I don't mind telling you that I believe that the new songs are the best songs we have written to date. I think you'll like it, too.

Please help if you can, even if "help" simply means reposting this on all of your various social media networks and telling all of your friends about it. Music is our passion and we are very passionate about this album it will not get done without your help

The Impact

By participating to this campaign we will donate a percentage from every album sold to a children's charity while outsourcing our artwork, merchandise and productions costs to small businesses creating work for many people who may be struggling supporting their families. 


You will be helping us get back into to recording studio where we can create meaningful music. Music that is bold enough to say the things we can not express. Music that can live on much longer then we will, songs that can guide our children with music we can be proud we listen too.

The impact that has already taken place has changed my life, I BELIEVE in music again or I should say I trust it again. I feel like a real individual not a drone just working to buy something I won't use. Music has grounded me, I have reconnected with my oldest friend Brave Dave and more importantly I can show my sons that you can do what ever you choose to do and to let nothing stand in your way.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Reposting links to our campaign is a major part of making this work, if you are unable to contribute finaically please post us on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Linkedin, myspace, snapchat etc. Post us in your blogs, bulletin boards, on other peoples pages your word of mouth is the best tool we have .

    You can also help by bringing on sponsorships and or companies that want to get behind the music, so if you have a small business and you want to work together contact us. We are always willing to talk to small businesses, we believe you are the building blocks for our communities and that directly affects our child all over the country, so we are in to help your business.

Music that is bold enough to say the things we can not express. Music that can live on much longer then we will, songs that can guide our children with music we can be proud we listen too.The impact that has already taken place has changed my life, I BELIEVE in music again or I should say I trust it again. I feel like a real individual not a drone just working to buy something I won't use. We are always willing to talk to small businesses, we believe you are the building blocks for our communities and that directly affects our child all over the country, so we are in to help your business.

story:
I am in the process of making a record and your support means everything. 


 I'm Jenny Marie Keris - a singer/songwriter based in Florence, Alabama. I have been playing guitar and writing songs since the age of twelve. For the past thirteen years, I have been writing and recording demos of my original songs. My lyrics combine vivid imagery with personal stories, to create beautiful folk music. 


This past year I was fortunate to meet and partner with, my friend and fellow musician, Jeff Pruet. Jeff plays a variety of instruments such as ukulele and guitar. Jeff also sings and has helped me record many of the demos you can hear on my SoundCloud page. Our sound is unique and described as dreamy and haunting.


Jeff Pruet playing his ukulele. 

I have also had the pleasure of working with sound engineers Albert Rothstein and Jamie Sego, who are also based in Florence. Albert volunteered much of his time, and recorded a few of the tracks heard on SoundCloud. I've collaborated with some very talented musicians, like Kate Hunt (violin) and Evan Lane (Percussion) and Dylan LeBlanc, who will soon be releasing a third record of his own, "Cautionary Tale". Dylan sings vocals and plays guitar on my album. With the help of friends & family, my community, talented musicians, engineers and producers, we have produced high-quality recordings in a professional studio environment. All of this support and inspiration has brought me to the point of making my very first record!

Kate Hunt plays violin at Single Lock Records - April 2015

Albert Rothstein and Jamie Sego - April 2015

My goal for the release of the album is June 2016. 

 My highest hope is to be able to share my music with listeners and the world. I would absolutely love for YOU to be the reason I am able to share these songs! The more support the album gains, the more I will be able to promote, share and market this record. I have received a great deal of support from talented musicians, engineers, and producers offering their services at manageable costs. I am hoping to raise money to afford proper services for sharing and producing my music. I will continue to support others in my community and industry by using local services, which I am lucky to access here in Florence, Alabama.


For approximately $10,000.00 I will be able to give these songs the production and distribution they deserve - but much more will be spent trying to ensure success.


I appreciate your time and support. 


Thank you for listening!


- Jenny Marie Keris
