story:
Deep down you have the same text in English thanks!

La canción que suena en el video es una versión de "La Sombra de la traición de Fangoria" no es el single, el nombre previsto para el tema es "Camaleón" busco productores para mi primer Single y Videoclip

Soy Mina DePop, muchos me habéis conocido por mi canal de Youtube, si aún no lo has hecho te invito a hacerlo aquí https://www.youtube.com/user/MINADEPOP/videos en él me divierto y me muestro tal y como soy, es un espacio en el que me siento libre y feliz en mis videos y entrevistas a personalidades como Mario Vaquerizo o Soraya Arnelas.

Las aportaciones económicas se realizan a través de la plataforma de pagos Paypal, no hace falta que os registréis si no tenéis cuenta de Paypal, solo tenéis que marcar la opción no tengo cuenta Paypal y podréis efectuar el pago a través de vuestra tarjeta de crédito, estos 4000 euros es la parte que necesito para financiar el proyecto que en realidad tiene un coste de 6500 euros.

Quiero comprometerme de una forma honesta,  mi propuesta es enviaros el primer single presentación junto a las recompensas descritas, ¡ojalá lleguemos al 100% del objetivo!

Marc Martín para mí es el mejor productor a nivel nacional ha trabajado para estrellas como Cristian Castro, Christina Aguilera, Paulina Rubio, Avril Lavigne, Carlos Baute, Miguel Bose, Rocio Dúrcal, Ana Torroja, o mis queridas Marta Sánchez y mi adoroda La Pelopony su música es ¡espectacular! ¡Llena de energía! ¡Os necesito mas que nunca para poder grabar mi primera canción inédita y el videoclip del tema!

El videoclip lo quiero grabar con Salva Muste, mi fotógrafo favorito, uno de los mas reconocidos nacionalmente, ha fotografiado y dirigido en sus clips a multitud de estrellas nacionales, creador espectacular de unos videoclips que hacen crecer al artista en imagen y carácter ¡Que ganas de trabajar con estos dos grandes artistas!

Conseguiréis antes que nadie este primer single y videoclip, antes de que se lance en las tiendas, os enviaré personalmente todas recompensas a cada uno de vosotros, siempre unidos a través de esta conexión que se ha creado, yo la catalogaría como “conexión mágica” de otra forma no lo puedo explicar, gracias a cada uno de vosotros.

He pensado en las recompensas con mucho cariño, y las he confeccionando pensado en poder dedicar toda mi atención a ellas, ya que quiero saber de cada uno de vosotros y conoceros un poquito mas.

Os enviaré con mucho amor el single, la sesión de fotos, la letra de la canción, la pista versión Karaoke, ¡vosotros decidís cual es vuestra aportación y el pack que os va mejor!

Las fotografías irán firmadas de mi puño y letra, las dedicatorias en video serán personalizadas para cada uno de vosotros, como siempre vosotros sois lo mas importante para mi y quiero que esto sea una hermandad de verdad y que sintáis el afecto y lo que os quiero.

Por favor difundid esta campaña en vuestros muros de Facebook, a través de tweets, de Instagram, Blogs, Youtube, ¡vamos a llevar alegría y fantasía al máximo de personas posible!

Os agradezco de antemano vuestra colaboración, a todos los que os vais a convertir en productores de Mina DePop, os envío un beso gigante ¡Gracias! ¡Grazie mille!


The song playing in the video is a version of " The Double Fangoria " is not the single, the name planned for the theme is " Chameleon "


I am Mina DePop and you might know me for my YouTube Channel. If you don’t, check me out here https://www.youtube.com/user/MINADEPOP/videos

My channel is a space where I show my true self, a space where I feel happy and free.

My videos, always with a bit of humour, have connected me with my followers through the Spanish music and TV news I have been giving. As well as through interviews to great Spanish celebrities, such Mario Vaquerizo and Soraya Arnelas.

But if there’s something I love doing and it is SINGING and the time has come for you to know me an artist. The song you hear on this video above it´s a cover I have released with an amazing producer, Marc Martin. And this is why I am here, to release my first single and videoclip. Any monetary contribution will be key on succeeding with this crowdfunding campaign. 

Marc Martin is for me the best producer ever. He’s worked with artists such Christina Aguilera and Paulina Rubio. I love his music and I can´t wait to working on my. But this is only a cover and I am aiming to release my own song and videoclip. But I need you help me make my dreams come true. There are several perks you can choose from and I will be grateful with every single one of them.

Salva Muste, a great photographer I have known for a while is the chosen director for my my music video, and I couldn’t be more excited.

If you want to be part of the project and bid for my music, this is your opportunity! I want to offer a quality product. A product you enjoy, you sing, you dance.

The bids/contributions are absolutely essential. I have though on every perk carefully and with loads of love. Check them out!

Please share of this campaign in your Facebook Walls, through tweets, Instagram, Blogs, Youtube. Spread the MinaDeLove.

I am so grateful already… Thanks so Much! Grazie Mile!

SELECT A PERK

7 euros

Enjoy my single before anyone else. You will receive it straight in your email inbox, before the oficial release. You will also receive the lyrics on PDF format.

15 euros

Enjoy my single before anyone else. You will receive it straight in your email inbox, before the oficial release. You will also receive the lyrics on PDF format. I will also send you a signed photography from the music video photoshoot.

25 euros

Enjoy my single before anyone else. You will receive it straight in your email inbox, before the oficial release. You will also receive the lyrics on PDF format. I will also send you a signed photography from the music video photoshoot. A vocal theme with no editing will also be sent to you.

45 euros

All of the above plus Karaoke versión of the song, so you can also sing it!

55 euros

All of the above plus 5 photo from the photohoot. Please note the potos will be sent to you digitally.

70 euros

All of the above plus the HD music video, sent to you digitally.

120 euros

All of the above plus you will appear on the music video credits. How exciting is that?!

150 euros

All of the above plus an invitation to come to the launch of my single in Barcelona. No transport fees included.

300 euros

All of the above plus a dinner with the one and only Mina de Pop

1500 euros

All of the above plus an acoustic concert in a lovely location Barcelona with your friends. Dinner not included.

3000 euros (Only Spain)

This is the best perk you can choose! All of the above plus an acoustic gig on your own house! The perfect night to get together with your friends and enjoy my music.

(Only Spain)

story:
Why am I making this record?

Do you know why you love music?

I do. 

I remember being a little girl and listening to music on the radio, on my headphones, and I had all of these FEELINGS.  Music made me FEEL something. I could feel happy, sad, nostalgic, excited - all driven by music.   And that was like magic.  

And in my life I continued to experience how powerful music can be.  Experiencing the instant unity of a crowd of thousands of strangers, singing their favorite band’s song together at a concert. The camaraderie and connection of a band on stage.  And how the words of a song can make us think a little bit more about ourselves and the world.

I have been writing songs and performing for many years, and I have always strived to, above all else, be the kind of performer that harnesses that power.  To take people on a journey with themselves.  To use music to impact people, to make them feel, think, and go beyond their daily lives. 

I am putting together an amazing group of like-minded musicians to help me make a record that uses the power of music to make people feel more and think more.  And I’m looking for your support.  

If you believe that music has the power to move people, if music has changed your life in some way, contribute even just a little to help me make this record.  I want to give back to the world what music has given me in my life.

If you want to learn more about my songwriting process, my goals, and what I want to achieve, you can also watch this short video my friend Juan made about me, featuring one of the songs that will be on this record here:  The Way You Are

Where is the money going?

This is a good - and important - question!  You should always want to know where your money is going!

While the act of writing and composing music is free, recording it is definitely NOT. Though to be fair, I HAVE recorded some demos in my basement for free, but you do get what you pay for!

So the money raised will go towards the cost of studio time, recording engineers, and mixing of all of the songs, as well as the travel costs for my musician friends to join me wherever I am.  That's it!  Every cent will go towards making the music that you will ultimately hear, and hopefully love!  

In terms of a timeline - the plan is to record during May-July 2014, with a goal to release the record by the end of August.

Thank you all for your support.  It means so much to me to make this record as a labor of love, and as the collective product of people who love music as much as I do.

- Siobahn Hotaling

If you want to find out more about me, visit my website, like me on Facebook, and listen to songs from my first album on my Bandcamp site:

Siobahn.com website

Facebook page

Bandcamp page

story:
PRECESSION: a new album of soul, folk & reggae

Thank you so much for checking out my campaign!!!! I am very excited to present to you this album of genre-blending evolutionary soul music.

My name is Buckman Coe and this is my fourth album, produced by Adham Shaikh and Jason Kechely. It has 13 brand new tracks of love songs and rebel music. We have recorded everything and just need your help to mix, master and produce CD & Vinyl.

How You Can Help: Thanks & Praise!!

We need $8000 to complete the production of the record. Funds will go to my mix engineer & his little baby; my mastering engineer & the island life, and; Stumptown Printers in Portland & their moustache wax. My musicians, producers, and artists have all been paid - we're on the home stretch!!!

There are great perks for supporters of this campaign based upon the gorgeous artwork Daniel Caners created above. The CD & Vinyl are going to look and sound amazing, and you'll get the music 6 months before the official release in Spring 2015. We will be making art-prints, stickers, scarves & patches, and t-shirts. There are ukelele lessons; house concerts; yoga classes; and more great gifts.

The Impact of Your Support

Making this record has involved a lot of artists, engineers, friends, and family. This process of creating songs of the heart, our civilization, and the supremacy of love has been a personal and communal journey.

We need hope and beauty in this world, as well as realness and truth. This music is the grooviest stuff I have ever created, and the vibrations of it are meant to inspire and give us all a dose of compassion and courage.

My mission as a musician has always been to share a message, and I will take these albums we have created together everywhere I tour and play. Having the CDs and vinyl not only allows people to take this music home but also is the lifeblood of my livelihood as a musician.

Blessings Friends and Family!

As an independent musician I have to wear many hats - luckily I love hats! I am not only the song-writer, but also the manager of my band, the visionary for artwork, videos, and more. The challenge of making high-quality music without a label is only possible through hard work and support from fans, friends and family. So thank you, thank you, thank you!!!!

I hope you feel inspired by my music and help make this album a physical reality. Apart from your financial support and choosing a wicked awesome perk, you can also support by sharing this campaign on social media through the Indiegogo links, the videos, and spreading the word the old-fashioned way.

Much Love!

Buckman

story:
Short Summary

We are Alvie & The Breakfast Pigs, a band located in Phoenix, AZ and San Francisco, CA! This campaign is for a very special project for us, we plan to make a music video for our song 'Been Around'. We met up with an amazing Production team, Electric Legend Pictures, to help create a unique and fun concept for our song, that truly encompasses our style! Along with the music video any remaining money you donate will help us with our dream to move to San Francisco, we need help finding practice space for the band and promote our music so we can bring sweet sweet melodies to the ears of San Franciscans everywhere! By contributing to this campaign you are helping us get one step closer to our dream!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1500 to reach our goal. All of the funding will go to the production of this music video first and foremost. 

We know this will be the most rad music video you will have ever laid eyes on with Director, Freddie Paull, Producer, Autumn Lewis, and everyone else at Electric Legend Pictures!

Things this money will go to:

-Cast and Crew:

    We need to pay the production team for all their hard work in this music video, including Grip and Electric, Actors, Production Designers, and Makeup Artists. 

-Art:

   Our concept for this music video involves a huge amount of production design. This money will go towards buying materials and set pieces to help create our vision.

-Food:

   Everyone has to eat! Working long hours on a film set can be exhausting so we want to make sure that everyone gets a Lunch and Dinner as well as a 'Crafty' table, which includes healthy energizing snacks to keep cast and crew happy and healthy!

-Equipment and Location:

   Lights, Cameras, and Mobile Homes! We need to not only pay the crew to operate the equipment, but pay for the equipment itself, which includes renting a grip truck, a RED Scarlet Camera. We need to make sure we have money set aside to pay for anything unexpected that can happen on our location (Which happens to be a mobile home).


We have some AWESOME perks that we want YOU to have for donating to us, including never released tapes of our music, custom artwork from local AZ Artists, and some one of a kind hand drawn Alvie & The Breakfast Pigs shirts!  Check out the perks to the right of the page for a more complete list---->

We will be making updates with some sweet photos of the custom artwork, shirts, and sneak peeks of the video itself, so make sure to keep checking this page!

The Impact

By donating to our campaign you will be helping us spread our music to a greater audience, as well as helping us get to San Francisco, where we hope to gain some momentum as a band. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We don't require a donation, we understand that times are rough. 
    If you are unable to donate but would still like to contribute, please share our campaign with others!


    You can also check out our music and like our page at:

    https://www.facebook.com/thebreakfastpigs

    https://soundcloud.com/thebreakfastpigs

    and you can check out Electric Legend Pictures work at:

    https://www.facebook.com/ElectricLegendPictures

    http://electriclegend.com/

story:
Update [4/20/15]: We're still working on the EP! We set out to have it done in the beginning of the year, but life got in the way as it always seems to. No worries though. We've been able to gather more gear so that we could make this first EP really pop! The songwriting is going well, and we have most of them written, and composed for the most part. We're shooting to make it a 6 or 7 song EP. If we can manage more we'll make a full album. We'll get you all your lovely perks as soon as we can! Thanks for being so patient. We appreciate it more than we can say.


The Pastel Virgins started as a joke. An inside joke that lead to the creation of a Facebook page that we thought no one would like. One evening, deep in a dark basement, we decided to make a mock EP. For some odd reason, people liked it. Recently we were asked if we like to perform live, and WE WOULD, that is, if we had the money to do so. That brings us to now. 1/3rd of the band is employed (in an unpaid internship might I add.) So we've come here to IndieGoGo essentially begging for assistance. That's where you come in. We really only need $100 to cover the costs of performing, but anything more than that would be used to produce an actual EP and acquire some better gear. We're in dire need of funds, at the moment, our percussionist plays a balloon. Yes, you read that right! A balloon. I hope you found this very sad, and through your empathy I hope you'll find the means to donate what you can in return for some cool stuff. Many thanks to you, and yours. Welcome to The Pastel Virgins!

story:
WE ARE SO EXCITED TO HAVE REACHED OUR GOAL!!!!!  THERE ARE 3 DAYS LEFT TO THIS CAMPAIGN AND WE ARE HOPING TO CONTINUE RAISING FUNDS THAT WILL ALLOW US TO PURSUE MORE CONCERTS TO PROMOTE THE MUSIC ON THIS ALBUM!!!!!!!! THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!!!!

Short Summary:

We are Kaia String Quartet, a Chicago-based string quartet founded in 2009.  Our mission is not only to bring classical music to audiences but also to expose music from different cultures around the world.  Currently, our focus is on Latin American music.

We are launching this campaign to raise funds to complete our first album titled, Latinoamérica which is a compilation of works written for string quartet with influences of both folk and classical music of different styles. This CD is special to us because it represents the voice of Latino composers in the United States.  We have had the good fortune to work personally with most of the featured composers and are excited for the opportunity to promote their works through this album. Many of these works are being recorded for the first time.

With your help we will be able to finalize and bring this project to life!

What We Need & What You Get:

We are raising $1500 that will be spent to cover the mastering, post-production and distribution costs.

Perks to encourage your involvement with our project:
“DANCE WITH US”

To show our gratitude for your contribution, we have created different dance-themed gift packages that range from a signed CD to a private salon concert in your home!

All funds will be going towards this project whether or not the goal is met.

The Impact:

This album represents a fusion of cultures as it creates a bridge between Latin America and the United States. This is not only part of our mission but it also communicates who we are individually.

Other Ways You Can Help:

We understand it is not always possible to contribute financially, but rest assured, there are other ways to help!

Spread the word! Make some noise! If you believe in our project, shout it from the rooftops!

Emails, calls, and Indiegogo tools are all outlets for sharing, whatever your style is!

Thank you so much!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Kaia String Quartet

story:
Short Summary

We've finished recording our record and need just an extra push to finish pressing the physical record.  As an independent band there have been many expenses and costs that have been chipped away at over the last year but we want to get this music out to as many people with your help! 

Any contribution to our campaign automatically gets you a digital copy of our album 'Grease & Love' 

The Funding goes towards all physical items that we'd love you to have and keep. There are Dropcards (Physical Digital Download Card), Special Edition Tour laminate DropTags (A way sweeter Digital Download Card), 180g Vinyl Record (For the Audio purists out there), Posters, Shirts, and a limited run of Cassettes for those of you stellar contributors out there. 

If you're feeling so generous; we will even name a song after you on our next record to forever immortalize you in being such a supporter of us grease mongers three. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! 

Share our campaign and take our album from your friends.

story:
Le projet en un coup d'oeil.

Les contributeurs financent le projet de l'Association basée en Suisse qui va poursuivre trois buts espacés dans le temps.

  • Offrir une stèle pour honorer le rayonnement que le Professeur Jacques Ambroise Herady bin Herady a eu durant sa vie. Il est décédé le 18 octobre 2014 à l'hôpital universitaire de Kinshasa. (délai 4 jours)
  • La création du premier Bibliobus pour jeunes à Kinshasa grâce à la collecte de livres, (en Suisse), l'achat d'un bus, ainsi que l'engagement d'une petite équipe sur place en RDC. (1er semestre 2015)
  • Aménagement d'une bibliothèque fonctionnelle pour les Universités de Goma et de Kindu dans l'Est du pays, afin d'offrir de meilleures conditions d'apprentissage aux étudiants . (octobre 2015)

Le Professeur Jacques A. Herady bin Herady

Le Professeur Jacques A. Herady, né le 15 juin 1942 à Kinsangani (RDC) a quitté son pays à l'âge de 17 ans pour venir étudier en Suisse. Il y étudie les sciences politiques, les sciences sociales et le droit. Il repart à Kinshasa en 1977, après avoir obtenu sa licence en Sciences politiques . Il est alors engagé au Ministère de la culture et de l'éducation. Il obtiendra un doctorat en philosophie à l'Université d'Etat de Kinshasa quelques années plus tard, ce qui lui conférera le statut de Professeur. 

Dès lors il consacre sa vie à l'enseignement et à la défense des droits de l'homme  en RDC. Il travaille également au développement de sa communauté, venant en aide aux plus démunis. Il sera animé toute sa vie par le besoin de réunir les gens afin d'être "plus forts ensemble", de partager les biens et les services sans contrepartie "dans l'intérêt de tous", comme il aimait à le dire. 

Les années passant, les régimes changeant, le Professeur subit comme l'ensemble des enseignants la pénurie de moyens, le désintérêt du gouvernement pour l'éducation jusqu'au point où même les salaires ne sont plus versés. 

Le Professeur s'est éteint le 18 octobre 2014 dans le plus grand dénuement, dans la plus grande discretion, bien qu'il ait jusqu'en 2013, consenti à se déplacer dans les Universités de l'Est du pays, à Kindu et à Goma, afin de donner des cours à des étudiants, dans des conditions plus que modestes. 

Il n'a cessé de chercher le moyen d'obtenir des ouvrages de toutes sortes, pour parfaire son enseignement, mais surtout dans le but d'offrir à ses étudiants les supports nécessaires à l'acquisition de connaissances récentes et actualisées. 


Le bibliobus

De manière générale, les enfants de RDC n'ont pas d'accès à la lecture. Principalement par manque d'ouvrages et par manque de moyens financiers et surtout par manque de bibliothèques. 

On trouve à la capitale 2 librairies qui vendent des ouvrages neufs, hors de prix pour la majorité des gens. La vente de livres exclusivement scolaires, toujours usagés,  se fait dans la rue, au marché noir. Les parents ayant payé les frais de scolarisation n'ont plus de budget pour offrir de livres à leurs enfants. 

Le Bibliobus sera un moyen rapide et facile de permettre l'accès à la lecture dans différents quartiers de la capitale. L'idée est de créer autour du bus un espace convivial et accueillant, bien qu'éphémère, dans lequel les enfants pourront s'adonner au plaisir de la lecture, de la découverte d'images, d'histoires qui les fassent un peu rêver tout en les exerçant à la lecture. 

Le Bibliobus de Kinshasa fera office de projet pilote pour le pays. 

Crise des bibliothèques en RDC

L'aménagement d'une bibliothèque universitaire.

La problématique de l'accès aux ouvrages universitaires est la même que pour l'accès aux livres en général. 

Ayant participé à un projet de réhabilitation de 2 universités à Kinshasa, j'ai pu constater l'absence d'ouvrages pour les étudiants, tels que livres, revues spécialisées, recueils de recherches, etc. Ces bibliothèques bien qu'organisées selon les normes internationales, n'offrent en moyenne pas plus d'un livre par étudiant. 

Le choix s'est porté sur l'Université de Kindu en hommage au Professeur Herady qui y a enseigné durant les dernières années de sa vie. 


Comment seront utilisés vos dons:

  • $ 1000 pour offrir au Professeur Herady une stèle digne de son rang et ainsi offrir la possibilité au plus grand nombre de venir honorer sa mémoire.(octobre 2014) 
  • $ 500 pour faire connaître l'Association, lever des fonds pour l'achat d'un bus à Kinshasa par la biais d'un repas de soutien et la création d'un flyer (mars 2015)
  • $ 1500 pour la location de quelques m3 dans une benne pour l'envoi des livres.(avril 2015)
  • $ 2000 pour la mise en place de la structure sur place.(juin 2015) 

D'autres façons d'aider:

  • Partagez ce projet autour de vous grâce aux outils offerts par ce site.
  • Rejoignez l'Association ! (statuts en cours d'élaboration)
  • Participez à la collecte de livres et d'ouvrages.

story:
Short Summary

God has placed a passion on all of our hearts.

For us, we imagine a life that is filled with moments of worship throughout the "ordinary" day. We believe that encounters with God are not confined within the church walls but are seeping out into the streets, schools, and workplaces. We are passionate about seeing worship become a lifestyle, and walking with God in abundant life. 

We are a band from Winnipeg, MB, Canada. Our passion for worship began three years ago when we started to lead worship at a city-wide young adult worship night called Bread We Break. Since then we have fallen in love with worshipping together through music and inviting others to join us.

When God placed it on our hearts to write music, what came out were songs that embodied the idea of coming before God vulnerably and to meet with him. Our community sang these songs together and we realized that these represented the prayers of our generation to be in close unity with God. Together, we want to record these songs so that we can bless our community and friends with prayers that will minister to them as they go about their day. 

We want to invite you to join us in getting the prayers and songs of our generation out into the open as we strive to bring more and more glory to God.

What We Need & What You Get

We have already recorded one single that is going to be part of this EP. We are looking to have a finished product 5 tracks total.

If we do not reach our goal, we will still record as much of the EP as finances allow. However we believe that together we are more than able to reach this goal!

If we exceed our goal, extra funds will be put towards future Bread We Break projects. 

The Impact

Is your desire to walk Jesus throughout your daily life? We hope that the songs on this EP will help you do that! The songs are written from the heart of one longing to be in the presence of Christ. They represent the prodigal story of us returning out of our rebellion back into the loving arms of the Father. We hope that by listening and singing along, you will find yourself in a place with Jesus where nothing else matters but to be with him.

Risks & Challenges

With God's leading and provision, we will be able to accomplish this project together. The biggest hurdle is raising the funds to complete it. That is where you can become a part of our team and play a role! We would love for you to partner with us on this journey!

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Pray- We believe that for this to be successful, God needs to be at the center of it.

2. Share- Building awareness about this project is a huge part! The larger our network, the greater support!

3. Encourage- We would love your feedback. We want to hear how God is moving in your life!

story: My name is Ramel Barnes and I've been rapping for a couple of years now.  Recently I submitted a rap video to Teambackpack.net as part of a contest to be chosen to fly to LA and be apart of the Mission Underground LA/Teambackpack Cypher live auditions.  Out of the 1000 videos submitted I was one of 12 chosen to go to LA for the live auditions. And if chosen from the auditions I get to perform in a live Cypher show with some of the biggest names in the underground rap business.  I'm asking for help in raising funds to make my dreams come true.  Not only do I get to do my music in front of a live audience but I have a chance to meet the professionals that can make my dream a reality.  It will cost $2000.00 to fly myself and my mom to LA, as well as cover the hotel, rental car, and food, and I have little time to do so.  Mission Underground LA is considered a music conference/concert/content party and includes informational and keynote speakers that are executives from independent labels and music companies.  It also gives me the chance to network with industry professionals, Teambackpack staff members, other emcees, and music producers.  This type of event allows artists, like myself, and industry professionals to connect.  I want to win the contest more than anything but either way it can change my life in the music business forever.  Anything I can learn to enhance my craft is one more thing making my dreams come to life.  We are working on putting the funds together but it's only me and my mom and things are tight.  Even if you can't financially help me out, let others know about my project.  Spread the word and be a part of something really special.  I truly appreciate any help I can get.  LA is the destination and winning this contest is my dream.  Help me make this dream a reality.  Check out the link above to watch the video I submitted to the contest and judge for yourself if I'm worth the investment.  If you would like any further information on Teambackpack or Mission Underground LA go to Teambackpack.net.  The dream is alive.

story:
Who is Oberlin Steel? 

Oberlin Steel (OSteel) is a steel drum ensemble based in Oberlin College and comprised completely of Oberlin college students. Founded by students in 1980, OSteel lives to share the infectious joy of pan (another name for the steel drum) music with the Oberlin community and the rest of the world! In the tradition of the great steelbands of Trinidad and Tobago, we primarily play SOCA and calypso music, along with occasional jazz and modern pop tunes. While we love jamming on the pans and spreading the music, OSteel members also share an interest in Trinidadian history and culture: to celebrate it, we regularly strive for self-education and informative community outreach efforts. More about OSteel here: oberlinsteel.com.

Trinidad? Panorama?

Trinidad is where the steel drum originated. It's also where Panorama, the largest pan festival in the world, is held every year as part of Carnival celebrations. Hundreds of steelbands compete over multiple rounds--and we've been invited to join the band Birdsong in 2015 to play alongside over a hundred internationally renowned steel pan professionals.

This experience will allow us to:

  • grow as musicians and performers
  • acquire pan-playing techniques, rehearsal practices, and band management skills that we will integrate into the band upon our return
  • learn first hand about the history and culture of Trinidad and the steel pan
  • bring knowledge back to Oberlin to share with our fellow classmates as well as the greater Oberlin community

We will spend most of our time in Trinidad immersed in an intense rehearsal process with Birdsong. The rest of the time, we'll be working to maximize our cultural learning experience. We plan to, for example, visit local panyards and the pan shop where some of OSteel’s instruments were made.

What We Need and What You Get

The money we raise through this campaign will go towards our airfare, lodging, ground transportation, travel insurance, typhoid vaccinations, and emergency fund (for medical emergencies, for example), which we estimate will altogether cost us around $21,000. In addition to this campaign, we are seeking funding through grants, performance fundraisers, CD/merchandise sales, and other means. We will pay for our food out of our own pockets.

Donors receive perks for being so AWESOME! Check out the bar on the right to see the rewards we're offering at each donation level.

    Risks and Challenges

    We are working around the clock to make sure that our fundraising efforts "pan" out as we wish them to. However, if for some reason we don't reach our monetary goals, the band has plans to go on an extensive, month-long tour over January that will allow us to travel farther, play more, and play bigger than any tour OSteel has gone on before! If you don't feel comfortable with your donation going towards this goal, we will refund it--just shoot us an e-mail telling us so (osteel@oberlin.edu) when you make your donation.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Share, Share, Share, Share, and SHARE! The more people know about us, the better our chances of reaching our goal. Plus, one of our favorite things is spreading pan music with the world! So brighten everyone’s day and share the joy of music by telling everyone you know about OSteel and our campaign!

    You can also purchase CD's and merchandise on our website, oberlinsteel.com. Digital copies of our merchandise are available at oberlinsteel.bandcamp.com.
story_txt:
Who is Oberlin Steel? Oberlin Steel (OSteel) is a steel drum ensemble based in Oberlin College and comprised completely of Oberlin college students. Founded by students in 1980, OSteel lives to share the infectious joy of pan (another name for the steel drum) music with the Oberlin community and the rest of the world! In the tradition of the great steelbands of Trinidad and Tobago, we primarily play SOCA and calypso music, along with occasional jazz and modern pop tunes. While we love jamming on the pans and spreading the music, OSteel members also share an interest in Trinidadian history and culture: to celebrate it, we regularly strive for self-education and informative community outreach efforts. story:
We have gotten out first single on the radio and had a GREAT response from our fans! So now we're ready to take our next step. We are going to record our first full EP and hit the road!! We are looking to do a state wide radio tour this summer to push our new single, 'Anything But Mine', but we need YOUR help!! Thank you so much to all of you that have already helped us in our career and to those that will help us now!! We love all of you!!

"Spread love like peanut butter!"

story:
(Para el texto en Español, haz click aquí)

Who we are

The Bolivian Chamber Music Society (SBMC as per its initials in Spanish) is the only organization in Bolivia dedicated to the presentation, promotion and instruction of chamber music. Our mission is to give Bolivians the opportunity to experience live classical music of the highest caliber in their everyday lives, reestablishing their right to develop artistically without the need to leave the country.
Launched in August 2014, its artistic directors are clarinetist Camila Barrientos, cellist Vania Andrea García, pianist Sergio Escalera, and trumpeter Bruno Lourensetto.

What makes us unique

·  We design innovative concert experiences based on our knowledge of what’s happening in the international music scene and what might be relevant to local audiences.

·  We are a bridge between the best Bolivian musicians living outside of the country and those living in Bolivia, thus creating and uniting a community while opening up a dialogue for exchange and improvement.

·  We are committed to the presentation and promotion of works by Bolivian and Latin American composers.

·  We reach remote audiences that have little or no access to live classical music, always prioritizing children and youth audiences.

2015 Season at a Glance

  • From August 15 to August 29, 2015 in Bolivia.
  • 9 musicians, of which 4 are Bolivian and the rest from Argentina, Brazil, the USA, Canada, the Netherlands and Sweden.
  • 10 concerts in 2 Bolivian cities: Cochabamba and La Paz. They include 2 outreach in-situ performances for over 1,000 children, teenagers, and their families in peripheral, low-income cities: Colcapirhua and El Alto
  • 5 totally different and exciting concert programs.
  • Unprecedented partnership with Bolivia Clásica, a successful music foundation that focuses on training young string players in La Paz city.
  • A 12-day program for young Bolivian musicians, who will receive private instrumental lessons, coachings, and leadership talks; all free of charge.

Where does your donation go?

The total costs of SBMC 2015 concert season will be over $20,000. We already count with important sponsorship and cooperation from organizations like the Youth Orchestra of the Americas, Bolivia Clásica and Simon I. Patiño. We are confident that by raising $5,000 through Indiegogo, we will be able to present our second season exactly as we imagined it. Your donation will help us pay:

  • Domestic flights 
  • Accommodation and lodging 
  • Publicity costs 
  • Design and printing of posters and programs
  • Photography and Audiovisual coverage 
  • Miscellaneous expenses (buying the music we will perform, photocopying material and others)

See our unique perks so that you can select which level is most appropriate for your donation!

The Impact

Although the Bolivian Chamber Music Society is only in its second concert season, numbers from the previous season show the great impact of our endeavours:

 - 5 Concerts, with a total audience of 910 people

- 5 In-Situ Outreach Performances, with a total audience of 1,840 children and teen-agers

- 4 Instrumental Workshops, with the participation of 625 students

- 11 works premiered in Bolivia, out of a total of 17 chamber pieces performed. Premières included the full production of Stravinsky's "A Soldier's Tale", Revueltas' "Ocho por Radio", Bolivian composer Agustín Fernandez's "Munirando", and Terry Riley's "In C", among others. 

Our hopes for the future are to secure continuous funding from public and private Bolivian institutions, as well as support from international organisations.  

What if we raise more money?

If we receive more than the $5,000 pledged:

  • We will hire a 3-person production staff
  • We will invest in tuning and transporting the best possible pianos available in Bolivia
  • A documentary of the 2015 season will be possible!
  • Finally, if we raise 50% more than is needed for this season, the extra money will go directly into our budget for the 2016 season. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributing is not the only way you can help us!

  • Tell your friends about our campaign.
  • Visit our Facebook Page and 'Like' us!
  • Get involved in our activities by checking our website.

Thank you!

story:
Hey Friends, Zach here. Thanks for stopping by my Indie Go Go page and helping to make this record a reality. 


This record has been a dream of mine for a long time, I started writing songs for this project back in 2011.  At the time, I had just finished school and was traveling across the country on a bicycle. Through that experience and the miles I have traveled since, I gained a love for storytelling.  I have been lucky enough to encounter people who have beautiful stories to tell. This project tells my own story as well as that of the people around me. I hope you enjoy it.

story:
Post-Campaign Updates: 

We are sending out updates via email (meaning, the email that you used when you made your contribution.) If you have not yet received any of those from us, 1.) check your promotional or spam mail to see if it landed there first and if you don't find anything, 2.) please reach out to us at thesucculentsband@gmail.com so we can hook you up with your perks! 

We're still finalizing everything. Currently, we need to know which sizes, colors, designs you want of the perks you selected. Once we have those in, we'll place orders to have those printed. Once we have all perks in hand, we'll start shipping those out to everyone. We're expecting to be able to start shipping to you in early-mid December. We'll keep you updated as we go.

In Brief

We are Audrey, Stacey, and Erin -- sometimes known as The Succulents -- a trio of songwriters from Austin, TX. For the past year, we've been pretty quiet as a group, working independently on projects, goals, and dreams, but we've still been busy capturing the music and memories we created together. We are beyond thrilled to be so close to sharing with you the first songs we wrote together -- the ones you may remember hearing at our shows -- on our first full-length record. Additionally, we have a few more items available for the first (and possibly last) time, including Succulents t-shirts, stickers, koozies, and posters! Oh my!


What We Need & What You Get

After some number-crunching, $3,800 is our estimated "break-even" figure that would allow us to move forward with the album production and release. If we can reach this goal, it would mean that these songs will be part of our personal and public collection -- available to revisit forever more. Having a formally released record will also allow us to distribute digitally and to radio.

As a Succulents supporter, you'll get your own little slice of our sweet Succulents sounds and anyone found on the street rocking a Succulents t-shirt, sticker, or koozie, is guaranteed an immediate hug and thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

We aim to ship orders in December so you'll have at least one gift to give or receive!

Other Ways You Can Help

The more supporters we can reach, the better chance we have of reaching our goal.  Spreading the news about our album campaign on social media platforms can go a long way. Tell your friends and neighbors! Convince Uncle Joe that he needs a little Succulents in his life. Start up a conversation with that cute guy or girl down the street about the new album they probably haven't heard. And, of course, tell all the folks you know who may not be active or present on social media. 

We sincerely appreciate each and every like, share, tweet, twerk, toot, yodel, and high five you can give. 


Package Details

Posters.
Packages with posters allow you to choose from one of the options shown below, or a non-show-specific version of Option C (which also includes autographs in the Super Fan Packs).


T-shirts and Stickers.

Available in a feminine v-neck or unisex crew neck, our Ts will be super soft. We're getting the good ones. And stickers too.


                 


Koozies. 

Because koozies.


**Special shout out and thank you to our sweet and talented friends Agathe Fay, Leah Overstreet, and Scott McCauley for the footage used in our campaign video.

story:
A Part Of Chicago's Music History

 In 1956, popular disk jockey McKie Fitzhugh opened his Disk Jockey Show Lounge in the Strand Hotel on Chicago's South Side.  Located at the corner of 63rd Street & Cottage Grove Avenue, the hotel and lounge were a part of a lively nightlife district in Chicago's Woodlawn neighborhood, a district that once contained numerous ballrooms, movie theaters, cafes and nightclubs.
 
The lounge was wildly popular from its opening thanks to Fitzhugh's engaging personality and counted among its patrons and performers the likes of John Coltrane, Sonny Rollins, Gene Ammons, Dizzy Gillespie, BB King, Fontella Bass, Little Walter and Mike Bloomfield, as well as local legends such as Tom Archia, Wilbur 'Hi-Fi' White and disk jockeys Big Bill Hill and Herb Kent.  Sonny Stitt recorded a popular live album there in 1961 titled 'Live At the DJ Lounge'.  In a 2013 interview, David Crosby recounted a revelatory musical experience at the club during a John Coltrane gig.
 
When McKie Fitzhugh died in 1970, Jet Magazine called it 'the end of an era'.
 
As the fortunes of Woodlawn fell, the Strand Hotel went vacant and the lounge space became an auto repair facility for a time.  Eventually, the entire building was abandoned and remained that way for over almost 20 years.
 
Woodlawn is back on a slow ascent and was recently chosen as the site for the Obama Presidential Library. The Strand Hotel has been renovated into residences.  Amazingly, the Disk Jockey Show Lounge sign remained in place on the front of the building for 58 years.
 
 

What We Need & What You Get

 

I have recently secured the sign and have been  so that it can be displayed as part of a wider exhibit on Chicago's musical past.  This fund drive will pay for the restoration work and fabrication of a display rack, and any amount in excess of the goal will be set aside for its upkeep. 

Any donation of $100 or more will be acknowledged with the donor's name on a plaque to be installed on the sign. 

Any donation of $200 or more will receive a copy of Sonny Stitt's album 'Live At The DJ Lounge' on

 

The Impact

The Disk Jockey Show Lounge sign is one of only a handful of artifacts left of Chicago's South Side entertainment heyday that dates back to the early 20th Century.  Preservation and display of the sign provides a tangible way for people to experience a small bit of the excitement that once existed on the South Side and at the corner of 63rd & Cottage Grove in particular.

 

Risks & Challenges

The sign was originally lit by both neon tubing and incandescent chaser lights.  They're not impossible to replace, but they are expensive.  A means for display  will need to be fabricated, and the metal structure of the sign has corroded in some places which will need to be remedied as well. 

The sheer size of the sign (18 feet long, three feet high) and its weight makes transportation and handling difficult, and neon sign fabricators are far from plentiful.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word to anyone you know with a remote interest in history, music, Chicago or any combination of the three!

story:
My name is Kim Belew and I am a conscious rap and spoken word musician.

This year for my birthday, I want a really special gift.  To make my dream of creating a CD of my all original music a reality.  

I am passionate about social justice, healing, community, bringing the generations together, authenticity, vulnerability and love. 

I began writing as a young person to help me get through a difficult childhood and for the last 10 years I’ve been able to share my unique form of music and vulnerability to help others as well.  

Your support is going to make it possible for me to complete my first all original CD and be able to get it out there on a global platform.  

I use music to bring hope, to bring healing, to speak truth, to bridge gaps, to engage conversations and to go directly to the heart.  I’m not just creating my own music but helping others come together and heal through music too.  Starting and leading a community choir made up of people of all ages and backgrounds who are looking for a way to express and feel community and acceptance.  

I’m amazed to be alive today and able to use music as a tool for reaching out to others.  I came from a background of child abuse, living on the streets, psychiatric hospitals and drug/alcohol addiction.  Writing and music were the only thing I had to get me through all of that.  Most people wrote me off as a lost cause.  Now I seek to connect with others who feel lost and give them hope.  For the last 10 years I’ve been able to take those experiences and turn them into a way to help others.  Especially young people who are struggling.  My style of music and words is not like anything else you have ever heard.  Almost every time I share music somewhere, people tell me they never liked rap until they heard mine.  Rap, is an amazing and creative style of music and I’m looking to bring a new and more positive light to this art form through my songs and lyrics.  

I believe in what I’m creating and bringing forth through my music writing. I believe it’s a needed and important expression. I believe in the power of authentic self expression and passion. I believe I have a gift to share with the world.

I was able to record a few songs on the project earlier this year through the generosity of a few people and I am so thankful for that start.   I would love to raise $5000 to complete the CD and production.   About $3000 is what I will need for sound production,  hiring musicians,  recording and mixing of the rest of the songs for the CD and $2000 will go for photograph’s, artwork and production of CD covers and getting them packaged and ready to distribute to the public as well as putting together a release party.  Recording earlier this year sparked my excitement in getting this CD completed so I can share it with the world.  It is very powerful.  

What’s in it for you?  You will be helping fund a dream.  Love.  Completely vulnerable and transparent music.  And hope.  

$100 or more will get you a signed copy of the CD prior to it’s official release

$500 or more you get a signed copy of the CD and a T-shirt

$1000 or more and I will bring a concert to your home

$5000 or more and I will do a rap songwriting weekend as well as a concert in your town

I have faced the challenge of getting people to listen to the music I am creating.  But I believe I was chosen to be a prophet through this style because I can handle the challenge and keep standing firmly with love and determination. 

I know the stigma that rap music has attached to it.  I have been able to overcome many hurdles in this area since I began sharing music.  Helping fund my project is not only helping me overcome these stigmas and obstacles but also helping the young people of our communities overcome as well by giving them hope and an outlet they can relate to.  

If you're unable to help donate money at this time, you can still help by helping me promote my dream and campaign and by sharing it with others.   You could also host a CD fundraising concert and help get people to attend.   Of course, you can hold the vision of achieving this dream and goal with me.  

Thank you for taking the time to read about my dream.  Because now you are a part of creating it.  

Namaste
story_txt:
My name is Kim Belew and I am a conscious rap and spoken word musician.This year for my birthday, I want a really special gift.  To make my dream of creating a CD of my all original music a reality.  I am passionate about social justice, healing, community, bringing the generations together, authenticity, vulnerability and love. 

I began writing as a young person to help me get through a difficult childhood and for the last 10 years I’ve been able to share my unique form of music and vulnerability to help others as well.  

Your support is going to make it possible for me to complete my first all original CD and be able to get it out there on a global platform.  

I use music to bring hope, to bring healing, to speak truth, to bridge gaps, to engage conversations and to go directly to the heart.  I’m not just creating my own music but helping others come together and heal through music too.  Starting and leading a community choir made up of people of all ages and backgrounds who are looking for a way to express and feel community and acceptance.  

I’m amazed to be alive today and able to use music as a tool for reaching out to others.  I came from a background of child abuse, living on the streets, psychiatric hospitals and drug/alcohol addiction.  Writing and music were the only thing I had to get me through all of that.  Most people wrote me off as a lost cause.  Now I seek to connect with others who feel lost and give them hope.  For the last 10 years I’ve been able to take those experiences and turn them into a way to help others.  Especially young people who are struggling.  My style of music and words is not like anything else you have ever heard.  Almost every time I share music somewhere, people tell me they never liked rap until they heard mine.  Rap, is an amazing and creative style of music and I’m looking to bring a new and more positive light to this art form through my songs and lyrics.  
I believe in what I’m creating and bringing forth through my music writing. I believe it’s a needed and important expression. I believe in the power of authentic self expression and passion. I believe I have a gift to share with the world.


I was able to record a few songs on the project earlier this year through the generosity of a few people and I am so thankful for that start.   I would love to raise $5000 to complete the CD and production.   About $3000 is what I will need for sound production,  hiring musicians,  recording and mixing of the rest of the songs for the CD and $2000 will go for photograph’s, artwork and production of CD covers and getting them packaged and ready to distribute to the public as well as putting together a release party.  Recording earlier this year sparked my excitement in getting this CD completed so I can share it with the world.  It is very powerful.  

What’s in it for you?  You will be helping fund a dream.  Love.  Completely vulnerable and transparent music.  And hope.  
$100 or more will get you a signed copy of the CD prior to it’s official release
$500 or more you get a signed copy of the CD and a T-shirt
$1000 or more and I will bring a concert to your home
$5000 or more and I will do a rap songwriting weekend as well as a concert in your town

I have faced the challenge of getting people to listen to the music I am creating.  But I believe I was chosen to be a prophet through this style because I can handle the challenge and keep standing firmly with love and determination. 

I know the stigma that rap music has attached to it.  I have been able to overcome many hurdles in this area since I began sharing music.  Helping fund my project is not only helping me overcome these stigmas and obstacles but also helping the young people of our communities overcome as well by giving them hope and an outlet they can relate to.  If you're unable to help donate money at this time, you can still help by helping me promote my dream and campaign and by sharing it with others.   You could also host a CD fundraising concert and help get people to attend.   Of course, you can hold the vision of achieving this dream and goal with me.  Thank you for taking the time to read about my dream.  Because now you are a part of creating it.  Namaste

story:
Short Summary

Hey, guys! My name is Jackie Gomez, and my artist name is ArwenStarsong. I am a small town girl from Madera California with a huge passion for music. I have always loved music since I was a little kid. I would always be singing somewhere, whether it was in a choir or on a stage or talent show or karaoke. I have been into writing music since about my senior year of high school, but I have only started to publish my work this past year. Most of what I do is a variety of genres, but I am mostly a Rock/Metal singer. I am all by myself. I write all the music and the lyrics with no band or help from a company. I am entirely self-produced and self promoted. :). I currently am going to Fresno State and majoring in Theatre Arts (Acting) and I have also released one Self-Produced album, Starsong and one single, Fracture. I have a small youtube channel (ArwenStarsong) that I also wish to use to try and make money not only to keep myself stable, but to give back to charity as well! I am currently trying to produce my 2nd album, but as of now I am beginning to have a little difficulty with the current equipment I own. If I could have any sort of help, I could produce something that is better sounding and I can use the power and magick of music to give back to the community and to live my dream: to spread the joy that is music. Unfortunately, I am unable to afford better equipment because the job market has not been kind to me. I work a seasonal job but it is not enough to get by and I have been trying to get a part time job, but school and rehearsals for school make it hard.

What We Need & What You Get

All I need to do is purchase better equipment or a better space and equipment to record with. I also need to advertise myself till I can get me a stable paying job or a record deal.
I need:
-a microphone that can withstand my aggressive vocal style (screaming, too)
-filters
-stands for the micorphone (or mic arm)
-acoustic paneling
-a better recording program
-a video camera (for youtube and commercial purposes)
-a pair of better headphones
-CD's to distribute
-advertising

Any leftover money will be donated to charity :)

You get-
-free copies of my music (digital, since making the covers and stuff won't come till later)
-free DVDS of all my music videos (or digital copies)
-credits in my music videos because you contributed to help me make the music
-my undying gratitude
-signed photos (cause I model, too)
-if I run into you in person, we shall selfie! <3! #selfie #thankyou
-if you have a youtube, your channel will be mentioned in my videos in the credits (just leave your channel name and link for the description box as well)
-to help donate money to charity as well.

The Impact

I want to get my music out there. Anything you give will help me make it better sounding and get me out there more! Your donation will not only help me live my dream, but it will also help me be able to give to those in need! I want to use the power of music to encourage people to not only live their dreams, but to love themselves and love others as well. Giving back to the community has always been my biggest passion besides music and I want to use whatever I make to not only pay off my tuition for college, but to donate to cancer research, autism awareness, animal shelters, and hospitals. :) You''ll help me live my big dream of being a performer AND you will help those in need! and your contributions will all be deeply appreciated and ENTIRELY used for these purposes!

Risks & Challenges

The music business is tough. I know it is. I have been trying for years to get myself out there, but all I need is your help, world. If you cannot donate, please just share the link to this campaign! It will help get the word out! I know if I just put my heart fully in and sound better, I can get out there and hopefully beat the tough competition. I will be competing against some pretty good indie artists, but I am not gonna let that bring me down!
I really want this. I have wanted it my entire life. My family is full of people with dreams, but none of them really got to live them, so I want to break the chain and live mine. I also want to give back to those who have helped me by donation to charity and research funding.

Other Ways You Can Help

Raise the noise! Sound the alarm! CLICK DAT SHARE LINK! Again, anything you do helps! If ya don't have money, someone else may! Thank you so much! <3

story:
Josh has signed a deal with Kent Wells Productions and Go Time Records (GTR) in Nashville to produce Josh's next CD, featuring all original songs. Kent Wells has been Dolly Parton's bandleader and guitar player for 25 years. His production company has produced several of Dolly Parton's CDs, including her new offering “Blue Smoke”. Kent feels that Josh has the musical talent and work ethic to be a successful recording artist. It is a true statement of his confidence in Josh that Kent would choose to work with a 19 year old on his first professional musical venture.

While this is an exciting opportunity for Josh, it requires financing for the production of the CD and to do appropriate promotion of the CD once it is completed. For that reason we are reaching out to those that know Josh and appreciate his talent to help provide financial support for this effort. Josh is looking for donors to contribute to help offset the costs involved with this effort.

Josh has built a strong and loyal following and has done many shows in the greater Baltimore area. He is the youngest inductee into the Maryland Country Music Legends Hall of Fame. He has been featured in local newspaper and magazine articles.

Josh has the talent, drive and desire to be a successful musician. This incredible opportunity can help him reach that goal, but he needs the financial backing for this endeavor. Thank you for considering contributing to this project.

Please, make a contribution to support this project. We have opened a dedicated account for these funds to be used exclusively for production and promotion of his CD.

story:
Potential backers...

 I've been prompted to give a description to share more about what we're raising funds to accomplish. It's simple really. We need to finish an album. The music is in place. Time has already been spent. We're excited about the outcome so far, but we've come to a point where we are exhausting our capital. Working with producer Glen Marshall has brought a fresh and real feel to the Pearly sound and it needs to be shared. We still have some work ahead of us and need to meet the mastering costs, as well. Any amount pledged at this time would be greatly appreciated.

There are a lot of contributing factors that go into creating your favourite songs and albums. I've heard people say to me, that they never imagined what really goes on nor did they even stop to think how much effort and money goes into the process. There is the inital writing of the material, the rehearsal, collecting and paying the right musicians. Arranging, recording, mixing and mastering. Over-dubs, Back-up vocals... the list can be endless. The thing is, this all costs money.

I am a working musician. I create produce and perform my music anyway and anywhere I can. It's a meager living, and I don't mind that. Long forgotten are the dreams of Fame and Fortune. I, at this point would be very happy with being able to just provide for my family and make sure tht machine keeps functionong at the pace it is. In order for me to do that though, I need to have a product to promote and sell. This is why i am putting out this plea to you.

I have sunk a great part of capital into my heart /lifes work. I need to finish this album and I'm doing everything I can think of to make the end result a reality. To be honest... I'm coming up short. The material is very strong and I stand behind it and can back it up without worry. The buzz has begun on a small but global stage and it seems Pearly just may have his shot. Again, hard to do without the product/album. 

So many of you have been so very supportive over the years and for that I Thank You. I guess, I'm hoping that you may go just a little further with that support and make a contribution towards the completion of my record. 

I have set up an "indiegogo" campaign to collect contributions on my behalf. The process isn't difficult. The website gives you all the information you'll need to contribute. The only think it dosen't tell you is how in making a pledge, you could change and better my entire life. The appreciation i feel everytime I see that someone has believed in me enough to help is at times overwhelmimg.

Thank You for listening and please know that you mean the world to me for even considering to help.

Pearly Jenkins is a character created by singer/songwriter Paul O'Toole. He was created as art and to present a genre of music Paul holds close to his heart. We will be posting Paul's and Pearly's bios for you to look over. Paul's was written by Juno award winner and Americana/Roots icon Fred Eaglesmith. Here goes...

Who is PAUL O'TOOLE ... 
​ 
​"Paul O'Toole comes out of Norfolk County, southern Ontario. Ironically, one of the bible belts of Ontario. He's a guitar playing ex-rockabilly icon, playing for years in bands such as "The Kil'billys", "Kingspeed" and "Dangerous Stairs". He's got a deep growly voice and the hard-assed level stare of not enough sleep and too much substance. His friends call him "The Old One". He's danced with the National Ballet of Canada. He's been in Nashville. He's an award winning songwriter. He's been in rehab, back out again, back in trouble and back out again. He hasn't fit in. He hasn't fit in the way that artists don't fit in. He's been on the path of soul-searching and the quest for integrity and his own personal values. Paul has left the rockabilly scene, quit the substance and quit the fast lane. He traded it all for his soul. Every time you hear Paul O'Toole, that's what you hear - his soul. He bleeds all over the stage, the way any smoky lounge singer bleeds when they sing. He invokes images of Willie P. Bennett or Tom Wilson, Greg Brown or even Tom Waits. He is a great songwriter and has a knack for putting you in his world. He has a powerful, powerful voice and he can deliver a song in only the way true experience can. Paul O'Toole is a force, that soon everyone will be reckoning with". 
​ 
And now, Pearly...

Pearly Jenkins BIO

Who is Pearly Jenkins? 
Pearly Jenkins comes out of the "deep south" of Canada... on the Northshore of Lake Erie. A little rural place, out of the way called Walsh Station. Nestled between Turkey Point and Vittoria in beautiful Norfolk County. 
He started his singin' career at a young age singin' all the rockabilly hits he could think of. The fillin' station he resided at had it's share of characters. Some from North Carolina. They came to cure the tobacco, which was the crop of choice in the area. Thru some of these characters and some talented locals, he was able to experience all kinds of music but primarily country, bluegrass, rockabilly and blues. He gravitated to this and vowed to carry the music he loved so much to the masses. A great and heavy decision for such a young boy. 
As the years went by he has grown into an amazing performer and songwriter. Known to write and record a song a day, his catalog is vast. Years of performing, pretty much "anywhere'd they'd listen" has made him a wanted force in the live music arena. Pearly Jenkins has shared the stage with Johnny Cash, Jerry Lee Lewis, Merle Haggard, Jack Dekeyzer, Tom Wilson (Blackie and the Rodeo Kings), Fred Eaglesmith, Washboard Hank, Chili Taylor, Dirt Broke and the Poorboys, David Lee Murphy, The Dixie Flyers, Bighouse and many, many more... 
His new project is a collection of songs to be recorded and produced by the wildly talented record producer, Glen Marshall. Glen has seen something in Pearly that he deems a special and artful twist on classic musical genres. 
The album is slated for release, when the album is slated for release. You will be informed at that time. 
Keep an ear out for Pearly. He just might change your life a little... He'll definately delight.

Loyal Fans...

There has been some question as to who Pearly Jenkins is, and why he is. Pearly is a creation. That's what I do, I create. I'm not hiding or trying to run away from anything or anyone. He was very spontaneously conceived, as an outlet for nothing more than creativity, and has allowed me to achieve and surpass my venture into a genre of music I hold very close to my heart. All the background of Paul O'Toole is still there. The hellish years. The clawing back years. If it wasn't for Paul O'Toole, the character wouldn't exist nor would the art and music.
I've been asked for a back story for Pearly. I have laboured over this and with a little help from a great friend, realised that he already has a back story. It's mine! The rock'n'roll. The singer/songwriter. The alcoholism and drug addiction. The family... lost and found. The heartbreak and the complete love. Clawing my way back from hell and standing tall. Learning how to live again... It's all mine.
I have been overwhelmed at the response this idea has brought me. I appreciate every bit of it.
For those wondering and asking... Glen Marshall and I are working very hard in the studio to bring you a work like no other. We have been fortunate to have had some very magical moments and work with some incredible players, so far. These works take time and we are on track. I've said it before and now I will again, I'm honoured and humbled to be in this position right now.
So, hats off to Pearly! Thanks for pushing me to be a better artist and for pushing me aside, just enough to experience a ride that gets more exciting by the day.
That's all I've got... for now.
Thank You.
Your friend,
Paul O'Toole/Pearly Jenkins

story:
Who we are

Hi we're Martyna and Thomas, otherwise known as the Oskar Duo. We have named ourselves after Oskar Milasius, a French-Lithuanian poet who once described himself as ' lithuanian poet who writes in French' therefore connecting our two countries. We met in London where we both studied and two years ago we decided to create a piano duo which concentrates on four hand repertoire. Our first aim together was to enter a competition and we were overjoyed to receive the first prize in the Roma International Piano Competition "F. Chopin" in Italy. Since then we have been performing in France, Italy and the UK and we feel that the time has come for us to record our first CD. Your contribution would make this dream come true, and by contributing to this campaign we will make sure you receive our album. This would mean the world to us and for that we need your help. 

The project

We need 2300€; this would cover a sound engineer, a photo session for the album, CD designing and pressing. We are very grateful for the Nicholas Boas Charitable Trust who is generously supporting us by providing the recording space and by letting us use his beautiful Steinway grand piano for this recording. We chose a wonderful and contrasting programme which we feel define us and our musicianship: poetry with Schubert Fantasy in F minor, humour with Barber's quirky Souvenirs and virtuosity with Ravel's fiery Rhapsodie Espagnole. We are more than confident that you will enjoy our selection of pieces whether you are new to classical music or are passionate about it. If we do not reach our target we will seek to get this album out even if that means that the editing will have to be done by Martyna's husband and the CD design by her brother-in-law, but we would rather not risk a family fight over this and get professional involved instead!

What it means to us

We are both busy performing alone and together and meet as often as we can in Berlin where we both live. We really love making music together and this particular programme has been already heard in many halls across Europe where we have performed it. After the concerts we have always been asked whether we have a CD and we feel that this CD would enable people to bring home a little of the joy we have been able to give them during our recitals. 

Other ways you can help

At this stage in our career a CD means people knowing about us and if you're not able to contribute financially you could still make a difference by sharing this campaign with your friends letting them know that they can be a part of young performers dream. Get the word out!!  You can share this on Facebook, Twitter or other social networks and this way help us achieve our dream.

story:
Rockett Queen

Rockett Queen is nearing completion of our new record to be released in 2015 with Zac Maloy (songwriter/producer to the stars, from Carrie Underwood to Orianthi; Adam Lambert to Shinedown; Michelle Branch to Blake Shelton; Cavo to Black Stone Cherry). On top of that, we are getting ready to hit the road in support of the West Coast with Creed singer Scott Stapp's “Proof of Life Tour” in November. The Scott Stapp “Proof of Life Tour” with special guests Rockett Queen will launch on November 1st in Little Rock, AR and with continue through the 22nd of November. Tour markets include major venues in Dallas, San Antonio, Houston, Lubbock, Tempe, AZ, Anaheim, CA, West Hollywood, CA, Las Vegas, NV, Sacramento, CA, Boise, ID and Seattle, with a few more dates yet to be announced


The Push

To help support the tour, we will relaunch our EP, "Goodnight California" with two new songs "Hey God” and "Attitude", three new videos - "To Be Loved and A'Live" , "I Hate You" (performance video) and "Since You've Been Gone" (concept video) and new packaging and artwork. 


Touring Isn't Cheap

As you can imagine, a tour this major isn't cheap. Along with the expenses associated with touring - van and trailer repairs, gas, food, lodging, road crew, merchandise manufacturing, new song mixing, mastering, production costs and promotional expenses to name a few, Rockett Queen has already dedicated enormous resources out of our own pockets to fund the major new recording with Zac Maloy in Nashville, Tennessee. The new record is slated for release in 2015, we have incurred production, mixing, mastering, travel expenses, etc. to take that next proverbial step with our music and our career.


We Need Your Help!

So the tour is booked, the EP will be repressed/reissued and the new record is nearing completion!  But we need your help to fund the related costs mentioned above!


Rockett Queen Bio

Storming out of East Texas, Rockett Queen burst onto the scene in 2003 and has since been a force with which to be reckoned. Fronted by charismatic, explosive lead vocalist/guitarist Walter Lee, and driven by the untamed Jay Scars on lead guitar, Chaz Graves on bass, and Seven on drums, they have cultivated immense recognition and rave reviews.


Not every band can boast the title "Best unsigned band in America"... Rockett Queen can. Rockett Queen quickly earned the title "Best Unsigned Band in America" by winning the contest that led their hit single "The Next Big Thing" to be featured in the full length film "John Tucker Must Die." This earned them a spot on the soundtrack along with The All American Rejects, Cartel, Ok Go and many more. With the buzz building, it wasn't long before MTV beckoned and featured "The Next Big Thing" in their hit TV show "Newport Harbour".


Rockett Queen has persevered playing thousands of shows for over 25,000 fervent fans with artists including Hinder, Powerman5000, Fuel, The All American Rejects, Yellowcard, New Found Glory, Story Of The Year, Bowling For Soup, Coheed and Cambria, Thrice, Bad Religion, The Sounds, Senses Fail, My Chemical Romance.


What We Need

Again, an undertaking of this magnitude is not without its challenges! Before we travel even one of the nearly 8,800 miles, we will need to make significant van and trailers repairs, we will need money to complete the new songs for the EP, mastering, press new CDs, merchandise to sell, gasoline, lodging, food, crew help and money to make it all possible. We're making our plans as close to the bone as possible to make this whole venture as economical as possible, but even if we eat ramen noodles every day - touring is not cheap!


The Rockett Queen Breakdown:

Van Repairs: $2,000

Trailer Repairs: $1,000

Gas/Tolls: $2,400

Lodging: $1,200

Audio Production: $1,000

Mastering: $900

CD/Merch Production: $1,500

Total Funding: $10,000


What You Get

That's where you come in! We've been overwhelmed by the love and support we've gotten over the years, and we know that we are in good hands! The most important part of this tour is that we get to see you, play for you and finally meet some of the good folks who have gotten us this far!!!


But to do that we'll need your help. We have dug deep and come up with what we think is a pretty amazing list of goodies for every donation level! Peruse the perks to the right and see what you can afford. Remember every little bit helps, no amount is too small.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!!!! Tweet, post, share, the more you post and share this campaign the better chances we have to reach our goal.

story:
Short Summary

 Hello! We are Angelmaker and we are about to embark on our quest of album recording and completion! Our campaign is designed to be the pre order for our full length album as well as pave the road for all our future endeavours as a band. This campaign is going to help us be the best Angelmaker we can be,  allowing us to print more merch, tour, and most importantly complete the full length album we have spent the last year writing.


What We Need & What You Get

 The money we fund is going directly into the Angelmaker bank account. We have never made money doing what we love and we never plan to. Everything is recycled into better merch, better music and ultimately a better Angelmaker. This campaign features some extremely unique perks from hand written lyric books to personalized shout outs. This is the pre-order for the album, so you can expect physical copies, early digital downloads, and campaign exclusive merchandise. 


The Impact 

Funding this album is backing the future of deathcore music: we do this because we absolutely love it, and through the passion and excitement of our devoted fans we have decided to make this more than just a hobby. This is an experiment, and we know that through talent and passion one is capable of success. If you are a fan of our music or even a fan of what we stand for, this is a way you can help us achieve success.  

Risks & Challenges

 We understand that to some individuals, crowdfunding is an abused luxury, and in some cases can be entirely true. We also know that not everyone is capable of sparing their hard earned cash on an art project, which is perfectly fine! To better plan the future of our band we want to see what a 'funding through donation' platform such as Indiegogo is capable of.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether its showing a friend our song off YouTube or buying a t-shirt from our merch store, you are contributing to our passion and we love you so much. Thank you! \m/
