story:
OK, but who are y'all?

Individually our backgrounds are different, but we come together in building creatively for hip hop. Just 2 out of the box thinkers overcoming doubt & taking action!

We met 3 years ago through a mutual friend, & since have build a friendship that led to multiple jam sessions, shows & opportunities together within the Orlando scene. As individual artist Our styles don't fit any particular mold & we want to share that with as many people as we can. For the past 10 years we have been practicing, performing anywhere from living rooms, churches, coffee shops, festivals & clubs. Though we have separately seen slight notoriety from sites such as Rapzilla, GrindTime Now, & Vice.com we know this is only the first step towards a long journey. That reality is what makes this the process a little scary, but that's ok. We represent the generalities that are true in all of us, the fears, the visions, People with a past & a present. We want to share our perspective the only way we know how.


What We Need & What You Get

We have managed to finance our studio time with top notch producers, so you're promised a quality sound (thank GOD). Your role is so important because you're helping us materialize it!

The funds will be used exclusively to distribute and promote the EP And the more money we raise, the more YOU get.

To be more specific, here is how the funds will be used:

  • Cover Art, Logo and Manufacturing of the EP: 
  • Promotion (Listening Party, Flyers etc) 
  • Merchandise (T-Shirts, stickers, buttons etc)
And we're not just asking for donations: we have something special to offer each and every contributor. We want to get people as involved as we can in the process. Attention to detail is what we're going for. Our flyers will look like menus & we have a sketch artist drawing up anime inspired art for our T-Shirt & sticker designs. We will be updating you all with the final look of these products.

 

                                                                  (Design #1)
                                                      Art by Leilani Rodriguez
 

Appetizers..

This is going to be a themed project that will represent what we do in a small way. Brainchild makes solo beat albums and all beats no more than 2 minutes each. To play into what he does as an artist & also showcase the emcee element we decided to put out a 7 song project where all songs are named after apps, & foods we like to munch on. As well, all songs will be two and a half minutes or less. Once the project is done we will host a listening party  for our contributors and supporters showcasing the project. We will be serving all of the food on our track list (menu).  We want to show you the potential of what we are cooking!

TRACK LIST

  1. CHEESE STICKS
  2. CALAMARI
  3. WINGS
  4. SHRIMP COCKTAIL
  5. MINUTE RICE
  6. TOP RAMEN
  7. MOON PIE 

Other ways to contribute.

  • RE-POST! Tell friends & family 1 post can make a difference.
  • September 11th we have a FREE show at THE BRINK in downtown Orlando, you will donate a dollar just for showing up. (Contact me for your free ticket)
  • Your interest is a donation in our eyes. If you would like to be updated on the project & its release feel free to let us know. Joining our mailing list is a great way to further what we do.

story:
PC: Madi Cheslock/Madison Abbey Photography

Hello world! We're Squints, and we are a band from the beautiful city of Boston, Massachusetts.

We’re a lo-fi, indie, pop-punk trio from Boston, MA. Joe Burr,and Mario Tavolieri (Guitars & Vocals), met bassist, Mike Williamson, in the Fall of 2012, while living as suite-mates at Suffolk University in Downtown Boston. After bonding over hours spent watching Boy Meets World and playing Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 4, Squints was born as a means to come to terms with impending adulthood. 

Since that moment, we've been working hard to book shows, record demos, and fine-tune our material, and this Indiegogo campaign is the final step toward creating our first-ever professionally produced studio album.

This campaign is raising funds for our professionally recorded album with Bryan Fennelly, a Boston-based producer, and engineer. Together, we are digging into our original material with Bryan, writing arrangements, and crafting our own unique sound. 

We’ve been able to cover the costs of recording and producing one song, which is ready for you to check out right here on this page. This first song is called “Don't Leave” and you can check it out below!

While we were able to fund the recording process for "Don't Leave" on our own, costs for recording an album of this quality add up quickly. With that said, this campaign can give us a unique opportunity to collaborate and make great art together. Your donation will cover following costs of my project:

1. Pre-Production: This is where everything starts. We will sit down with Bryan to start shaping the arrangements for each of the songs for the album. We’ll hold rehearsals to fine-tune the songs, arrangements, and talk through new and exciting ideas for how to approach the recording process.

2. Recording: This is when we enter the studio and start capturing the music and where the songs become what you'll hear on this album. This campaign will play a huge role in making sure we have enough time to capture great performances for every member of the band.

3. Mixing & Mastering: Each track will get mixed to create the right balance between instruments, texture and color that make up a track. As a final step, the album will be mastered from beginning to end, so the listening experience is cohesive and carefully choreographed from start to finish.

PC: Madi Cheslock/Madison Abbey Photography

And what will you get for your generosity and support? So many awesome things!

We are so appreciative and grateful for any support you can lend to this campaign. In exchange for your generosity, We've put together a really exciting group of gifts that are available exclusively through your participation in this campaign.

Check out some examples below and a full list to the right!

PC: Madi Cheslock/Madison Abbey Photography

It's hard to express how much this project would change our lives.

When our band first formed a few years ago, we never dreamt that we would be in this position. This whole experience has been so surreal and we're wicked thankful for all the support. We originally just formed this band to get away from all the stresses of being a young adult and trying to figure our lives out. But Squints quickly grew into something bigger after we released our first songs to the public. The feedback was unreal and it inspired us to take our music to the next level. When Plaid Dog Recording reached out to us we knew it was the perfect opportunity to do that. 

Music has always always been a huge part of our lives. We all had bands throughout high school and even played a few shows here and there. All of our friends and family have been supporting us since the very beginning and have helped us reach this point. Our lyrics are inspired by the suburbs we've grown up in and all of the experiences that came with it. We hope our music connects back to our hometowns and that people can really relate to it. We also want our story to inspire younger artists to keep pursuing their music. 

We've never made a professional music project like this before, so we're eager to get back in the studio. In the mean time, we'll continue writing, practicing, and perfecting our sound to give you guys some great music to listen to. With your support, we can make all of this happen and record our first professional album.


PC: Madi Cheslock/Madison Abbey Photography

If you're ready to contribute, just click the pink "Contribute Now" button on the top right of this page! Every little bit counts, and we’re so grateful for all your support.

If you've got folks in your network that would be interested in supporting us please help get the word out and make some noise! There are social media share buttons on this page, and please tell your friends how grateful we are for this support.

Thank you so much for checking out my campaign page. We can't wait to share this music with you.

We also want our story to inspire younger artists to keep pursuing their music. 
We've never made a professional music project like this before, so we're eager to get back in the studio. In the mean time, we'll continue writing, practicing, and perfecting our sound to give you guys some great music to listen to. With your support, we can make all of this happen and record our first professional album.



PC: Madi Cheslock/Madison Abbey Photography

If you're ready to contribute, just click the pink "Contribute Now" button on the top right of this page! Every little bit counts, and we’re so grateful for all your support.
If you've got folks in your network that would be interested in supporting us please help get the word out and make some noise! There are social media share buttons on this page, and please tell your friends how grateful we are for this support.
Thank you so much for checking out my campaign page. We can't wait to share this music with you.

story:
The Vision

Art activities are dwindling and suffering from lack of funds particularly in our urban areas. There are very few programs, if any for children and families. This year in 2014 , The Firey Strings Company (FSCO) has been invited to partner with the Manna House Workshop in East Harlem. FSCO is proposing to raise money for the Manna House summer Workshop and for our Radiance 2 Festival.

 

The Radiance Festival 

FSCO  produces a yearly event called the Radiance Festival . The festival started as a culminating activity from summer composer’s workshops. It has organically transformed into a fantastic way to bring artist together with the community. Our first annual Radiance Festival in 2013 featured composers Jay Rodriguez, Geraldine Eguiluz thanks to the Canadian Council of the Arts,  Hamiet Bluiett/Frank Lacey and a 10 piece Firey String Sistas! Ensemble. The festival was held at the beautiful Shape Shifter’s Lab, Brooklyn. 

  

Our Goal

On March 2, 2014, our second annual Radiance 2 Festival, will feature world class artists trumpeter, composer Cecil Brigewater and cellist, composer Akua Dixon (Yamaha Artist). Their music will be performed by an exciting ten piece Firey String Sistas! ensemble- Violins; Frederika Krier, Ariadna Kryazheva, Megan Atchley, Jennifer Axelson, Violas: Charisa Dowe-Rouse, Pamela Hamilton, Cellos: Nioka Workman, Nicole Verderosa, Bass: Melissa Slocum and Harp: Riza Printup. 


Donate 

Please donate to the Manna House Summer Workshop and help us encourage and support young people in the arts  by bringing Radiance 2 to Manna House Workshop in East Harlem. Become a ‘GEM” of the Firey Strings Company. Check out the cool perks that you will receive. Purchase a $50 festival access pass!  

Visit our website  for  more  information and questions about us  at  www.fireystringscompany.com or  call 646.580-2291.

 

Updates


Akua Dixon's appearance in Radiance 2  Festival at Manna House Workshop on March 2, 2014, has just been endorsed by YAMAHA!



Thank You 2013 'GEMS'!

Please Note: We would like to thank our 2013 'Gems' for supporting us. W. Bruno, J. Keepnews and B. Clemens have won a free pass to this year's festival. Please confirm your attendance at loftartsproductions@gmail.com. Renew your pledges, join our efforts, give an in-kind gift and spread the word. (We are also seeking designers, videographers and photographers to donate services.)

 

Our Sponsor 

Firey Strings Company is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Firey Strings Company must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Texas Chainsaw Dust Lovers needs you !

Sorti de terre en juin 2011, TCDL ce sont quatre fringants jeunes hommes bien élevés venus réveiller les morts avec leurs riffs trapus. Avec un style aux confluents d’un son rock terreux façon redneck, d’un punk énervé et de power chords bien lourds, le groupe se produit depuis décembre 2012 dans les salles de Paris, Nantes et Tours.

Un nouvel EP The Wolf is Rising

Après un premier EP « Born Bad » et un single « White Teeth » enregistré à la maison, le groupe décide de voir plus grand. Pour notre second EP intitulé « The Wolf is Rising », nous voulons passer un cran au dessus dans la production, et souhaitons enregistrer dans un véritable studio. Deux studios pour être exact ! De plus, nous envisageons de presser ce nouveau cinq titres en vinyles. Afin de financer notre projet et le mener à bien, nous avons besoin de votre support.

Ce que nous vous proposons

Bien sûr, si vous nous aidez, vous ne repartirez pas les mains vides !

Nous vous proposons d'acquérir nos EP et single sous format digital, des T-shirts et bien sûr "The Wolf is Rising" en format vinyle.

Un grand merci pour votre soutien.

TCDL

story:
My name is Pete Cater and I play drums.

Having first picked up a pair of sticks in very early childhood I have now been playing for more than fifty years.

Born into a musical family I was fortunate to have great influences and access to inspiration from my first days. Such was the power of this inspiration that I made it my goal very early on to aim as high as possible, seeking a level of attainment akin to that of the legendary drummers in my father's record collection. 

Not blessed with a formal music education or an entree into the upper echelons of the music industry it was very much left up to me to make my own way when it came time to become a professional player. This I have done and I believe that you can do it too. 

I first began performing at a professional level in 1977, took my first private students in 1982 and have been teaching at university/college level since 1994.

My career as a performing musician has always and continues to encompass a broad range of musical genres, however it is as a jazz musician, with particular emphasis on big band playing that I have forged an international reputation. In 2015 I was voted in the world's top 5 jazz drummers by Rhythm magazine, the only non-USA player to be nominated in that year's poll.

I am proud to be affiliated with Premier drums, for whom I appear as international brand ambassador, the Avedis Zildjian company, and Vater drumsticks.

My lifelong quest for attainment in my field, having been inspired in very early childhood by legends like Joe Morello, Buddy Rich and Louie Bellson has led me to scrutinise the techniques of drumming very closely. I have spent much of the last three decades analysing and deconstructing the approaches of all manner of drummers across the entire musical spectrum.

However, not content merely to replicate what has gone before I have fused the traditions of the past masters with contemporary concepts and developments both with regard to technical facility, musical application, and with particular emphasis on creativity and improvisation. 

Decades of research and development have led me to a point where I feel I have a logical, easily understood  and fully formed approach to the instrument, and that I have the tools to simplify and revolutionise drumming for players of all ability levels.

My work as an educator in music colleges, masterclasses, clinics, drum camps and with private students has proved that a great many students feel overwhelmed by the amount of information available and the required level of knowledge. My approach simplifies and strips away unnecessary baggage and will help the student understand how everything comes back to a very small number of key parameters that are at the root of everything all drummers do. 

Now it is time to share this with the world. My never-ending quest for self-improvement means that I'll never run out of things to work on, and you can have this too. I have seen the dramatic effects of my methods on private students on numerous occasions and it is my aim to achieve a global reach that would be impossible for me as a single individual.

The Goal

I'm aiming to make this DVD as informative as possible. Production values will be at the highest possible level but the intention is to make the end product long on substance without being fixated on style and image. There is no contingency for 'photo shoots' in this campaign for instance.

In order to take raw footage and edit it into a coherent sequence of between 2 and 4 hours duration, together with manufacturing costs, DVD artwork, plus all contingencies and sundry expenses, the target has been set at 5000 GBP.

In the event that the target is significantly surpassed, the scope of the production will be expanded to feature performance examples with musician colleagues from my three bands; The Pete Cater Big Band, The Ministry of Jazz, and The Organisation.

Global Reach

The videos on this page include two parts of a series of four produced in 2015 in association with Rhythm magazine. These videos prompted a huge response, requests for private lessons and clinic/masterclass appearances, as well as all sorts of questions about all manner of drum concepts relating to both hand technique and musical applications. All these questions I will endeavour to answer in the dvd. These videos are shared here in order to give an insight into the style of presentation and method of delivery. 

The aim is to make every drummer play better; to demistify and simplify much of what we do. With so much material available these days, be it audio visual or good old fashioned printed words it can be easy for aspiring players to feel overwhelmed by the amount of knowledge that is seemingly a prerequisite of the contemporary drummer. Stand by to see a few myths get busted!

Through Indiegogo's InDemand feature plans are also in place for further projects including a 'big band minus drums' package featuring some legendary and challenging music as well as recording, performance and educational projects featuring The Pete Cater Big Band, The Ministry of Jazz and The Organisation.

 

Thank you

Every contribution counts and helps. Whatever you feel able to pledge all makes a difference. Also I won't be annoying you with unsolicited and needy emails, private messages or texts. I look forward to making this happen with your help. Thanks.

Pete Cater (Feb 26, 2017)

story:
‘Take Me to Paisley’ DEBUT ALBUM by HANNA OGREN! 

 

WE DID IT!!!! U GUYS, WE DID IT!!!

I'm so very happy and grateful. Thank u to each and everyone of u who contributed, whether it was financially or by supporting me in other ways...U know who u all are  I'm so happy I will be able to finish this album and ecstatic about the fact that u will all get what u ordered. I will do my absolute best to make the album of my (and your) dreams! 

 

Svensk text hittar du lite längre ner på sidan!

Family, friends and Purple Fam! I'm ready to record my debut album and I am over the moon excited! The album  is called ‘Take Me to Paisley’ and even though it is highly inspired by my trip to Paisley Park and Minneapolis back in April 2018, it will also show my heritage and that mystical Swedish melancholy.

When I visited Prince’ home and studio complex I was not allowed to bring a camera (they have since changed the rules a bit). I still wanted to gather all my impressions of the place; smells, colors, textures and different items...I decided to take a notebook with me to collect everything I experienced. That turned out to be a really good decision, because when I returned back home to Sweden I could open up that notebook and it would take me right back. 

This album is based on those experiences and my hope for this is that whether you have been to Paisley or not, it will still hold elements that resonate within & move you. It’s an album about Love4OneAnother!

UPDATE!

It has come to my attention that some of u have experienced a little bit of either technical issues or lack of payment methods for the pre orders of my album. I really do not want that to be an obstacle and that's why I've decided to set up another system. If u feel more comfortable using PayPal u will be able to do that or if u live in Sweden u will also be able to use Swish. Please find instructions on how to order below:

In both cases, firstly check out the different perks to find what option u would like to go for, then send an email with full name, home address, phone no and the perk u've chosen. Once u have sent me the full amount of your order, I will enter all your details onto Indiegogo and u will recieve a confirmation email of your order.

Email: info@takemetopaisley.com

PayPal: paypal.me/takemetopaisley

Swish: 0735291766

I really do hope this will help! Please let me know if u have any questions.

 

‘TAKE ME TO PAISLEY’ COST BREAKDOWN:

This is a purple family project. It’s done with the help of the purple community and I am so very grateful for that. Our community holds so many talented and professional artists, musicians and other creatives and I really want to make sure they get treated fairly. I'm an independent artist without the backing of a label or record company and that’s why I've decided to do a crowdfunding campaign through INDIEGOGO where people can pre-order the album and receive other perks to help fund the record.

The budget for this project is €6,000.00. This includes:

- Producer fees

-Album photography, cover art & graphics.

-Marketing & branding.

-Physical CD and merch printing & distribution.

-INDIEGOGO service fee (INDIEGOGO takes a cut from the overall amount).

 

RECORDING:

The recording of the album has already begun. Thanks to the internet I can record vocals from Sweden and the production can take place anywhere in the world. So cool right!?

 

ALBUM PRE-ORDER & PERKS:

Whatever you decide to pledge, you will receive a digital copy of the album before the actual release date. If you’d like to contribute more, there are other perks you can check out. These include:

-Signed Physical CD

-Exclusive ‘I bleed purple’ t-shirt 

-Handwritten lyrics of ‘Take Me to Paisley’

-Your own ‘Kitchen a cappella’ dedicated to you

-Tickets to the online release party

-Mentioned by name in album credits

-Be credited as an Executive Producer for sponsoring a particular song of your choice

 

I REALLY CAN'T AFFORD TO PLEDGE RIGHT NOW, WHAT ELSE CAN I DO TO HELP?

Just you being here and you cheering me on means everything to me! If you're unable to pledge at this time, please consider these other ways you can spread the word or support my music:

*Share this campaign on your Instagram, Facebook or other social media channels! (Make sure to use the INDIEGOGO share tools!)

*Follow me on Instagram at @hannaogrenpurplemusic & tag me when sharing the campaign.

*Follow me on Facebook here: https://www.facebook.com/hannaogrenpurplemusic & tag me when sharing the campaign.

If you have any questions, please send an email to info@takemetopaisley.com

 

LOVE 4 ONE ANOTHER!

Thank you so much for supporting me and my musical journey. It means the world to me and just the thought of you pre-ordering my debut album makes my heart tingle!

NOW LET’S GO DO THIS TOGETHER! :) Love4OneAnother / Hanna

 

SVENSKA

Hej alla vänner, bekanta och familj! Jag har äntligen kommit till den punkt att jag ska spela in min debutplatta. Det känns så fantastiskt roligt! Jag har fått kontakt med flera olika producenter runt om i världen som via internet kommer hjälpa mig färdigställa musiken. Jag gör detta helt utan hjälp av skivbolag och det är där ni kommer in i bilden. Ni kan hjälpa mig genom att förbeställa skivan, ni hittar alla alternativ under det som kallas "perks". Jag har 30 dagar på mig att samla in HELA summan...det är allt eller inget som gäller! Så snälla vänta inte med att köpa skivan sen när den kommer ut, hjälp mig istället att se till att den blir verklighet :)

Såhär gör du för att beställa:

  • Välj bland de olika nivåerna med diverse bonusgrejer, t ex signerad CD, handskrivna texter, exekutiv producent för en sång mm.
  • Klicka på 'Get this perk'
  • Fyll i dina uppgifter
  • Kika igenom ditt bidrag och om du är nöjd, klicka på 'agree to terms' och sen 'Submit payment'
  • Klart!
  • Har du några frågor, tveka inte att höra av dig till info@takemetopaisley.com

 

Det här är verkligen min dröm som håller på att gå i uppfyllelse och jag är så glad att just du är här och läser detta nu! Tack, tack, tack!! / Hanna

Kika igenom ditt bidrag och om du är nöjd, klicka på 'agree to terms' och sen 'Submit payment'
Klart!
Har du några frågor, tveka inte att höra av dig till info@takemetopaisley.com

 Det här är verkligen min dröm som håller på att gå i uppfyllelse och jag är så glad att just du är här och läser detta nu! Tack, tack, tack!! / Hanna

story:
OCTOBER RAGE - INDIE GO GO

Welcome to October Rage's Indie Go Go campaign page! In case you're not yet aware, we are a rock band from Australia currently on tour in the United States. We've had multiple releases, including a full length album and our latest single, White Walkers, and have shared the stage with some of the biggest bands in the world, including Bon Jovi, Sevendust, Steel Panther and Saliva.

Indie Go Go is a fundraising platform where artists can raise funds for tours, albums, etc... and fans can contribute by getting what is called "perks" e.g rewards for supporting their favorite artists.

October Rage's campaign is dedicated to raising enough funds to keep our tour going so we can reach every corner of the world where you, the fans, want to see us play. By contributing to October Rage's cause, you can become a HUGE part of our history and join us on our journey!


THE DETAILS

The money generated from our campaign will mainly go towards funding tour expenses - gas, equipment, food, travel expenses, (recording a new song or two perhaps?), as well as mailing out all those "perks".

"Perks" are what you receive as a reward for your support. The bigger your donation, the larger the rewards. If you don't have that much cash, don't worry. Every little bit helps and is fully appreciated. For instance, for a small donation you can get every single song October Rage has ever released delivered digitally straight to your email. For larger donations, you can get anything from your own private house concert to a signed guitar that was actually used to record the album!

 

YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL MAKE A HUGE DIFFERENCE, HERE'S HOW:

* We are currently making a huge dent in the music industry and building a lot of momentum. With the funds raised we can continue our winning streak and bring the music directly to the fans.

* October Rage has no record label - every last bit of funding goes straight into funding the tour and creating new music!

* We love playing shows - the more funds we raise, the more we can keep touring and bring our show to your town!

Other ways you can help:

We know that not everyone can contribute, the economy is horrible and funds are tight sometimes. That doesn't mean you can't be a part of this, however. Be a member of our street team and get the word out about this project!

There are many share tools on this very website you can use to let your friends, family and even strangers know about October Rage and the campaign.

www.octoberrage.com

www.facebook.com/octoberrage

www.youtube.com/octoberragetv


Thank you so much!! We can't do this without you!

Rock On

October Rage

Nick, Will, JB, and Alan

story:
Short Summary

My name is Will Corbin, I am a musician in Bangkok, Thailand.  I have been performing for a few years now, and was named the Ukulele Champion of Thailand 2011 with my musical colleague, Kitti Bronco.  I, along with a handful of talented musicians and artists who are taking part, am in the process of producing a music project entitled "Au Contraire."

Au Contraire is a multi-genre project, but mostly tends to center on elements of Folk and Jazz.  This is a project I am taking on with Pacifico music with producer Paul Romaine, who is a musical genius and very dedicated to his craft.

Au Contraire is a chance for myself and the musicians taking part to be heard, and to create something meaningful and timeless.  I also have two photographers and an animator who will be creating related artistic work to accompany the music, so this is also a chance for their art to be represented.

We have the musicians, the songs, the direction, and we have the heart - all we are missing is the funding! With your help, we can have the chance to shine.

 

 

We have set our goal at 2,500 USD.  This encompasses the costs of producing the songs in the studio, commissioning of the various artists involved (an artist should receive compensation for their time and effort) and cutting the album.

Every donation counts, and we will recognize you and give you credit on our album and on our videos! No matter what amount you decide to give we will be one step closer to completing our work.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, it's fine!  But you can still help us by sharing this project, and our music with your friends!

story:
Short Summary

We founded New Millennium Orchestra in 2005 because we are incredibly passionate about sharing the power of classical music through innovative programming…and happened to have an orchestra's worth of amazingly talented friends. Watch the video above to learn more about our story, and to hear the results of all of our hard work. Each year we've grown in our ability to present programs on our own initiative. This year we've chosen to produce Der Kaiser Von Atlantis because we believe that audiences will be moved and inspired by hearing a rarely performed opera written under the most extreme circumstances. Kaiser will be shown in workshop March 8-10 on the City of Chicago's Department of Cultural Affairs and Special Events' series "In The Works", a series that takes place behind the closed glass doors of the incredible stage of the Jay Pritzker Pavilion at Chicago's Millennium Park.

Viktor Ullmann's opera was written in 1943 at the concentration camp Theresienstadt (Terezín) using a libretto by Peter Kien. A hopeful parable influenced by Weill, Mahler, and Berg, the chamber opera was rehearsed but never performed; the Nazis saw the Kaiser as a Hitler satire, and both Ullmann and Kien were sent to certain doom at Auschwitz. At Theresienstadt, Ullman wrote, "we simply did not sit and lament...that our will for culture was not sufficient to our will to exist...all who have worked in life and art to wrestle content into its unyielding form will say that I was right..."

What We Need & What You Get

George Bernard Shaw said that opera was ‘the most expensive invention of man, second only to war.’ Putting on an opera without fundraising staff, or a large endowment, would be impossible for most-- for us, it's the next logical step. These three performances will be directed by Joanie Schultz and conducted by Francesco Milioto-- the last time we all collaborated, we received rave reviews like:

"Kudos to director Joanie Schultz for an inspired under-the-dome staging that manages to be gently satiric without entirely sacrificing the deeper emotions. Add a superb cast of fine young voices and idiomatic musical backing from conductor Francesco Milioto and the New Millennium Orchestra and it all adds up to a witty, delightful retooling of Acis and Galatea." -Lawrence A. Johnson, Chicago Classical Review

We have some great perks to thank you for your donation. Each person who donates will be named in the Kaiser program. We have VIP tickets to the show. We have an exclusive afterwork cocktail party with the Kaiser cast, conductor, and director in March where you can meet the artists while enjoying wine and hors d'oevres. We are offering two different private concert options showcasing our talented conductor and orchestra members. And finally we're offering our largest donor the chance to make a night of it at the Radisson Blu Aqua as our guest after the show.

Our ensemble spends over ninety percent of our annual budget on our artists, and we make only 5% of our yearly budget from ticket sales (it used to be mostly for-hire before regional presenter's budgets shrank drastically) which means we have to make up the rest with grants and donations. We choose to keep our ticket prices low because we want our performances to be affordable to most people-- in fact, for this, and many of our past productions, tickets are free to the public.

We're trying to achieve $20,000 in donations from this campaign. If we reach this goal, not only will this production occur, but making a recording and planning an entire 2013/14 season will become feasible. Over 700 people will be reached by this appearance, adding to the thousands of citizens we've reached over the last eight years. If we don't make our goal, we won't be able to continue to expand this impact even further, and continue to rise on our trajectory that has recently included performances at Orchestra Hall and the Harris Theater.

 

The Impact

Your support not only helps the New Millennium Orchestra put on this show, it means that our ensemble will be able to plan, make, and document future shows. This is how we will progress down the road-map to sustainability and avoid the catch-22 of nascent arts organizations. Previous productions in partnership with the Chicago Cultural Center garnered critical acclaim in both the Chicago Classical Review, Chicago Sun Times, and the Chicago Tribune. This project, along with our future work, will be fantastic. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to help us besides donating money:
• Volunteer. Opera and orchestras require a lot of time and a lot of people. Tell us about your skills and interests, we always need more help!
• Even if you can't donate right now you can still help us by spreading the word about our campaign.  Share this link with your friends => http://igg.me/p/262956/x/1669974 on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media.

 Ask your friends to do the same. A personal ask always works best.  Whether you are a long-time member of our Chicago music community or a brand new fan, tell people how this kind of work moves you and why you are encouraging them to support us.  Help us help ourselves and share in the wealth of music and culture that NMO shares with you.

story:
Short Summary

Internationally acclaimed Sacred Earth and Healing Arts of Tibet Tour is coming to Aspen!!!

- - July 29th - August 4th - -

First invited to the Roaring Fork Valley by John Denver's Windstar Foundation, the Tibetan Monks from the historic Gaden Shartse Monastery were first sent on tour by His Holliness the Dalai Lama to preserve their culture about 30 years ago.  

It is important for our valley as a whole to receive the peace, clearing, and support the Monks provide.  They will  offer healings, teachings, and fun cultural events for all ages.   Your donations will help make these programs possible!  The money provided goes directly to support their monestary in India. 

Their housing, office space, and dining is donated by the open hearts of Aspen, and we thank you!  

If you are interested in donating, volunteering, or participating, please call Yva-Marie at (970) 401-3233.

  

Purpose of the Tours

The purpose of the GadenShartse tour is to share with all people the Tibetan culture, as well as practices and paths to inner peace and compassion.  Accomplishments of previous tours have provided funds for construction of new buildings at Gaden Shartse, including the new debate hall.


Additional funds raised by past tours have supported medical needs, teachers’ salaries and the day to day expenses of supporting the monastery. This success is due to the help and generosity of those who support the tours.


The monks of Gaden Shartse feel deeply indebted to their friends in the West who have given their time, effort, and homes to make the tours possible. It is hoped that the upcoming tour will be a success.

Funds raised from the tours will also help finance the new guest house which has been constructed with the purpose of making guests and visitors from the west more comfortable. The guest house offers western amenities such as private rooms and bathrooms and western meals.

 

“Shartse” Today

In-depth education in all aspects of Buddhist philosophy and practice is the focal point of the academic program at Shartse. The duration of the monastic program is 24 years. The students interact with their teachers on a daily basis. Accommodation, food, and instruction are all free and are provided by the monastic administration. Shartse offers complete basic courses in Tibetan History, Literature, Poetry, Grammar, English, and Mathematics, which are studied as prerequisites for the more advanced courses of Elementary Dialectics, Buddhist Logic, the Prajnaparamita (the study of Wisdom/ the Heart Sutra), Madhyamika Philosophy, Vinaya (Ethics), and Abidharma (Epistemology). All sand mandala takes 4-6 days to complete. Under certain circumstances a shorter version may be offered.

Unique to Shartse is the compulsory study of Buddhist Tantra. Additionally, there are optional subjects such as Painting, Calligraphy, Tailoring, Tibetan Butter Sculpture formation, and Sand mandala creation. The training program also encourages its students to independently pursue and practice profound Buddhist rituals and to complete extensive solitary retreats.

The Monastery hosts multiple festivals, seminars and inter-monastic philosophical meetings. The Monastery also encourages active fieldwork. All members sixteen and older are given fieldwork assignments for four months of every year, during which time they are required to contribute to the day-to-day running of the monastery. Such co-operative jobs include secretarial office work, cooking, milking the cows, clinic management, and general maintenance. The Monastery also hires some of the local Indian residents to assist with construction and farm work, thus contributing financially to the local economy.

Shartse has a staff of twenty, sixteen of whom are teachers and four of whom oversee the proper administration of the programs. Aside from the two English language and mathematics teachers who are recruited from outside the monastery, every member of the staff has graduated from the Monastery.

They teach an average of seven hours a day and offer private instruction from their own living quarters.  For more than twenty years they have provided this service free of charge. Only recently did the New Educational Development Project begin to offer them a token remuneration of the equivalent of US $4.00 each month.

Teachers play a very special role in the lives of their students. As is the Tibetan tradition, and also due to the early age at which many youths leave their families to join the Monastery, students admire and respect their teachers as they would their parents.  Teachers are considered to be the source of both the academic and the spiritual development of their students.

Following the democratic constitution promulgated by His Holiness the Dalai Lama in 1964, all Tibetan institutions now function as parts of a democratic government. Although privately administered, the College is also administered on an election basis.  There are eight board members who are elected as directors every three years. The President of the College, however, is appointed directly by the Office of His Holiness the Dalai Lama, as was done in pre-invasion Tibet.

A world tour by members of Shartse in 1988 enabled the administration to begin the new Education Development Project. This interagency body now monitors all educational development and makes suggestions regarding the necessity of improvements and modernization.  Additionally, a few senior students are elected to oversee a library at the Monastery that is open to both students and non-students.

With a modest collection of important Tibetan works and Western works of philosophy, the library is accessible, free of charge. In order to feed, house, clothe, and provide study materials for each monk, it costs just over US$1 per day per monk. For 1600 monks, this amounts to close to US$1700 per day, or approximately US$600,000 per year. This expense is for the most basic necessities and does not cover the costs of building maintenance, construction, farming, or improvements.

Maintenance is the most costly aspect of running Gaden Shartse Monastic College. The original 84 acres of farmland that was allocated to the monks in 1969 was done so as a lease, and this land provides the bulk of the Monastery's income.  

The main source of income for the Monastery comes from the sale of rice grown on the leased farmland. Even in the most profitable year, the yearly revenue from the crops can only cover one month of the expenses of the Monastery. With this acute shortfall in cash, short-term loans are arranged from time to time. Unlike other active educational centers of its size in India, Shartse does not receive any government funding from India or abroad.  Thus the need to meet the financial obligations of the Monastery is urgent. There are very limited and unreliable sources of income, and the majority of revenue comes from tours abroad.
